Necifora owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Necifora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Sexto ciclo y todas las integrantes se encuentran satisfechas con el trabajo que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Ramona M. tiene 50 años con  2 hijas  señorita, una de ellas también participa del comité.
La Sra.  Ramona se dedica a dos actividades una de ellas es la venta de ropas de segunda mano y la otra es la  confección y venta de lencería.
La ropas las ofrece en su salón de ventas y  las  confecciona de lencería   vende los  fines de semana visitando locales comerciales con su hija.
 Es una señora muy guapa y le gusta lo que hace y agradece por el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación por el crédito que se le otorga.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropas de segunda mano.
En el futuro desea ampliar su salón  para su taller de costura, por ende ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo y dice que si uno procura por sus metas se puede lograr el objetivo .
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” (“Fighting Women”) group is in its sixth loan cycle and all of its members are satisfied with each other's work. One of the group's members is Ramona M.. Ramona is 50 years old and has two daughters, one of whom is also in the group. Ramona has two businesses. She sells used clothing from her shop, and she makes lingerie which she and her daughter sell on the weekends by visiting local businesses. Ramona is a very beautiful woman and she likes what she does. She is grateful for the support of the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya. She will use this loan to purchase bundles of used clothing. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and sewing studio, and so she puts a lot of effort into her work. She says that if you work hard you can achieve your goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of San Isidro, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating jeepney transport services. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the engine of her jeepney. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the engine of her jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For plowing the field, hoeing and the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Enerika

texts.en: Enerika S. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock ful beans (fava beans), a local Sudanese type of bean, to cook and sell. Enerika is 50 years old and is married to a retired soldier. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock ful beans, a local Sudanese type of bean, to cook and sell

loans.name: Heydi Del Socorro

texts.es: Heydi Del Socorro tiene 31 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio en un cyber. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está pensando en mejorar para el bienestar de su familia, ella siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que tiene que hacerse cargo. Para en el futuro ella desea incrementar su negocio, estableciendo nuevas computadoras para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de computadoras, teclados y accesorios para computadora.
texts.en:
Heydi Del Socorro is 31 years old and offers Internet services at her cybercafé. She has been in business for more than 15 years and is always thinking about making improvements for the welfare of her family. Heydi has always been a very responsible mother who enjoys running her business. She has a young child who is under her care.

In the future, she wants to expand her business by setting up new computers for her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy computers, keyboards, and computer accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers, keyboards, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase a stereo

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn S., 53, is married to Ou Chorn, 52, and the couple earn a living by cultivating crops. They currently have six children, two of whom are married and live separately, while the other four are single. In addition to their farming work, Vorn S. produces cakes to sell to her nearby villagers, who eat them as a snack food. The coming rainy season is good for growing. However, Vorn S. doesn’t have any farming supplies to use on her field. Thus, she has asked for a loan to use towards buying fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting.

loans.use: To use towards buying fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
F. Umedjon is 33 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Umedjon the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting wheat, onions, watermelon and rice. 

Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market. That is the motivation to continue planting. At the same time Umedjon raises cattle. 

This is the 9th loan that Umedjon has with IMON International, making his payments on time. He is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, Umedjon will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, and also cattle.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, cattle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M., 46, is a professional silk weaver, making US$ 2 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US$ 5 every day, selling furniture. Sok M. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more furniture for resale.

loans.use: purchase furniture to resell

loans.name: Sèbessé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sèbessé est composé de quatre célibataires sans enfant vivant toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 20 ans. Elles habitent le quartier Médine Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente du savon, riz, fruits, tubercules et légumes (concombre, patate, igname, banane et pomme de terre). 
Dans le but de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire.
 Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 cartons de savon au grand marché de Ségou en gros. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché de Médine Ségou en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, s’entretenir et constituer petit à petit son trousseau de mariage. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son petit commerce dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sèbessé group is made up of four single and childless women, who all live in large traditional families. They average 20 years of age. They live in the Médine district of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and met each other through their income generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou.

The members of this group buy and sell soap, rice, fruit, tubers and vegetables (cucumber, yams, bananas and potatoes). In order to diversify the goods that they sell they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fifth group loan.

Miss Djènèbou S. is planning on using her loan to buy 20 cartons of soap wholesale at the market in Ségou. She resells on a retail basis for cash and on credit, walking through the various districts and at the Médine Ségou market, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan, Miss S. is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to save, to look after herself and to build up her marriage trousseau. In common with the other members of the group, her goal is to increase her business volume through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jose de Jesus M. D., es un adulto mayor, de 61 años que habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad, que sobreviven independientemente, ellos son agricultores desde hace 21 años, los cuales se han enfrentado a plagas y sequia que desfavorecen las cosechas y afectan a su economía, a futuro espera contar con el capital necesario para diversificar sus cultivos, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas, que permitan una mantenimiento fitosanitario en apoyo a sus terrenos, y de esta forma a corto plazo recuperar lo invertido, y la mejora continua de sus niveles de vida y la de su pequeña familia. Ellos son una humilde pareja que no cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, por la limitación de trabajo que no les permite apoyar a sus padres. esta no es la primera vez que se apoya a esta familia, ellos son muy responsables y se sus condiciones economicas han mejorado para bien estos ultimos años
texts.en: Mr. Jose de Jesus M. D., is an adult of 61 years old who lives with his life partner. They have 2 grown children who live on their own. They have worked in agriculture for 21 years, and have faced plagues and drought that work against the harvest and affect them financially. In the future he hopes to have the capital necessary to diversify his crops. For now his is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and agricultural supplies that will allow him to maintain the health of his plants and help his lands. In this way he hopes to recover the investment in a short time and continue improving their living standards and that of his small family. They are a humble pair that don't have the help of their children due to work constraints that don't allow them to help their parents. This is not the first time that we have helped this family. They are very responsible and already their economic conditions have improved these last couple years.

loans.use: To maintain plant health.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso Y. T. tiene 36 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Alfonso pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Alfonso se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y comprar terrenos.
Le gustaría que el crédito sea el monto más alto.
texts.en:
Alfonso Y. T. is 36 years old. He is married an lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar. He has 5 children. 

Alfonso belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba bank, located a half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that is dedicated to agriculture and dairy cattle and pigs. This bank has 20 members. 

Alfonso grow corn, wheat, potatoes and raises dairy cows. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market of the same city.  

He is asking for the loan to buy materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes as well as animals to fatten up and later sell. The support of this loan will help him financially to meet his family's needs.  His dream is to be able to buy a house and land. He would like the loan to be the highest amount.

loans.use: Materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes, as well as animals.

loans.name: Francisco Filadelfo

texts.es: Francisco Filadelfo tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este medio de vida, el es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo que vive con esposa pues el sale a vender todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, pues tiene ciertos clientes que visitar ya que siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos y el busca la manera de cómo complacerlos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, cosmeticos y calzado necesaria ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en:
Francisco Filadelfo, 23, sells general merchandise.  He’s had this means of support for 12 years.  He is a very hard working man and has a minor son in his care that lives with his wife because he goes out to sell every day from 5am until 10pm; he has customers to see who are always asking for different products and he seeks ways to satisfy them.

This loan will be used to buy needed merchandise like clothes, cosmetics and footwear because a good season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Kitinda Traders Group

texts.en: Kandi N. is a member of the Kitinda Traders group. He is 40 years old, married, and has 14 children.  Kandi has a retail shop business where he sells posho, sugar, soap, and more for a profit. He has been in the business for 20 years and he acquired his start-up capital from agriculture after advice from a friend. He is a social and hard-working man who wants his children to have the best in life. Kandi also has a boda boda business; he is a farmer and he sells produce to earn additional income. He is requesting a loan to be able to expand his business by restocking his retail shop with general merchandise.

loans.use: To restock his shop with general merchandise

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El Sr. Dámaso  tiene 48 años de edad, casado y tiene 4 hijos; dos  en edad escolar y dos son  mayores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañía Espartillar.
    	 Don Dámaso  trabajó  como empleado de un Surtidor por mas de  7  años  y  de a poco  fue adquiriendo capital y así  pudo  comprar mercaderías para iniciarse como vendedor ambulante,  recorre por las ciudades  de Alto Paraná ofreciendo  y colocando  productos de primera calidad.
                 Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas).Este mes tiene muchos pedidos y con un pequeño apoyo podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dámaso is 48 years old.  He is married and has four children: two are school age and two are grown up.  He lives in the city of Carapeguá, in the Espartillar residential development.

Dámasco used to work as an employee in a gas station for more than 7 years.  He gradually gathered together some capital and was able to buy merchandise and set himself up as an itinerant street vendor.  He sells his products on the streets of Alto Paraná, offering top quality products.

Dámaso is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, woven belts and sheets).  This month he has a lot of orders and with a little support he will be able to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 58 años, enviudo hace 2 años, y confiesa que aún se siente triste por ello, pero el apoyo constante que recibe D. sus 3 hijos, la motiva. Ella vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad D. San Ramón (selva central peruana). La alegría que muestra está mujer es reflejo del constante apoyo que recibe D. parte D. sus hijos, los que construyeron sus casas alrededor D. ella para poder cuidarla. El trabajo al que se dedica Elena, es la venta D. comestibles, verduras y frutas, los cuales venD. en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto, pero como exitosa mujer cuenta, que no solo a ello se dedica, pues tiene un negocio D. venta D. café y  miel, productos que lo consigue en la ciudad D. Perene, donD. viaja constantemente, para luego comercializarlo en la capital del país. Pero las fuerzas D. Elena, es sorprendente, ya que también siembra papa en la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. viaja en cada cosecha. Sin embargo es conciente D. su avanzada edad, por ello desea comprar una máquina D. tejer chompas D. lana, los cuales piensa vender en la ciudad D. Huancayo y La Oroya. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz D. pertenecer a su banco comunal, que según sus propias palabras “son como su familia”. D. adquirir el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos necesarios para invertirlo en su tienda D. abarrotes, y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en su próxima siembra D. papa.
texts.en: 58-year-old Elena is a widow of two years. She is still sad about his death, but the constant support she receives from her 3 children motivates her. She lives alone in her own home in the city of San Ramón (in the central Peruvian rainforest). The happiness she shows is a reflection of the support she receives from her children, who built their houses around her so they could look after her. Elena makes a living selling food, vegetables and fruits, from a little space set up in her home. She has been at this business for 4 years, but as this successful woman tells us, she also has a business selling coffee and honey. She gets these products in the city of Perene, where she travels constantly, and then sells them in the country’s capital. Elena’s strengths are surprising because she also grows potatoes in the city of Tarma, where she travels every harvest season. She is, however, aware of her advanced age, which is why she would like to buy a knitting machine to make sweaters to sell in the city of Huancayo and La Oroya. This is her eighth MFP loan, and she is happy belonging to her communal bank, which, in her own words, “is like family.” Once she gets the requested loan, she will use it to buy supplies for her grocery shop and if she makes any extra money she will spend it on growing potatoes.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items and to invest in growing potatoes

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old. He is married and has 5 children.

Akil has a good experience in commerce. He owns a food market. He is becoming well known in the market and has a good reputation.

He is requesting $3000 to renovate his store and expand the inventory. He is aiming to grow his shop so it is bigger in the future. This will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Renovate his store and expand the inventory

loans.name: Turyasiima

texts.en: Turyasiima E. is a client from Rukungiri. He is 34 years old and married with 5 children. E. has an agricultural business, selling his crops such as matooke (green plantain), Irish potatoes and maize to his customers in Mabungo. He works with his wife and both of them are trustworthy people. He is able to get 140,000 UGX as weekly profits since he is also involved in the sale of coffee to individual clients and coffee factories. He is very hard working and needs a loan to be able to improve his agricultural farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Chiziwi

texts.en:
Chiziwi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Kikois-selling business from home for the past two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Chiziwi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Salde, who is 44 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 10 and 18 years old. Vivian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 29 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vivian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 30th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Vivian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Adela Catalina

texts.es:
Adela de 48 años, tiene un negocio de venta de comidas. Empezó con el negocio de comida hace 6 años atrás, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar sillas y mesas. Ahora ella tiene un puesto en el Guasmo, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, como arroz con pollo, arroz con menestra etc. 

Ella comprar con el préstamo  arroz y aceite para hacer mas comidas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa que ahora es de caña para ubicar hay un local de comida.
texts.en:
48 year-old Adela has a business selling meals.  She started her business 6 years ago and gradually, with effort, she was able to buy tables and chairs.  She now has a stall in Guasmo where she sells traditional Ecuadoran dishes such as rice with chicken, rice with mixed vegetables, etc.

Adela will use her loan to buy rice and oil to make her meals.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house, which is currently made from cane, in order to create premises there for selling her meals.

loans.use: to buy tables, rice and oil

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia Martínez de 34 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 15 años,  en Ciudad Bicentenario, uno de los escenarios de Sueños y oportunidades:  Programa de vivienda y desarrollo integral de comunidades sostenibles,  liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora que inició su negocio  de vender mercancía variada cuando vivía en otro barrió y fue trasladada a esta comunidad por agrietamiento de su vivienda;   en Ciudad Bicentenario  emprendió nuevamente su actividad, integrada ahora por sus antiguos clientes y sus nuevos vecinos; en este negocio de nombre “Variedades Yanny”, ella comercializa mercancías de consumo comunitario,  como mochilas,  ajuar de para damas y todo en bisutería, estos últimos productos elaborados con sus propias manos, mientras la mercancias las compra a un buen precio para vender a crédito y de contado. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará materiales e insumos para elaborar collares, aretes, tobilleras y también comprará cosméticos, mochilas y vestidos. Su sueño es adicionar nuevos estantes y vitrinas y surtirlos con mucho productos solicitados por la comunidad   y con los que muchas veces no tiene en existencia; así mismo trabajará mucho con su cónyuge,  para lograr la meta de educar a sus hijos porque su máximo desafío, es ayudarlos a que sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en: Patricia Martínez is 34 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children, who are between 8 and 15 years old. They live in the City of Bicentenario, one of the places of Dreams and Opportunities, an integral housing and development program for sustainable communities, led by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation (Kiva’s field partner). She is a vey enterprising woman that began her business of selling various merchandize when she lived in another neighborhood and was transferred to this community because of cracks in her home. In Bicentenario she began her work once more, with old customers and new neighbors, with her business called “Variedades Yanny.” Patricia sells her merchandize for the consumption of the community by selling backpacks, trousseaus and everything pertaining to costume jewelry (which she handcrafts herself) while the merchandize is bought at a good price to be sold on credit and cash. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation; she will buy materials to make necklaces, earrings, anklets as well as makeup, backpacks, and dresses. Her dream is to add new shelves and display cases and fill them with many products needed by the community which many times she does not have. She will work hard with her partner in meeting her goal of educating their children because that is their main objective, to help them become successful professionals.

loans.use: buy materials to make necklaces, earrings, anklets as well as makeup, backpacks, and dresses

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJAMADJIGUI est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. Avec l’idée d’améliorer leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’articles divers, des céréales et du miel. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. Avec ce prêt Fanta D.  compte acheter 100 litres miel avec les paysans de DIOUTIEBOUGOU et environnants pour les revendre ensuite en gros et en détail, au comptant et à crédit sur le marché BOUGOUNI. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de  25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The group DJAMADJIGUI is composed of married women who average 32 years of age and four children each. The women live in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husband, and they reside in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU, in the prefecture of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through business ties. With the idea of improving their buying power, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for doing commerce in a variety of goods, grains, and honey. The group members are on their sixth group loan. The previous ones have been fully repaid.

With her loan, Fanta D. intends to buy 100 liters of honey from peasant farmers in and around DIOUTIEBOUGOU to be sold wholesale and retail, cash or credit accepted, at the BOUGOUNI market. The customer base comprises women and men.

Using this loan, the women hope to obtain a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to care for their children.

loans.use: to buy honey

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past five years, she has operated a business selling cashew nuts from home to her neighbors. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of competition from other cashew nut sellers in the market. She dreams of becoming known as a reliable seller in the market.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she is requesting, Mwanamisi wants to purchase 10 sacks of cashew nuts for resale. Mwanamisi decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa est homme marié de 38 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Monsieur Moussa a abandonné l’école dés son âge. Il a tenté pendant des années, différentes activités, mais sans succès. Il finit par la suite, opter,  apprendre auprès de son ami la vente de carburants, d’intrants agricoles, d'insecticides et la pulvérisation des champs et bâtiments. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité. Son magasin est situé au abords de la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.
Moussa compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 tonnes d’engrais et des cartons d’insecticides. En effet les engrais sont destinés à la vente et une partie des insecticides sera également vendue et l'autre partie utilisée dans le cadre de ses prestation de services de pulvérisation de bâtiments etc. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000FCFA. Il compte utiliser son bénéfice pour améliorer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa S. is a 38 year-old married man and a father of one. He lives with his wife and child in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.
Mr. Moussa S. quit school early. He attempted different activities throughout the years, but was unsuccessful. He finally decided to learn from his friend how to sell fuel, agricultural supplies and to spray fields and buildings. With ten years of experience, he is highly qualified in his business. His store is located by the road connecting Bougouni to Sikasso.
In order to answer the demand of his growing customer base, he joined Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second loan with them; the first one has been paid back on time.
With his loan, Moussa intends to purchase 5 tons of fertilizer and boxes of insecticide for spraying.
He gets his supplies in Bougouni from wholesalers, and his client base his composed of the local population.
He intends to make a monthly profit of 55,000 CFA. He is planning on using his benefit to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase various articles

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 66 años D. edad, vive con su esposo en el caserío Pueblo Libre ubicado en el distrito TambogranD. – Piura. La comunidad donD. Elena vive es pequeña y rural, D. condición baja y las principales actividades que se desarrollan dentro D. ella es la agricultura y ganadería. 

La actividad  a la que Elena se dedica, es la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, hace 2 campañas por mes y tiene una experiencia D. 5 años en este negocio. Recorre varios caseríos en los cuales deja sus productos y cobra en la quincena o fin D. mes. También se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.

Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia, en la cual siembra Mango y Limón, ambos cultivos en producción y bien conducidos.

Elena solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra D. cosméticos que se encuentran en oferta y que podrán ampliar su stock para lograr mayores ventas y por lo tanto más ganancias.

Elena es una cliente conocida para nuestra entidad, siendo este su segundo crédito, el anterior lo pago responsable y puntualmente.
texts.en:
Elena tiene 66 años D. edad, vive con su esposo en el caserío Pueblo Libre ubicado en el distrito TambogranD. – Piura. La comunidad donD. Elena vive es pequeña y rural, D. condición baja y las principales actividades que se desarrollan dentro D. ella es la agricultura y ganadería. 

La actividad  a la que Elena se dedica, es la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, hace 2 campañas por mes y tiene una experiencia D. 5 años en este negocio. Recorre varios caseríos en los cuales deja sus productos y cobra en la quincena o fin D. mes. También se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.

Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia, en la cual siembra Mango y Limón, ambos cultivos en producción y bien conducidos.

Elena solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra D. cosméticos que se encuentran en oferta y que podrán ampliar su stock para lograr mayores ventas y por lo tanto más ganancias.

Elena es una cliente conocida para nuestra entidad, siendo este su segundo crédito, el anterior lo pago responsable y puntualmente.

loans.use: Comprar productos en oferta y ampliar stock.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also cooks chapati (flat bread) and doughnuts for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a motorcycle for  business transport in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts, bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with his mother, wife and three children. He works as an engineer-mechanic at the local factory. Since the salaries are very low, making it impossible to sustain a family, Andranik also keeps cattle, has a battery farm and a fishery. Andranik also has six walnut trees, giving him additional income against the walnut sale. 

To cover the education fees of his children, as well as the family's daily costs, Andranik needs to expand his agro-business. He has applied for this loan to buy seeds for sowing. Andranik is going to cultivate land.

loans.use: to pay for seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominaron Mujeres  Emprendedoras de las Colinas esta conformado por vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Asunción. Todas ellas se organizaron y decidieron formarse. Actualmente cuenta con 16 integrantes, todas ellas manifiestan que están muy a gusto dentro del grupo.
Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Cuentan que lo que las llevo a unirse fue el deseo de que puedan llevar a sus casa mayores ingresos y así mejorar un poco su nivel de vida.
La Sra. Emma es una modista. Ella se dedica a esta profesión desde hace ya varios años, es muy conocida en su barrio y ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Dice que todo el trabajo que ella realiza es con miras a ayudar a sus familiares y así poder tener una mayor estabilidad económica.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos que utilizara en su profesión, como telas, hilos, sets de agujas y demás.
texts.en:
This committee is called 'Mujeres Emprendedoras de las Colinas' and it is made up of neighbors and friends from the city of Asunción.  The women got together and decided to form a group which currently has 16 members.  All of the members say that they are very happy to be part of the group.

The group's members describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women.  They say that what led them to come together and form a group was the desire that they had to make more income for their households and improve their standard of living a little.

Emma is a dressmaker.  She has been in this business for several years.  She is very well known in her neighborhood and has a well established customer base.  She says that she does all of her work with a view to helping her family members and creating more financial stability.

Emma is requesting this loan to buy supplies that she uses in her profession such as fabric, threads, needle sets and other products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais não lembra as respectivas  idades somente que todos são maiores de idade. Fez a 2ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras, quando perdeu os eu pai. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo,apenas mudou com a sua mãe para Boane quando perdeu o pai e vive la ate hoje. É negociante permanente ha 15 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 12.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de conversas com conhecidos que também são clientes desta instituição, e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, arroz, amendoim, cervejas, refrescos, vinhos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is single and the mother of five children.  She doesn’t remember their respective ages, only that all are adults.  She finished two years of schooling and stopped because of lack of money when she lost her father.  She lives in her own house with her family and maintains her mother who lives with her.  

She never left Maputo, she just moved with her mother to Boane when she lost her father and she has lived there since.  She has been working as a seller for 15 years and has a monthly salary of 12,000 (meticais) which she uses for household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

She has never taken out loans with other banks.  She heard about Hluvuku through conversations with acquaintances who are also customers of this institution and this is her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 25,000 meticais which she plans to use to buy products (oil, rice, peanuts, beer, soft drinks, liquors, and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.  

She dreams of finishing her building project and expanding her business; to do this she intends to request more loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products (oil, rice, peanuts, beer, soft drinks, liquors, and others).

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre Agripina, en compañía de ella, su hermano mayor Orlando y su sobrino Etson. Juntos habitan en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde muy joven ayudaba a sus padres en las largas faenas agrícolas y así aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra papa, alverja y maíz junto a su hermano, en las chacras de su madre. Le gusta la labor agrícola, pues dice que le gusta vigilar las tierras con dedicación, brindándoles los insumos necesarios para que produzcan productos de calidad. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha, contratan la ayuda de operarios, y de esta manera venden toda su producción a los mayoristas de la ciudad, quienes le pagan regulares precios, sobretodo por la alverja, que es una legumbre bastante cotizada en el mercado nacional. Como es un joven emprendedor para más adelante desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, ya que solo posee 2 y a veces alquila otros. Como joven lleno de ambiciones, desea también, abrir una tienda de fertilizantes en su ciudad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde estará muy agradecido con todas las personas que desean ayudarlo, pues le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Eduardo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales y guano de corral para comenzar su siembra de papa “única”donde espera obtener una producción de 20 sacos.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 23, lives at home with his mother, Agripina, his older brother, Orlando, and his nephew, Etson.  They live in the Cumutay rural community.  From a very early age he helped his parents with the long farm days and learned all about growing crops.  He now grows potatoes, peas and corn, together with his brother, on land that belongs to his mother. He enjoys his work and watching over the land with dedication, providing everything necessary to ensure a quality crop.  At harvest time he hires workers so he can sell all of his produce to wholesale distributors in the city.  They pay decent prices, especially for the peas, which can command a high price on the national market.  

Being the young entrepreneur that he is, in the future he wants to buy more farmland since he now has only two patches and sometimes rents others.  He is full of ambition and wants to open a fertilizer store in the city.  He belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is his fifth loan through MFP.  He is grateful to all the people who wish to help him, since it will allow him to continue working toward progress.  Eduardo plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer and  chicken waste fertilizer for the upcoming planting season of the "única" variety potato of which he hopes to produce 20 sacksfull.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of natural fertilizer and chicken waste fertilizer.

loans.name: Darin

texts.en: Darin, 62 years old, is a cake seller earning $4 per day for her income. She has three children, one is studying and the other two are working, earning $2.5 per day. Every month, she spends $50 on food, $27 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her children's travel to studying. She never wants to change her career because she is an expert in making cakes to sell and she can make a good income for her family. She hopes to send her children to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to studying.

loans.name: Atamurod

texts.ru: Атамурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он четыре года как занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того он работает в средней школе района, преподавателем. У него имеется высшее педагогическое образование. Он берет кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Atamurod lives in the Shahrituz.  He is 50 years, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Atamurod breeds livestock for future sale.  Besides this business, he works as a teacher at a district's secondary school.  He has a higher pedagogical education.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Quat's Group

texts.en:
Quat was born in Dai Bi village. She has two daughters who are going to school. Her husband is a guard. 

Mrs Quat has a shop in the market. She sells dresses and clothes. She has this job for 5 years. Her famiL. has an income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last time, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid punctualL.. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more new clothes and dresses to sell. She is the leader of a 5 member group in SEDA.
 
About other borrowers in her group:

Nghi is 39 years old. She is tailor. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.

T. is 55 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her store(to buy more cobbler supplies).

Dung is 45 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her small business.

Loc is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to business food available.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with five children — one girl and four boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish and coconuts selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing her own business premises in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her selling stall.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 36 years old and had been widowed for almost 17 years. She has one child attending in his third year college education. To provide a good education for her child, she is selling processed meat products such as pork sausages, fish, pork and chicken meat. She operates the business in a stall located at the public market.

She needs to offer more food products to meet all her customers demand for affordable and high quality of products she sells because there are many competitors in the market. She wants to improve her sales. She is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy cured pork, sausages, hot-dogs, fish and chicken meat to sell in her food stall.

In the future, she wants to have a good financial management and continue acquiring good income from her business. She wants to save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy cured pork, sausages, hot-dogs, fish and chicken meat to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Franciso

texts.es: El señor Francisco es productor lechero y trabaja con la ayuda de toda su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar su producción de leche, pues la demanda es muy buena. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la localidad de Villandrani en el departamento de La Paz;  es casado y tiene cinco hijos pero dos ya están casados. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito y su análisis social y financiero indican que necesita el crédito y que puede pagarlo sin ningún problema.
texts.en: Francisco is a dairy farmer and his entire family helps him with the work.  He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow of a better breed to increase milk production because demand is very good.  He lives in a house of his own located in Villandrani in La Paz Department.  He’s married and has five children who are all now married.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan and the financial and social analyses indicate that he needs the loan and is able to repay it problem-free.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cesar Leonor

texts.es:
El señor Cesar es de la ciudad de luque, está casado con la señora Celia con quien tiene 3 hijos. Cesar hace aproximadamente 15 años que se dedica a la mecánica de automóviles, empezó trabajando como empleado de varios talleres de la zona y en el año 2007 decidió independizarse. Lo hizo gracias al dinero que pudo juntar de los otros trabajos que hizo y también gracias a la ayuda económica de la fundación, con la cual pudo comprarse las herramientas para su taller. En la actualidad posee una clientela formada, y piensa seguir ampliando su taller, ya que este es el medio de subsistencia de su familia y la de su hogar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para vehículos, lo cual es principal para el ramo al que se dedica. agradece a al fundación por la nueva oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Cesar is from the city of Luque. He is married to Celia, with whom he has 3 children. Cesar has been working in auto mechanics for approximately 15 years. He began working as an employee in various shops in the area and in 2007 he decided to open his own shop. Thanks to the money he saved from the other jobs he did, and also thanks to the economic assistance of the Foundation, he was able to buy the tools for his shop. He now has an established client base and he plans to expand his shop since this is his family’s and household’s source of income. 

He is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts for cars, which mainly what he works in. He is grateful to the Foundation for the new opportunity that it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for cars for use in his car mechanic shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bertha Ines

texts.es: La señora Bertha de 62 años de edad trabaja en su tienda desde hace 13 años; luego de que su esposo falleciera a ella le toco quedar sola con la obligación de su familia y con el negocio. La señora Bertha es muy organizada con sus cuentas y actualmente desea comprar un congelador y realizar adecuaciones para su tienda como serán pintar, organizar el piso y abrir una ventana.  Los hijos de la señora Bertha ya se encuentran con familia propia por lo que la señora Bertha trabaja día a día con el ánimo de conseguir sus propios ingresos para no depender de sus hijos.
texts.en: Bertha, 62, has worked in her store for 13 years since her husband died and she alone was left with the obligation for her family and the business.  Bertha is very organized with her accounts and wants to buy a freezer and do some structural improvements to her store like painting, organizing the floor and installing a window.  Bertha’s children have families of their own so Bertha works daily hoping to earn her own income so as not to be dependent on her children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and to do some structural improvements to the walls and floor of the store.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! Ebby is the facilitator of the Upendo group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ebby  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ebby had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ebby was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ebby  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ebby will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sourou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOUROU est composé de trois personnes qui sont résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emma Kokoè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emma Kokoè est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin. Emma Kokoè a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Emma Kokoè est mariée à un certain Victor. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Emma Kokoè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses besoins familiales, Emma Kokoè mène comme activité depuis douze ans, la vente de tissus, de conserves et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son quartier du Bénin. Emma Kokoè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emma Kokoè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOUROU, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The SOUROU group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Emma Kokoè, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Emma Kokoè is 53 years old and lives in Benin. She attended high school.  She is married to a man named Victor. The couple have three dependent children who all attend school. Emma Kokoè lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

In order to help support the family, Emma Kokoè has been selling fabrics, canned goods, and mobile phone recharge cards around her neighborhood for the past twelve years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Emma Kokoè is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Sourou group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, canned goods, and mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Ingrid Loreli

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid loreli es una mujer joven pero muy trabajadora, cuenta con 21 años de edad y está casada con el señor Víctor portillo quien es campesino tienen 2 hijos Abrahán y Adolfo quienes cursan segundo y tercer año de primaria, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace 1 año. 

Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: aceite, jitomates, chiles, cebollas, carne, maíz, sal, etc. 

Doña Ingrid dice que uno de los sueños que tiene es el de hacer crecer aun mas su pequeño negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner un restaurante de comida mexicana, y así tener una mejor producción y variedad de platillos, puesto que así obtendrá mejores ingresos, para poder asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Está muy contenta por esta gran ayuda que FRAC y los prestatarios de kiva le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso, ahora gozara de un mejor nivel de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a young but very hard-working woman. She's twenty-one and married to Victor, who is from the countryside. They have two children, Abrahán and Adolfo, who are in their second and third year of school respectively.  Ingrid has been selling Mexican antojitos for one year.

She says that she decided to start the small business because she was looking for a way to support her husband with household expenses and offer a better quality of life to her children.  She'll use her loan to buy more ingredients, including oil, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, meat, corn, salt, etc.

Ingrid says that one of her dreams is to make her small business grow. She wants to build a Mexican restaurant so she can make better dishes and offer a wider selection. That way she'll make more income and be able to assure her kids an education.

Ingrid is very glad for the huge help she's gotten from FRAC and Kiva lenders, because thanks to them she'll now enjoy a better standard of living and a good business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as oil, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, meat, corn, salt, etc.

loans.name: Luisa Teresa

texts.es:
Luisa  Teresa de 62 años de edad, tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20 años, es muy carismática y tiene una fuerza que muchos jóvenes desearían, ella  vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. Luis disfruta mucho visitar a su familia y pasar momentos inolvidables en sus tiempos libres; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Luisa le gusta mucho es el “Pato con Tau-si”. Ella hubiese difrutado mucho poder estudiar agronomía, pero debido a los pocos ingresos que tenía no pudo pagar la carrera que tanto deseaba, pero con el transcurso del tiempo, encontró una oportunidad de negocio que le permitiera dedicarse a otra actividad. 

Luisa se dedica se dedica a la venta de raspadilla (es hielo desmenuzado al cual se le añade una especie de dulce) y chicha Morada (refresco a base de maíz morado), se dedica a este trabajo aproximadamente 7 horas diarias, ella trabajaba con su padre desde pequeña y es por esto que se animó a tener este tipo de negocio. En un día Luisa puede atender desde 30 a 40 y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/.55 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.75, lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales. Luisa cree que su negocio tiene éxito porque sus clientes se sienten satisfechos y siempre regresan a su negocio. Luisa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá incursionar en una nueva idea de negocio, la que consiste en comprar panetones, (Hechas a base de un bizcocho y frutas confitadas), y ofrecerlos en su negocio por campaña navideña.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a en tener otro producto que ofrecer y aprovechar las ventas por navidad y año nuevo, también invertirá un parte del préstamo en algunos productos que son necesarios para su puesto de rapadilla, este conjunto de esfuerzo e inversión, le permitirá a Luisa en algunos meses tener un local propio y cumplir su gran sueño "Tener un Restaurant".
texts.en:
Luisa Teresa is 62, and has the spirit of a young woman of 20. She is very charming, and has the energy that many young people would like to have. She lives in Ica, Peru. 

Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. It is celebrated by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (one 8.0 in 2007, and 6.9 in 2011), for its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps especially as the source of Pisco, the traditional national drink of Peru. The home and business of the client is located in this warm and dry climate. 

In her spare time, Luisa really enjoys visiting her family and having unforgetable times. As is well known, Peru is notable for having some of the best food in the world, and one of the dishes that Luisa really likes is "Pato con Tau-si" (duck cooked Chinese-style). 

She would have really enjoyed being able to study agronomy, but due to her lack of income, she wasn't able to afford the degree she wanted so much.  But with the passage of time, she found a business opportunity that allowed her to have another livelihood. 

Luisa sells raspadillas (shaved ice), which is crushed ice to which a kind of sweetener is added, and chicha morada, a soft drink made from purple corn. She does this work for approximately seven hours daily. She worked with her father from a young age, and this is why she felt like having this kind of business.

In a day, Luisa can serve from 30 to 40 people, and this allows her to earn an average of approximately 55 soles daily; on a good day she can earn up to 75 soles, and this helps her with a few additional expenses. 

Luisa thinks her business is successful because her customers feel satisfied, and always come back to her business. Luisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with the help she has been provided, she will be able to tackle a new business idea, which consists of buying fruitcakes, made from a base of sweet cake and candied fruit, to sell at her business for the Christmas season. 

This improvement will help her have another product to sell, and take advantage of sales during Christmas and New Year's. She will also invest part of the loan in a few products that she needs for her raspadilla stand. This combination of effort and investment will allow Luisa to have her own shop within a few months, and fulfill her great dream, "to have a restaurant."

loans.use: To buy fruitcakes to sell.

loans.name: Felicitee

texts.en: Felicitee is 50 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 32 — all of them married. She has run a stall for the past two years. Felicitee has requested the loan to buy items such as soaps; cooking oil and flour to sell. With the profits she plans to make savings. In the future, Felicitee plans to have a shop.

loans.use: To buy more shop items for sell.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en: Sonya sends her greetings to Kiva and will be happy if she manages her third Kiva deal. Sonya lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region with her daughter and grandchildren. Sonya has vocational education and specialty of nurse but she never worked of her profession. Being in the trading business already 20 years she earns on her family living and also covers the needs of her grandchildren. At the city’s wholesale market renting a stall she sells woman clothes of great variety and of different style. Sonya this time again needs Kiva support for her business and she asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to renew her stall’s clothes assortment with new winter season women clothes.

loans.use: to renew her stall’s clothes assortment with new winter season women clothes

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Kodjo A. was born in Kouvé (in Yoto prefecture) on August 9, 1978. His parents being poor, he had to quit secondary school in order to traing to be a commercial agent. Unable to find steady work, he got into the charcoal business. Today, he is married and the father of two children. His wife also contributes to meeting household expenses with a meager income selling second-hand clothing.

Mr. A. would like to grow his business. A substantial income would increase the welfare of his family, so he is requesting a loan of $950 to lease a store for stocking and selling charcoal. He will name his store «Mon Salut», which means My Salvation. To finance his plans is to join in the struggle against unemployment.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kodjo est né le 09 Août 1978 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto. La pauvreté de ses parents a fait qu’il a abandonné les études au niveau secondaire pour aller suivre une formation d’agent commercial. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi fixe il se lance dans le commerce du charbon de bois. Il est aujourd’hui marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Sa femme aussi contribue aux charges du foyer avec les maigres revenus de son commerce de friperie. Monsieur A. Kodjo, ayant un sens aigu de gestion et du travail bien fait, a su rembourser les deux premiers crédits qu’il avait obtenus.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur A. veut agrandir son commerce en vu d’avoir un revenu plus consistant pour le bien être de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 qui va servir à louer un magasin pour le stockage et la revente du charbon de bois. Financer ce projet, c’est participer à la lutte contre le chômage.

loans.use: To lease a store for stocking and selling charcoal

loans.name: Maria De Los Milagro

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Milagros. I have been running a small business out of my home for two years, selling used clothing. Hoping to increase my family income, I currently need to provide a little more to my customers, since demand has grown and I don't have the selection to satisfy my clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Maria de los Milagros, mi Actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación de venta de ropa usada, tengo 2 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas ya que la demanda ha crecido y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer mis cliente, necesito mas variedad.

loans.use: Buy a bundle of used clothing and baby clothing.

loans.name: Giao

texts.en: Giao is 37 years old. Her husband, a farmer, is 1 year older. She must support a daughter and a son whose ages are 9 and 14. In addition, she supports her elderly mother. Her son is attending third grade, and her daughter stopped going to school to help the family. Recently, because of spreading insects, their income from the rice field is low. Giao has decided to improve the family income by running a grocery store from their home. She has been running the store for 1 year. Now their income is $8 per person/month. She hopes to get a loan of $75 to supply her grocery store. Giao will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Supplying the grocery store.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
Sandra is married with 2 children, one being her own. Her initial loan of approx. 225 dollars to purchase vegetables in bulk allowed her business to grow. She now employs 4 people. To further grow her business, she is asking for a loan of 450 dollars to purchase used clothing for sale. In the future, she looks forward to expanding her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada com 2 filhos, seu 1. emprestimo foi de 6.000mts, para compra de vegetais a grosso, o negocio esta a crescer, ja tem 4 empregados,para ampliar o seu negocio tomou 12.000mts, a 12/07/07, para compra de roupa usada para revenda. No futuro pensa ampliar a sua casa.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis is 23 years old and is married with one child, aged 3. She sells clothes on credit, and requests a $100 loan to expand her business.  Some of the loan will be used for her husband's business, selling meat-balls in the market. They expect earnings of $33 - $35 per day and the profit will be used to buy more goods for their business. Lilis is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business and her husband's business

loans.name: Idiatu

texts.en: "I hope to buy more drinks and provisions to enable me to increase my worth of goods," says Idiatu G., who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 49 years, married with 5 children, and has been in this business since the year 1984. She hopes to get the loan of $400 to buy more drinks and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Fatoh

texts.en:
G. Fatoh is 49 years old. His wife, who is a seamstress, and he raised 2 sons. Both sons are already married.  

For 32 years Fatoh has been involved in the business of repairing  vehicles and also selling them. He started as the master and gradually managed to open his own repair shop. Fatoh is well-known in his neighborhood as an excellent master. He tries to fix any problem and the prices for his services are quite fair which attracts lots of clients. All this allows Fatoh to generate stable income for his family, to help his sons and to buy small presents any time his grandchildren come to visit him. 

Fatoh has been provided with several loans by IMON. He is a very accurate and positive client. Today Fatoh requests $900.00 US Dollars to purchase spare parts for the repair of cars. Fatoh plans to pay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his auto repair business

loans.name: Eddy Abercio

texts.es:
Eddy S. is a young man who has demonstrated skills for carpentry work since he was a young man. His business is located in the patio of his house, with the advantage of being located in a very busy area. He is also one of few carpenters in his village, El Sauce, in the city of León.

The need this gentleman faces is that in order to continue maintaining his humble household (wife and son ) along with his elderly parents, he needs to invest in the purchase of wood and tools in better condition than those he currently uses. This will allow him to continue providing a good service to his clients. For this reason he turns to Ceprodel, to receive the loans that allow him to purchase tools and wood of excellent quality. His credit record with Ceprodel is 4 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eddy S. es un joven que desde muy pequeño ha tenido la habilidad de trabajar en la carpintería. El negocio lo ubica en el patio de su casa teniendo la ventaja de estar ubicado en un lugar muy visitado y adema es uno de los pocos carpinteros de su pueblo El Sauce en la ciudad de Leon.

La necesidad que atraviesa este caballero es que para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar(esposa e hijo) y a sus ancianos padres requiere invertir en la compra de la madera y de herramientas en mejor estado para continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por tal motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de las herramientas y madera de excelente calidad. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and tools

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T., 70, is a widow and works as a rice dealer in her village. She sells rice, and resells it for profit, earning on average $4 a day. She has four children, two who are married and live in their own homes. One child works in a hotel with a salary $280 and one other daughter works with her mother selling rice. She would like to borrow $1000 to increase the amount of rice she can buy in bulk and resell. This will increase her profit margin. (The elder daughter is pictured because Mrs. Chan T. was not available).

loans.use: She wants to purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Ny Yun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny Y. is a grocer and lives in Au village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is also the leader of a group with four members. She has four children, one of whom is a farmer and one of whom is enrolled in school. The two youngest are still too young to work or study. Her husband, Soth Pon, is a subsistence farmer. Their income comes principally from the sale of groceries and rice, and they use this income to support the family and pay for expenses.

This year, Mrs. Ny Y. has a lot of rice, but she does not have enough money to transport her rice and sell it for a better price. Thus, she would now like to have access to a loan to hire a car to transport her rice.

loans.use: To hire a car to transport her rice

loans.name: Faozia

texts.fr:
Born in 1990 in Kpalimé in the prefecture of Kloto, situated 120 km from Lomé, Mrs. Faozia A. is unmarried. Her main business is the purchase and sale of generic drugs and basic need goods in the Hédzranawoé area in Lomé. After ending her education due to a lack of material and financial means in 2000, she immediately embraced this small business as a way to make a living.

This loan, her first, will allow her to buy five (5) boxes of generic drugs, comprising mainly nivaquine, paracetamol, and aspirin.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1990 à Kpalimé dans la préfecture de Kloto située à 120km de Lomé, Madame A. Faozia est célibataire. Elle a pour activité principale l'achat et vente des produits génériques et des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Depuis qu'elle a cessé les études faute de soutiens matériels et financiers en l'an 2000, elle a immédiatement embrassé le petit commerce pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins.

Ce premier crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter cinq (5) cartons de produits génériques constitués essentiellement de nivaquine, de paracétamol et d'aspirine.

loans.use: To buy and sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. sells provisions. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Samuel and his three children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.
He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Unity And Strength Group

texts.es:
Hello.  Our group is Unity and Strength.  It consists of three individuals.  We live in the same community in Aldea el Puente Yusguare.  This is the first help we are asking for, now that we have come to develop our economic activities for a few years without credit help or permanent consulting.  This is why we’re asking for credit to help us start and develop our activities, and our families, and with the strength and dedication we can give our children all of the necessities of life, and an education, so that they can get involved in our production and sales.

We need unconditional support to continue working and to move forward.  We have dedicated ourselves to the production of meat and chicken tamales.  We also make tortillas, small cakes, and white bread in our earthen oven.
Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer

hola nuestro grupo es UNION Y FUERZA estamos conformadas por 3 integrantes, residimos en la misma comunidad del Aldea el Puente Yusguare, es la primera ayuda que estamos solicitando, ya que hemos venido desarrollando nuestras actividades economicas desde hace un par de años sin tener apoyo crediticio ni asesoria permanente, por tal razon estamos solicitando el credito para poder tener un crecimiento en nuestras actividades y asi poder lograr un desarrollo en nuestras familias ya que con esfuerzo y dedicacion damos educacion y todas las necesidades a nuestros hijos, a quienes tambien involucramos en nuestra produccion y venta. 
necesitamos un apoyo incondicional para poder seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
nosotras nos dedicamos a la produccion de nacatamales de carne y pollo, hacemos tortillas, pastelitos, pan blanco en horno de barro.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and wheat flower, salt, lime, sugar, firewood and vegetables.
