loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria lives on Julian Apaza Street, north south of the Mejillones Port area in the city of El Alto. She lives with her children that are 23, 8 and 6 years old respectively. Her husband works in the interior of the department. She is dedicated to the sale of vegetables and meat that she transports to provinces in the department.

The loan will be allocated to purchase a printing press for her husband; he previously worked for an employer and will now work independently and will no longer be away from his family. It is her first loan with Impro, the evaluation that was conducted qualified her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Silveria vive en la calle Julian Apaza s/n de la zona puerto Mejillones en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella vive junto a sus hijos de 23, 8 y 6 años respectivamente ya que su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento. Se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y carne que transporta a provincias del departamento. El crédito lo destinará en la compra de maquina de imprenta para su esposo ya que anteriormente él trabajaba de empleado y ahora lo hará independientemente y ya no estará lejos de su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a printing press for her husband so he can work and open his own printing business near their family.

loans.name: Koudilatou Afi

texts.fr:
Madame B. Koudilatou Afi est née le 07 juillet 1972 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de beauté et de mèches dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 1993 lui procure de bons revenus
Elle désire acquérir de nouveaux produits de beautés afin de diversifier stock et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 150 boîtes de ultra beauty, 80 boîtes de Dark lovely et 4 sachets de mèches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koudilatou Afi B. was born on July 7, 1972 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. Her primary business is selling cosmetics and hair extensions in the Kégué neighborhood in Lomé. This business which she began in 1993 brings in good income for her.

She would like to buy some new cosmetics so as to diversify her inventory and so is asking for this, her first loan to buy 150 boxes of Ultra Beauty, 80 boxes of Dark Lovely, and 4 bags of hair extensions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sorn Ra's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are eleven members in the village bank located in Chamka Khai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sorn R., 29 years old and mother of three children, is the village bank president. She is a farmer who earns a small revenue from harvesting rice to support her family. On her plantation, she now faces a problem because her field is infertile, thus badly affecting her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sorn R. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field conditions and grow more crops. Her husband, Mr. Leng Soeurn, is a palm juice collector who collects palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine.

All the members in the village bank loan have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy, tiene 32 años, está casada  y tiene 2 hijos, todos van a la escuela que queda cerca de su domicilio, ella es fabricante y vendedora de chipas en forma ambulante y su pequeña fábrica lo tiene en su mismo domicilio que con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido realizan la producción de la chipas. nComenta Nancy, que gracias a éste trabajo ella y su marido pudieron hacerse de una casa propia con todas las comodidades mínimas, con sus ganancias diarias le permite cubrir los gastos de la familia, como ser la comida, los pagos de los servicios, agua, luz, y la educación escolar de sus hijos. nCon los préstamos que solicita hoy a la Fundación Paraguaya desea comprar buena cantidad de materia prima como ser, almidón, aceite, quesos entre otros productos, lo que le permitirá  obtener un precio mucho menor que lo de costumbre por sus compras en cantidades grandes.n
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old, is married and has 2 children. All of her children go to the school that is near their house. Nancy is a street vendor. She makes and sells "chipas" (cheese or corn breads made of yucca). She makes the chipas in her house with the help of her children and her husband. Nancy says that thanks to this work she and her husband could afford their own home with all the basic necessities. With her daily profits, she can cover the expenses of her family, such as food, utility bills and schooling for her children. With this loan she is requesting from Fundacion Paraguaya she hopes to buy a large quantity of raw materials, such as starch, oil, cheese, among other products. This loan will allow her to purchase these goods in large quantities, and therefore obtain a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy starch, oil and cheese for bread business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana E. is 22 years old and married to ,Jimmy Roquero, who has no stable job to support their lovely daughter named Joanna Roquero. They live in a small dilapidated house made of nipa shingles and bamboo.  They lack money even though there are only three in the family. Rosana works as a laundrywoman in the town and earns Php150.00 a day, just enough to buy a kilo of rice and a piece of fish as their daily food. She cannot meet the needs of her daughter especially in times of sickness. This is why she joined Ahon Sa Hirap:  to get capital to start a business. 

She wants her husband to support her in her project of hog fattening and opening a sari-sari store. She needs Php5,000.00 (USD $125) to start this project as the way to achieve her dreams.  She dreams of sending her daughter to college and having a stable source of income. She wants to end her hard times of being an “ita” or native without opportunities.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 79 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 6 hijos y actualmente vive con una hija. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/.500 aumentó su capital D. trabajo y compró verduras para su puesto D. trabajo. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que hace 18 años adquirió su puesto D. trabajo por un traspaso D. una comadre.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará verduras que más se venden en las fiestas D. navidad, año nuevo y reyes, ello lo realizará en su puesto D. trabajo.

Felicitas desea continuar trabajando para apoyar en su hogar y a la hija que vive con ella.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 79 years old, widowed, and mother of 6 children. Today she lives with one of her daughters. With the first loan for S/.500 she increased her working capital and bought vegetables to sell in her stand. She has been working with the communal bank for a year and tells us that 18 years ago she acquired a stand from a friend. With this loan for S/.800, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy vegetables that are commonly sold during the Christmas, New Year, and Epiphany holidays to sell in her vegetable stand. Felicitas wishes to continue working in order to support her home and the daughter with whom she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Mead

texts.en: Mr. N. is a 42 year old rice farmer. He also climbs palm trees to gather and sell palm juice and sugar. He started this business in 1990 and earns around $4 per day. He is married to Mrs. Synoeun and they do not yet have children. His wife raises poultry and cattle as another sources of income for the family. They work hard to earn their income and save much of it for future plans. Mr. N. would like to ask for a loan to purchase two buffaloes to breed for profit.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes to breed.

loans.name: Nadou

texts.fr: Nadou L. est une revendeuse ambulante de produits génériques, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle est souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en louant un magasin et en l’alimentant afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses ventes et de gagner plus pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nadou L. is a traveling saleswoman of generic pharmaceutical products in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are all in school. She would like to use this loan to expand her business capacity by renting a store and stocking it, so as to respond better to customer demands. This will enable her to increase her sales and to earn more in order to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals and also to rent a store

loans.name: Peang

texts.en: Peang O., 59, is a widowed farmer who lives with her old mother and two sisters in the Kampong Cham province. She and her sisters have been farming since 1980 to earn a living and they are able to make about USD $1 every day. Besides this activity, Peang also sells grocery products from her home. On average, she can make USD $8 in revenue per day. Mrs. Peang has one child who stays at home to help her sell grocery items. She would like a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands. (Mrs. Peang O. is third from the left in the photo.)

loans.use: Expand grocery inventory

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en: Fiapito T., 35, is married with eleven children. She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and public five days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiapito’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a new canoe and a large container to store the fish and keep it from being damaged.

loans.use: To purchase a canoe and a large container to store the fish

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay A. is a trader who has run his own business since 1995. He started this business and built his own shop, step by step, from his savings. Oqtay is married and has two children. He sells different kinds of goods such as sweets, home products, bath accessories, etc. This is the only source of income for his family. Oqtay tries his best to cover the family’s needs and to provide an excellent education for both of his children. Oqtay’s dream is to hand over the business to his children in the future. For this purpose he is applying for a US$1500 loan to increase the number of items he sells.

loans.use: To increase merchandise in shop.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa P. se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera teniendo su propio negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario se desempeña vendiendo los deliciosos platillos preparados por ella misma.

Hoy en día ha venido a Ceprodel con un propósito y este es el ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración y venta de los alimentos y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa P. stands out as an excellent cook. She has her own business selling food in the wholesale food market in Managua, where she sells delicious dishes prepared daily. Today she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan, so she can buy raw materials in order to manufacture and sell food, thereby improving the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Divorced with two children who are working, Kate Boabeng is 51 years old. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantains, maize and gari (manioc couscous) etc., in the local market of Mankessim where she lives. She is been selling there for the past four years, so she has lots of sales experience to win customers.

Kate is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to strengthen her business right now while she is not taking care of her children. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of cassava, plantains, maize, beans and gari, etc. to serve her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of cassava, plantains, maize, beans, and gari, etc.

loans.name: Ramira

texts.en:
Ramira J. hails from Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver in their town. At the same time, they also earn a living for the family by growing corn. Ramira is now on her eighth loan cycle, requesting a 10,000 loan for the purchase of fertilizers. She also wishes to set aside a portion of it for labor, especially during harvest.

Her future plans is to till her own land and to be able to send their children to school so that they can attain good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for corn crops

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Because of the Community Economic Ventures Inc.’s (CEVI) wide array of good services, 41-year-old Evelyn D. became very interested in joining as one of its growing members. As a matter of fact, she is currently applying for a loan amounting to Php 15,000.00 that will be used to purchase insecticide and other necessities for their family's rice farming business. Together with her husband, Evelyn manages their small business where they get their income for food, school fees for their two children and savings. The couple also aims to buy an additional parcel of land in the future and improve their present income. This way, the couple believes that they will be able to realize their main goal in life, which is to provide a brighter future for their children.

loans.use: Insecticide and other farming necessities

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, a 41-year-old businesswoman, sells cooked food during lunchtime and some refreshing snacks during snack time. As her business is located in St. Barbara Centro Ilagan, Isabela in front of Victory bus terminal near their village, most of her customers are passengers and drivers. Her husband is always there supporting and helping her in maintaining their enterprise, which is the couple’s main source of income. They are supporting their three children who are presently studying in college, high school, and elementary school respectively. Their two eldest children are both already married.

Geraldine hopes to someday have a store to earn a better income and provide better service to her customers. The couple aspires to increase their daily income, currently only PHP300, which is just enough for daily school allowances and basic needs at home. Geraldine is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital to make her business more productive in order to better provide for the needs of the children and accrue some savings in the event of an emergency.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Thou Nem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people living in Tranh village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Thou N. is the 41-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In her plantation, she has some problems because her field is infertile and it is far from the irrigation system. In order to solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She would use the rest of money to hire a laborer to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Chuk Touch, is a hardworking man. This couple has four children, two of whom are construction workers and the other two are attending the local school. 

Fifteen members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those having EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to hire a laborer to plow the field

loans.name: El Sufrido Group

texts.es:
Provenientes de la comarca El Raizon (Nindiri), ubicada en el Km 19 ½ de la carretera que nos lleva a Masaya, el grupo El sufrido está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que poseen la convicción de crecer y alcanzar sus sueños con forme al trabajo y ahínco que pongan a sus vidas.

Doña María Auxiliadora S. P., es la coordinadora del grupo, quien tiene 30 años de edad. de los cuales lleva ya tres años trabajando en la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas conocidas como los son Zermat y AVON.

Ella pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de comenticos, que distribuye al crédito a sus diferentes clientes, y luego de los abonos de estos, saca las cuotas que le corresponde dar. María inicio su negocio, cuando todavía trabajaba de Domestica en una casa, y parte de su salario lo invertía en su negocio para poder vender sus productos. 

Cuando conoció ADIM, contemplo la posibilidad de invertir su crédito en la  compra de sus productos y a partir de esto le ha ido muy bien, por lo cual pretende seguir adelante, hasta convertirse en una promotora de venta.

Teresa del Carmen C. C., quien trabaja en la elaboración de Nacatamales (Comida típica, hecha a base masa de maíz, carne de cerdo y algunas especias) que tiene mucha demanda por parte de los Nicaragüenses) y Claudia María S. L., quien posee un negocio de venta de Ropa Usada, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
From the region of Raizon (Nindiri), located at Km 19½ of the road that leads to Masaya, there exists a group of three experienced women entrepreneurs who have the conviction to grow and achieve their dreams though hard work.

Doña María Auxiliadora S. P., the group coordinator, is 30 years old and sells various brands of cosmetics, including Avon and Zermat. She has been in business for 3 years. Doña María intends to use her loan to buy cosmetics, which see sells to her customers on credit. She will use the payments from her customers to satisfy her loan installments. She started her business when she was still working as a domestic employee and used part of her salary to purchase inventory. When she started working with ADIM, she contemplated buying more products. Since her business has done very well, she is seeking to advance herself to the level of sales promoter.

Other members:

Teresa del Carmen C. C. makes and sells nacatamales (a traditional dish made of corn-based dough, pork, and spices), which are very popular among Nicaraguans.

Claudia María S. L. operates a business selling used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other merchandise

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a member of The Dawn village bank. He is 54 years old, separated, and has two children who are 26 and 25 years old. The youngest is married and the eldest lives with him.

Luciano came from the province of Chiclayo to Lima at the age of 16 and worked for a travel agency for twelve years handling documents. Unfortunately, he lost his job when the business went bankrupt. However, with his savings he was able to buy a used car. He works everyday as a taxi driver.

The loans he has received since joining FINCA have been a great help with the unexpected costs of his taxi. Luciano needs a loan of 1,200 soles for the maintenance of his taxi and to fix the taxi’s transmission. Luciano’s dream is to live in Chiclayo in a couple of years.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his taxi and to fix it’s transmission

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Approvisionner sa boutique

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is fifty–two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four school-age children. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Comfort is a trader. She trades in plantains. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Comfort also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for over twenty–five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantains

loans.name: Pelsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Pelsie V. lives in Brgy, Menez, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Married to a tricycle (rickshaw) driver, with 4 children, Pelsie has managed to help her family make ends meet with a small general store she has been operating for 7 years. Recently she has started electronic loading (the selling of mobile phone airtime credits) to increase her income.

As years pass, Pelsie realizes that it is important for her to grow her business so she can continue to meet the growing demands of her family. A better future, comfortable life, and a little savings for times of emergency are what Pelsie looks forward to.

A loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory for her general store (her 12th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon) will make this dream a little closer. About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane C. is from the village of  Batangan, Valencia City. She is 37 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling scrap metal and other used products like plastics, iron and empty bottles to the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is currently requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: investing in expanding the business

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband. Najla has owned a grocery store since 1985. She also sells fruits and vegetables. Najla has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Najla has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. 

Najla is successful in her business because she knows how to treat her clients. In addition, she has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. Najla decided to open her store initially to supplement her husband’s income. In the future, she plans to expand her business by selling wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Cette dame est une femme courageuse et très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, pour aider son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer elle a débuté en 2007 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé. Ainsi elle arrive à réaliser de bonnes marges bénéficiaires sur ses ventes. Voulant se réapprovisionner en charbons de bois parce que son stock en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de cette marchandises.
texts.en:
This lady is courageous and very dynamic, she is married and is the mother of 2 children. In 2007, to help her husband with daily household expenses, she started a trade of charcoal bags that she purchases from the town of Sokode in the center of the country. She is able to make good margins on her sales. Wishing to replenish her stock of charcoal that is getting low, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to pay for the purchase of 15 bags of charcoal and their transportation.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and transportation of charcoal bags for their local retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell beef, goat and mutton meat

loans.name: Phiech

texts.en: Phiech S. is 20 years old and the mother of two children who live at home and attend school. Phiech S. is a local farmer: she plants various crops as well as raising many ducks to produce eggs for sale. Her husband is Mr. Eung Korng, age 26. He also uses his truck to pick up soil to sell to people who need the land to cover the polluted water surrounding their houses. Recently his truck has often broken down during the process and that affects his revenue. To solve this problem, Phiech S. decided to seek a loan to repair the broken truck of her husband.

loans.use: To repair a broken truck

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita M., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Mateo M., a jeepney driver, she is blessed with five children.

Margarita makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own video game rental business for more than a year.

Margarita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times in CCT’s cooperative.

Margarita is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy games and equipments needed for her video game business.  Her business lets her earn an additional profit of PHP 7,200 per month.

Now, with your help, Margarita would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying an optical mouse, electronic cables and a television.

Margarita dreams that someday her business will expand to become a successful Internet café so that their living conditions will improve as well.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy an optical mouse, electronic cables and a television

loans.name: Joreynelle

texts.en:
Joreynelle A. is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Joreynelle owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Joreynelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Joreynelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Joreynelle is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jappo Liggey Asf N°4 Group

texts.fr:
Jappo Ligguey ASF est une association mixte composée de plusieurs personnes microentrepreuneuses. Elle a été créée en 2009 par un groupe de femmes pour  rassembler  tous leurs  paires microentrepreuneurs  du  quartier  Angle Serigne Fallou  (ASF) autour d’un même idéal  « l’entraide  pour travailler ». Elle est dirigée par Madame Marie Ndiaye D. et  est scindée en plusieurs sous groupes de 5 sous l’influence de l’agent de crédit de la caisse U-IMCEC Moda Kane pour  que tous  les membres  puissent  bénéficier mieux des services d’U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que certains sous groupes ont déposé leur demande de crédit de 500 000 FCFA qu’ils vont se partager en part égale. 
Quant au  sous Jappo Liggey ASF n°4, elle est gérée par la présidente de l’association Madame Marie Ndiaye D.. C’est une femme mariée avec 5 enfants tous majeurs qui s’active dans le commerce de tissus depuis 1986. Cependant, Madame D. voudrait se lancer dans l’aviculture sous l’influence de son amie avicultrice. Elle compte avec sa part du prêt, ses 100 000 FCFA, démarrer l’activité en achetant  50 poussins et tout le nécessaire. Ainsi ce prêt va lui permettre de diversifier ses activités afin de bien gérer ses besoins et ceux de sa maison.
Pour les autres membres du sous groupe, ce prêt leurs permet de renforcer leurs activités. Elles sont entre autre :
 La trésorière Madame Fatou S. s’active dans le  commerce de tissus Thioupes (indigo) et de bol depuis 30 ans. 
Madame Ndeye salla N. la plus petite du sous groupe, coiffeuse depuis 6 ans entend acheter des produits cosmétiques, mèches et greffages pour son salon de coiffures  qu’elle gère avec ses 6 apprentis.
 Madame Mame Thioro D.  qui vend du petit déjeuner et du jus local  dans un coin du quartier depuis 4 ans 
Et Madame Diago M.  avicultrice de poulets de chair  depuis 3 ans et qui a formé Madame la présidente au métier.
texts.en:
Jappo Ligguey ASF is a mixed association composed of several micro-entrepreneurial individuals.  It was created in 2009 by a group of women to bring together all of their micro-entrepreneur peers in the Angle Serigne Fallou (ASF) district to focus on the same idea: mutual aid for doing work.  The association is lead by Ms. Marie Ndiaye D. and is divided into several sub-groups of five under the guidance of the agent of the lending group U-IMCEC Moda Kane, so that all the members may better benefit from U-IMCEC services.  Thus, some of the sub-groups have submitted their loan request of 500,000 francs CFA for sharing equally among themselves. As for the sub-group Jappo Liggey ASF n°4, it is managed by the president of the association Ms. Marie Ndiaye D..  She is a married woman with five children, all of age.  She has been active in the commerce of cloth since 1986.  However, she would like to get started raising poultry, with the help of her friend who is a poultry farmer. And she plans on using her share of the loan, the amount of 100,000 francs CFA, to start this business by buying fifty chicks and all the necessities.  And so, this loan is going to enable her to diversify her business in order to do well managing the needs of her house, as well as her own.  For the other members of the sub-group, this loan enables them to bolster their businesses.  Included are: The treasurer Ms. Fatou S. has been active in the commerce of thioupes fabrics (indigo) and bowls and basins for thirty years. Ms. Ndeye salla N., the youngest in the sub-group, has been a hair stylist for six years.  She intends to buy cosmetics, hair extensions, and weaves for her hair salon, which she manages with six apprentices. Ms. Mame Thioro D. has been selling breakfast and local juices in her neighborhood for four years.  And Ms. Diago M. has been a chicken farmer for three years.  She trained Madame President in her trade.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on a variey of goods

loans.name: Muhabbat Karabaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мухаббат 50 лет. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. В данное время она проживает со своим мужем  и младшей дочерью- студенткой факультета бухгалтерского учета.  Ее супруг работает водителем пассажирского буса, также активно участвует в семейном бизнесе. Они занимаются выращиванием и реализацией сельхозпродукции. Этим бизнесом они занимаются на протяжении 20 лет, за счет дохода от бизнеса купили пассажирский бус. Этот кредит будет использован для закупа одного бычка для откорма.
Кадыров Шарабидин, 50, женат. Его супруга работает в школе учителем начальных классов. У него двое детей:дочь и сын. Шарабидин занимается разведением поголовья МРС. Еще отец клиента занимался этим делом и с малых лет он был обучен разведению скота. Кредит будет использован для закупа МРС.
Сейдахан замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее супруг работает техмастером. Совместно с супругом она занимается разведением и откормом МРС и КРС. Бизнес был начат с 2006 году с двух овец. В данное время  у нее имеются корова, теленок и 2 овцы, также на прибыль они смогли купить авто. Кредит будет использован для закупа теленка. 
Шахназа, 22 года, замужем и воспитывается одного 3 сына. Ее супруг на заработках в РФ. Шахназа занимается реализацией детской одежды на рынке ХАлмион. Кредит будет использован для расширения ассортимента продукции, а именно одежды для взрослых.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 50 years old. She is married and is a mother of four children. She lives with her husband and youngest daughter who is a college student majoring in accounting. Her husband works as a bus driver and also takes an active part in their family business. They grow and sell agricultural produce. They have been doing this business for twenty years and used the profit from it to buy the passenger bus. They will use this loan to buy one calf for feeding. Sharabidin K. is 50 years old, he is married. His wife works as an elementary school teacher. They have two children: a son and a daughter. Sharabidin breeds small cattle. His father has been in this business and Sharabidin has learned to breed cattle since a very young age. The loan will be used to buy small cattle. Seydahan is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband works as a technician. Together with her husband they breed large and small cattle. They started this business in 2006 with just two sheep. Right now they own a cow, a calf and two sheep and have also purchased a car using the profits from the business. They will use the loan to buy a calf. Shahnaza is 22 years old, she is married and is raising a three year old son. Her husband is now working in the Russian Federation. Shahnaza sells children's clothing on the Khalimon market. She will use the loan to expand the variety of her inventory by including clothing for grown ups.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small cattle, calfs and clothing

loans.name: Fevely

texts.en: Despite the many challenges Fevely B. has encountered in her life, she has remained strong and happy to be working so hard in helping her husband earn an income by growing her own hog fattening business. This is the only way she knows to earn money to support the needs of her family, especially her two children aged one and three years old, since she has not received a degree from a higher level of education that could get her employed in offices and a higher compensation. The loans she had received through her membership in ASHI have helped her a lot in growing her business and she now has greater profit. Thus, she is again requesting another loan from ASHI in order to sustain her small business until it will grow. She plans to sell pigs she has fattened for four months either slaughtered or alive to meat vendors in the market. Profits will be used to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. J. is a 43 year-old unmarried woman who supports her 65 year-old mother, 27 year-old brother and two nephews who are high school students. Financially, her small variety store business is the main source of income for her family. Her customers are people in their village and the store is located in front of their house. 

Josephine really wants to grow this business and also start another business of buying and selling ready to wear clothes. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to be used in her business. With the loan, she will increase her store inventory and better satisfy her customer demands. She hopes to have increased profits which will also support her dream of renovating the family home house in order to have a more comfortable shelter.

loans.use: To purchase various goods and grocery items.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna P. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luna has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Luna joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luna is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.pt:
Carla N. nasceu na cidade Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, solteira e não tem filhos ainda. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com  seus familiares e sustenta 2 irmaos que vivem com ela.
 Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, depois de parar de estudar devido as dificuldades financeiras iniciou um negocio próprio. Faz este negocio ha mais de 7 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt a 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar roupa (calcas, blusas, casacos, saias e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem o sonho de se formar no ensino superior, no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para desenvolver o seu negocio e se tornar uma empresaria de renome.
texts.en:
Clara N. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 30 years old, single and does not yet have children. She finished twelfth grade but did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her relatives and supports two brothers who live with her. She never left her hometown. After she stopped studying because of financial difficulties, Clara began her own business. She has run this business for more than seven years. She has no employees and earns about 10,000 to 15,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Clara has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her friends, who are also customers of this institution. This is her third loan, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy clothing (pants, blouses, jackets, skirts and other items) to increase her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out more loans. Clara's dream is to attend college. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to develop her business and become a businesswoman of renown.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing (pants, blouses, jackets and skirts)

loans.name: Mr. Saren Reach Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is made up of eight people, who are all villagers in York Bat village in Kandal Province. Mr. Saren R. is a village bank president, selected by the other members, who will use their share of the loan for different purposes. He was born in 1967. He provides motorcycle transport to support his family, but he has a problem because his motorbike is too old to use. Therefore Mr. Saren R. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one. His wife, Mrs. Daney Loeng, is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family. Through these activities, the couple supports four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while another is a construction worker, and the others are studying at a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married with five children, who all attend school. She resides in and owns a four room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include utility bills and feeding the family.

Sylvia used to sell snacks but a few months ago changed her business enterprise. She owns a store in Kyebando selling charcoal wholesale. Sylvia works six days a week. She doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys her charcoal from delivery vans which get the charcoal from villages. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She hopes to start going to villages for charcoal. Sylvia joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nadou Celestine

texts.fr:
Celestine a 46 ans et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de tubercules d’ignames. Elle a 5 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Bassar. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de  WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter  6 lots d’ignames.
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants
texts.en:
Celestine is 46 years old; her line of business is retailing yams. She has five years of experience doing this; in order to obtain a greater profit margin, she stocks up in the interior part of the country, in the town of Bassar. She has a diverse customer base. The current customer demand is growing, which is why she is seeking her first loan from WAGES to purchase six yam lots. She is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing yams [for resale]

loans.name: Libia Gladis

texts.es:
Libia Gladis C. M. tiene 22 años. Es soltera y tiene un hijo de un año, Javier. Viven en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Libia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Libia se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la agricultura: comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que con este crédito seria más cómodo para trabajar y le gusta que los intereses sean bajos. Su sueño es tener su casa y un poquito de tierra. 

Le gusta escuchar música y jugar en la casa con su hermana en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Libia Gladis C. M. is 22 years old. She is single and has a one year old son, Javier. They live in the hamlet of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. Libia is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Libia is a farmer who raises corn and rice and makes her sales of rice and corn in Ventanas every six months. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer. She believes that this loan will make it easier for her to work and she likes the fact that the interest rates are low. Her dream is to have her own house and a bit of land. In her spare time she enjoys listening to music and playing with her sister at home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies, seed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING WOOD, ZINC, STONE AND SAND TO USE IN HOME IMPROVEMENTS

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng R., age 52, is widowed and resides with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She produces cow ties (leashes and harnesses) to sell for a daily income of about USD 6.  Pheng is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more nylon to produce ties. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more nylon for producing cow ties.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel A. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 44 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Ronel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ronel has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ronel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ronel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is an enterprising woman, always happy to do good work. When she was young, she had the goal of self-improvement. For about 20 years she has been breeding cattle and sheep. This allows her to support her four children who are the reason of her being; she has raised them alone since she is widow. Habiba's parents also live with them. Habiba wants to increase her capital to buy new animals so she can keep supporting the family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Robert Gikaba

texts.en:
Robert has been running his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 38 years old, married to Tabitha Njoki and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a second hand motorbike which he will employ somebody else to operate for him in motorcycle transport business.  This will increase his daily income. He is very determine and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a second hand motorbike.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis vive en la localidad de el Torno, en el Barrio Miraflores, es nacido esta población, soltero, su actividad es el transporte de personas, desde el torno a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive en la casa de sus padres, hace 11 año que se dedica a esta actividad, es el ultimo de tres hermanos, por lo que el esta a cargo de sus padres que son de edad avanzada, el destino del crédito es para comprar un motor para su vehículo y asi ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, es una persona muy responsable, sus padres son su unica preocupacion, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor José Luis lives in the locality of el Torno, in the Miraflores neighborhood.  He was born in the neighborhood.  He is single. His activity is the transportation of people from el Torno to the city of Santa Cruz.  He lives in his parents house.  He has been dedicated to this activity for 11 years.  He is the last of three brothers, which means that he is charged with the care of his parents that are of advanced age.  The loan will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle and in this way to offer better service to his clients.  He is a very responsible person.  His parents are his only concern.  He is very thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tienen 23 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su esposa, ambos trabajan para los gastos del hogar, el tiene el negocio de venta de ropa y lo atiende dese las 7:00am a 5:00pm, este negocio fue iniciado con ayuda de su madre ya que ella es comerciante de ropa también.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir con modas del momento, esto le ayudara a mantener la clientela y a que nuevos lleguen también atraídos por la mercadería que ofrece,  el quiere satisfacer los gustos es por eso que en esta época que se acerca es un tiempo donde más se busca ropa para las fiestas de fin de año.
Los sueños de José Luis son como comerciante crecer cada día y brindar un buen servicio y atención a los clientes, y como persona superarse y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José Luis is 23 years old and resides with his wife in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. They both work to cover the household expenses. José Luis has a business selling clothes and manages it from 7am to 5pm. He started this business with the help of his mother, who is also clothing merchant.

José Luis is requesting a loan to buy articles of clothing that are currently in fashion. This will help him keep his existing customers as well as attract new ones with the arrival of more merchandise to offer. He wants to cater to the tastes of each customer since the time is coming when most people are looking for clothes to buy for the year-end festivities.

His dreams include becoming a merchant who grows each day and provides good service to his customers. In addition, he hopes to excel as a person and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sofía; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, viuda  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. panadería ella venD. desD. las 06:00am hasta las 08:00pm, la panadería se encuentra en su casa, ella desea implementar su panadería con la  compra D.  insumos para elaborar pasteles, panes, tortas y algunos postres mas.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas insumos para su panadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the community bank "Vamos Juntos", which is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Sofia is 57 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with working at her bakery.  She works from 6:00am until 8:00pm.  The bakery is located in her home.  She would like to purchase ingredients to make cakes, breads, pies, and other desserts to sell in her bakery.

She is asking for this loan to purchase supplies for her bakery.

She is thankful to everyone who is part of making this dream come true, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children who attend school.  Amina has a business of selling food, which she has had for 10 years.  

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food, oil, and flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Amina hopes to own a house.   Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning new skills.

loans.use: To purchase food, oil, and flour

loans.name: Gaby Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta.Gabi; ella tiene 22 años de edad, soltera; La socia es egresada de la carrera de economía de la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco, la socia es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y empezar a trabajar en su carrera.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar su grado en la universidad y otra parte para apoyar en el negocio de sus papas que es una ferretería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Gabi is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gabi is 22 years old and single.  She is studying an economics degree at the Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco.  She is a very enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead in life and begin working in her profession.

Gabi will use one part of her loan to pay for her university degree and the other part to support her parents' hardware business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her university degree and to support her parents' hardware business

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana T. is 52 and married with 5 children between 10 and 24. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has three years experience in this business. Moana needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business — estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week — to improve and expand the business.

Moana joined SPBD in 2009 and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Moana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: B. Milton, 53, began selling cattle 20 years ago in Katoto-Ibanda. Before that, this reserved and down-to- earth married father of five sold agricultural produce. His determination, his friends say has gotten him this far and explains his longevity in a business which is highly competitive in western Uganda where many people own cattle. Milton ekes out additional profits from selling goats. Monthly this business generates 500,000 shillings for Milton and with this loan, he will buy more cattle to resell

loans.use: The purchase of cattle to resell

loans.name: Muhangi

texts.en: Muhangi G. R. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 50 years old and married, with eight children. He has a charcoal store in Bwambara Trading Centre that he has been running for over 20 years, and he works closely with his sons. On average, he makes 310,000 as monthly profits, although he still has another source of income, and that is the sale of secondhand clothes. The charcoal he burns himself with his sons; hence the cost is not very high. He is a dedicated man, and he needs a loan to be able to restock his business with more bags of charcoal and more secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.use: To restock his business with more bags of charcoal and more secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn P. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Ilyn is married and has 2 children, aged 5 and 2. To make a living, Ilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ilyn works hard to sustain her family and also be able to help her extended family.

Ilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ilyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hanifahon's Group

texts.en:
Hanifahon I., 19, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  In order to earn money,  Hanifahon sells fruits and vegetables seasonally with the help of her mom.  She is also engaged in the retail trade of fabrics and materials. Her mother started this activity 15 years ago with the initial investment of 8000 soms, and now the family together earns 27000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Hanifahon would like to increase the variety of fabrics and materials she can offer her customers. In the future, she is planning to celebrate her wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To  purchase fabrics and materials to resell

loans.name: Edwin Wilson

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 34 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Viven un su casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Paiján, una ciudad que pertenece a la provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que está a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 5 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea utilizar su crédito para realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Edwin puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Edwin es muy trabajador y responsable. Tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y tener ingresos para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old, married, and has three children. They live in their own home in a rural section of the District of Paiján, a city that is part of Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad, which is more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Edwin has been providing public transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi. This type of vehicle consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for carrying passengers. He wants to use this loan to make a few repairs to his motorcycle since it is wearing out with use. With these repairs, Edwin will be able to keep his motorcycle taxi in better condition so that he can provide better service to his customers and increase his income to cover his family’s expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Edwin is hardworking and responsible. He has good references from his neighbors and acquaintances. His greatest wish is to continue improving his quality of life and having income for his children’s future.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, de 63 años, es una mujer muy dócil y trabajadora. Es separada y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 4 hijos ya adultos e independientes. Por muchos años se dedicaba a la venta de anticuchos, comida que expende en las periferias de los paraderos de buses. Pero, desde que circulan los carros por su casa, puede vender con mayor comodidad, ya han transcurrido 13 años y le va muy bien. Es así desde las 3 de la tarde, sazona sus anticuchos, siendo la clave por el cual le resulta bien rico este platillo, que son vendidos desde las 6.00 de la tarde hasta la 1.00 de la madrugada, tiempo que es muy concurrido su establecimiento. Por ello con tu ayuda anterior ha comprado sus mesas y sillas, en donde ahora  posan sus clientes mientras se deleitan. Está muy contenta con la acogida de su negocio, siendo así que sola no se abastece, por lo que su hija la apoya. En gratitud a ello, le ha sugerido  adicionar otro negocio. Solo que ahora deberán afrontar las restricciones de la municipalidad,  debido a su toldo amplio en la puerta de su casa. En vista de ello tiene que cambiarlo por otro, pero más pequeño, asimismo piensa mejorar su espacio para atender a más clientes. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar, con la misma responsabilidad que antes. Ya que no quiere perder la ayuda reiterada de ustedes, y que le son de mucha ayuda. Con el crédito que solicita, hará cambiar su toldo por una nueva y más pequeña.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 63 years of age, is a very docile and hard-working woman.  She is separated, and lives in a house she owns, with her 4 children who are now grown and independent.  For many years, she dedicated herself to selling anticuchos near the bus stops.  However, since many cars pass by her house, she can sell from there more comfortably.  She has been in business for 13 years, and things have gone well.

Starting at 3 in the afternoon, she seasons her anticuchos, the key to the resulting delicious dish.  She sells from 6 in the afternoon until 1 in the morning, a time span when her stall is well frequented.  With your previous help, she bought her tables and chairs, where her customers now repose while enjoying her delicious food.  She is very happy with her business’ reception, which she does not supply on her own, as she has the support of her daughter.  

In gratitude, she has suggested starting a second business.  Only now they must face the municipality’s restrictions, due to the ample awning on the door of her house.  In light of this, she must change it for another, smaller one.  Concurrently, she is thinking about improving her space in order to tend to more customers.  

This is her second credit with MFP, and she commits to paying it back with the same commitment as before.  She does not want to lose the assistance you provide, which is a great help to her.  She will use the loan she is requesting to change her current awning for a newer one that is smaller.

loans.use: to buy a smaller awning.

loans.name: Óscar De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, Óscar se siente orgulloso de ser emprendedor y de trabajar diariamente largas jornadas para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. De su padre aprendió el oficio del campo y fue así como desde hace algunos años decidió darle vida a su propio negocio, es así como empezó a cultivar tomate de árbol, café, maíz y fríjol que son ahora su fuente de sustento. 

Los cambios climáticos, las plagas y la falta de recursos para mejorar su negocio, son algunas de las limitaciones a las que se enfrenta este campesino que actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios y reparar su invernadero.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Oscar feels proud to be an entrepreneur and to work long hours each day to provide a better future for his family and improve their quality of life.  He learned to farm from his father, and then some years ago he decided to start his own business, so he started to cultivate the tamarillos, (also known as tree tomatoes), coffee, corn and beans that are now his source of livelihood.

Changes in the weather, pests and the lack of funds to improve his business are some of the constraints that this farmer faces.  At this time he needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to repair his greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to repair his greenhouse

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, nacida en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, a los cuales ella los ha criado sola con su ardua labor, ella se dedica a vender ropa  y también tiene un salón de belleza. De hecho ella comenzó vendiendo mercadería ambulante, en las comunidades cercanas a Pueblo Nuevo, esto lo hizo por diez años. A los 35 años de edad, se dedico a vender ropa y cosmético y a cortar cabello todo esto lo hizo a través de un préstamo que le concedieron. Hoy en dia tiene su negocio establecido de venta de ropa, cosméticos y salón de belleza.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa nueva y  cosméticos para abastecer su tienda de nuevos y mejores productos. Con esta inversión espera aumentar su clientela, mejorar las ventas y ampliar su negocio.
Tiene como plan futuro seguir trabajando duro para preparar a sus hijos para la universidad  y componer su casa. Tiene como meta próxima ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina was born in Pueblo Nuevo, located in the Estelí municipality.  She is 45 years old and the single mother of two children, who she has raised alone through hard work.  She dedicates herself to selling clothing and also has a beauty salon.  She sells clothing door-to-door throughout communities near Pueblo Nuevo, which she has been doing for ten years.  At 35 years of age she started selling clothing and cosmetics, as well as cutting hair.  She managed all this through a loan that she was granted.

Today, she has well-established clothing and cosmetics sales and beauty salon businesses.  She requests the loan to buy new clothing and cosmetics to supply her store with new and improved products.  With this investment, she hopes to augment her customer base, grow sales and expand her business.  Her future plans are to continue working hard to prepare her children for attending university and improve her home.  Her next goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: buy new clothing and cosmetics to supply her store with new and improved products.

loans.name: Frente Al Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Frente al Sol esta integrado por 11 mujeres que se dedican al trabajo diario para sostener a sus familias, el grupo se llama así por que en el lugar donde se reúnen las personas está al descubierto y en las mañanas se puede apreciar el iN. de la mañana y del nuevo sol.
Brígida es una de la integrantes de este grupo, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Bernabé, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados y 2 estudian la Primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, ella iN. con este negocio porque en su casa se aburría mucho y ella necesitaba realizar hacer algo para distraerse y es por ello que empezó a vender ropa, al principio vendía poco ya que solo vendía con sus vecinas y familiares pero con el transcurso del tiempo han incrementado sus ventas ya que ahora sale a otras poblaciones para vender sus productos, para ella es  muy importante este negocio ya que aparte de que ocupa su tiempo, obtiene ganancias para los gastos escolares de sus 2 pequeños hijos y también para los gastos de su hogar.
Brígida solicito el crédito para comprar más ropa; ya que es la temporada en que la venta es muy buena y necesita tener mas surtido es por ello que comprara: blusas, faldas, playeras, camisetas, calzones, pantalones, gorras y con ello podrá surtir más y proveerles mas productos a sus clientes ya que ellos son el motivo importante por el cual su negocio sigue creciendo. 
Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio aunque hay ocasiones en que esta un poco triste y casi no hay ventas pero en otras ocasiones se recupera y le va muy bien; ella espera que le valla muy bien esta ocasión para que así pueda realizar sus pagos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 
Su deseo más grande es que sus hijos realicen una carrera y que estén bien de salud ya que son lo más importante de su vida.
El grupo frente al sol agradece por el apoyo atorgado por que gracias a ello pueden surtir de nuevo en su negocio y así podrán ir creciendo cada vez más. Sus integrantes son: Claudia, Alberta, Leonarda y Gudelia (Venta de antojitos), Patricia (Venta de calzado), Trinidad, Martha y Brígida (Venta de ropa), Laura (Venta de dulces), Lucia (Venta de pescado), Ana (Venta de perfumes).
texts.en:
The group named "Frente al Sol", meaning "Facing the Sun" is made up of 11 women who works every day to support their families. The group was named this because the location where they meet is in the open and in the mornings one can appreciate the start of a new day and the rising sun. 

Brigida is one of the members of the group. She is 39 years old and she is married with Bernabe. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are married, and 2 are in primary school. She has been selling clothing for 2 years. She started the business because she used to get bored at home and she needed to do something to keep her occupied, so she started to sell clothing. At the start her sales were low because she only sold to her clients and family but with the passage of time her sales have been increasing. She goes out to other communities to sell her products. This business is very important to her, not only because it occupies her time but also because it helps with the school expenses of her 2 young children and with the household expenses.

Brigida requests a loan to purchase more clothing. This is the season when sales are very good and she needs to have more variety. She will purchase: blouses, skirts, beach shirts, t-shirts, undergarments, pants, and hats.  She will increase the variety the products to offer her clients, as they are the most important reason why her business has been increasing. 

She comments that her business has been doing very well, although there are times when it is a little quiet and there are almost no sales. But during other times she is able to recover and it has gone very well. She hopes that it will go well so that she will be able to make her payments and to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Her greatest dram is to see her children earn a career and to be in good health, which are the most important things in life. 

The group "Frente al Sol" is thankful for the support granted to them and it is thanks to this that they will be able to revitalize their business and to keep it growing. The following is a list of the members: 

Claudia, Alberta, Leonarda and Gudelia: fast food sales
Patricia: shoe sales
Trinidad, Martha and Brigida: clothing sales
Laura: sweets sales
Lucia: fish sales
Ana: perfume sales

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale, including blouses, skirts, t-shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Lasticia Alfredo

texts.pt:
