Lasticia Alfredo nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo  sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 2 filhos de 2 e 8 anos de idade. Fez 10ª classe,mais 2 anos de curso de professores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ela. 

Saiu de Namaacha Para Boane por missão de serviço.Trabalha como professora permanente ha mais de 6 anos e é do quadro do Ministerio da Educação. Naõ possui nenhum empregado e tem como salario 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca fez emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, pedra, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa,os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt as duas vezes e ambos para habitação.

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para comprar um veiculo automovel.
texts.en:
Lasticia Alfredo was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who are 2 and 8 years old. Lasticia finished 10 grade plus 2 years of teacher training. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother by sending her money.

Lasticia left Namaacha to move to Boane on work assignment. She has worked as a teacher for more than six years and is on the staff of the Ministry of Education. She has no employees and has a salary of 6,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She is also able to save some money in her bank account at the end of each month.

She has never had loans from other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is Lasticia's third loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 16,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, beams, stone, zinc sheets and other items) to continue construction on her house. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais each, and both were for housing.

She promises to make her payments promptly so she can get other loans in the future. She intends to ask for more loans in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, beams, stone, zinc sheets, etc.).

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mr. Mom, 59, lives with his wife and five children. Three of his children are single, and two of them are employed in various jobs. Mr. Mom and his wife are local farmers who are able to make around $2 USD each day. The couple has longtime experience in the crop-planting business in the province of Kompong Cham. It is a skill they learned from their grandparents back when they were single. Mr. Mom will use the loan to pay for plowing costs and to purchase other materials to start planting crops. Mr. Mom is pictured with his wife under their wooden house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to purchase other materials to start planting crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 19 años de edad. Actualmente, la socia vive en la ciudad de Huarocondo y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella trabajó en la municipalidad de Huarocondo en el área de administración de desarrollo de económico como asistente. La socia ahora está estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración en el Instituto Superior ESITUP y ya está terminado. 

La socia y su mamá tienen un negocio familiar de venta de cerveza pues tienen un depósito donde se puede comprar la bebida las 24 horas del día. Ya son 4 meses que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza pues se está acercando las fiestas de la Virgen del Carmen.
texts.en:
Marilu is a responsible, hard-working person who, because of these traits, was invited by her friends to participate in the communal bank "Las Natividades" which belongs to the Arariwa Association.

She was born in the city of Quillabamba in the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco (Perú).  She is 19 years old and currently lives in the city of Huarocondo where she carries out her commercial activities.  She has worked in the municipality of Huarocondo as an assistant in the area of administration of economic development.  Currently she is studying for a degree at the ESITUP Superior Institute of Administration, and is almost finished.

Together with her mother, Marilu runs a business selling beer and has a 24-hour dispensing depot.  She has been in business for four months, and it is going well thanks to all her hard work.  She is requesting a loan to buy beer because of the upcoming festivities of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

loans.use: To buy beer.

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group

texts.en:
A decade is the time period that 38 year old Zulaika has been involved in a general merchandise retail business. The mother of 6 plies her business in the Jinja district. She was previously involved in farming and grocery store businesses, respectively. Many low denominator people find commodities sold by these small retail enterprises much cheaper than those sold by the supermarket stores which are mushrooming up in almost every town. This, therefore, means the small retail businesses can be lucrative. However of recent, the status quo has given rise to a rising middle class. These middle class people are increasingly partial to goods sold in the supermarkets, despite the price difference. This has, however, not dampened the spirits of most retail business people, including Zulaika. Her 10 year old experience in this business is clear testimony to her hard work and determination. She, however, has never rested on her laurels. She strives day in, day out to make new plans for her business, including expansion plans. She says she still has a lot of leeway to make up to see all her plans come to fruition.

Most of these retail businesses also operate on loans and the credit crunch in many respects adversely affected them. Zulaika, took this all in her stride. 
On the side, she ekes out a supplementary income from a poultry sales business. On a weekly basis, she makes gross profits in the amount of Ugandan shillings 120,000. She says with this requested Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, basins, toothpaste, beans, maize flour, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, basins, toothpaste, beans, maize flour, rice, etc to resell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 62 years old and is a married woman with seven adult children. Her husband is a farmer.

Lerma is engaged in farming. She assists her husband in managing their rice farm. Lerma also manages their sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, and noodles.

Lerma is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store. She hopes their farm and sari-sari store business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a farmer’s wife, living in a barrio with their six children. A barrio is a traditional division of a municipality officially delineated by the local authority. She is 56 but, because of extreme poverty, she continues to look for an income just to send her children to school to finish their education so that they may avoid the hardships of life which they are experiencing right now.

Rosalinda operates a store, selling candies, vinegar and cooking oil. She earns a net income of 2,000 PHP a month but this is not enough to cover their basic needs. Rosalinda stated that they are used to eating salt for breakfast. So, when she heard about Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. and their program to help the needy, she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy soft drinks and bread as additional goods to sell in her store. She hopes that it will allow her to meet the demands of her customers in order to generate more income to provide for her family's basic needs, such as food.

She is thankful that God gave her ASKI and extends her thanks to ASKI for the great service and companionship to needy people such as her.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bread for resale.

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
Jennebby is a 54-year-old, married woman with 10 children. Jennebby's younger children still attend school.

Jennebby is a farmer, and she works in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Specifically, she grows rice and vegetables on her land, and she then sells her harvest at her town's market.

She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and school supplies for her children. In the future, Jennebby would like to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her business (seeds and fertilizers) and school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Emily is providing jeepney, or multipurpose jeep services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of the vehicle.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future. Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of the vehicle.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Rosenda has a retail shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy food seasonings, spices and vegetables for resale.
Rosenda is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Samiarah

texts.en:
Samiarah is a smart and honest woman. She is married to a businessman and she is a loving mother of four children.  She works diligently to provide a good quality of life for her family. 

In order to earn money and support her family, Samiarah became involved in retail sales at the public market of Santiago City. She started her business in 1981 with the sales of women's and men's outerwear and other kind of dry goods. She wants to obtain a loan amounting to P20,000 for the purchase of stock blouse, pants, shorts and other kinds of dry good products for her clothing sales business. She would be glad if her request loan will be granted to maintain the business she manages. Maintaining her business would really help her most especially in increasing the income she manages and providing the allowances of her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock blouse, pants, shorts and other kinds of dry good products for her clothing sales business

location.town: Mabini Street, Victory Norte, Santiago City

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 12 años de edad, la socia trabaja atendiendo su salón de belleza, la socia es cosmetóloga y ella también  desea implementar su salón de belleza y también desea invertir   en el espacio que puso en su mismo local de venta de perfumes, peluches, y un poco de bazar. La socia invierte lo que ingresa de su negocio en el pago de estudios de su menor hijo y en esta ocasión desea implementar su salón de belleza y su tienda bazar ella comprara peluches para navidad, regalos, juguetes, papel de regalo entre otros y mejorara su salón de belleza con mejores peines, cepillos, ruleros, secadoras de cabellos entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de regalso para su bazar y de productos para su salon de belleza.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas". The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Rosa. She is 37 years old and she is married common-law. She has a 12-year old son. She has a beauty shop and she is a cosmetologist. She also wants to supply her beauty salon and she wants to invest in the sale of perfumes, stuffed toys, and some general merchandise, all in the same store space. She invests what she earns from her business in her son's education. At this time she wants to supply her beauty salon and her general store with the purchase of stuffed toys for Christmas, gifts, toys, wrapping papers and other products. She will also improve her beauty salon with better combs, brushes, rolls, hair dryers and other products. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of gifts for her general store and products for her beauty salon.

She is thankful for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments according the agreed payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase gifts for her general store and products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
Jose Adan tiene 23 años de edad, es casado, y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Jose Adan trabaja como pescador en una laguna ubicada cerca de su casa.  Jose Adan aprendió el oficio de su padre, quien le enseñó.  

Jose Adan sale a pescar todos los días. Durante el verano el entra a la laguna a las 7am y regresa a las 5pm. Durante la epoca de lluvia, el entra a la laguna a las 9pm y regresa a su casa a las 7am del día siguiente. Jose Adan pesca tilapia, bagre, camaron, mojarra, entre otros. Al salir de la laguna la mamá de Jose Adan lo espera para recibir la pesca y salirla a vender de comundad en comunidad, a pie. Debido a las torrenciales lluvias que cayeron en El Salador a mediados de Octubre, Jose Adan no ha podido salir a pescar por los ultimos 18 dias. La lluvia, la cual no paró por 10 días seguidos, causó que la laguna se sobrebordara y parte de la comunidad donde vive Jose Adan se inundara, desplazando a muchos de sus hogares.Jose Adan espera anciosamente que el nivel del agua baje en los próximos dias cuando planea regresar a pescar.

Jose Adan ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de un par de redes de pescar, y tambien para mejorar el techo de su casa. Jose Adan tiene otro préstamo con Fundación Campo, el cual esta pagando satisfactoriamente. Con la ayuda del prestamo Jose Adan podra tener mejores herramientas de trabajo, y evitar que el agua entre por el techo de su casa.

En un futuro Jose Adan quisiera poder comprar un vehículo para así salir a vender su pesca. De esa manera su mamá no tendría que salir a vender a pie.
texts.en:
José Adán, 23, is married and has two small children.  José Adán works as a fisherman in a lake near his house.  José Adán learned this occupation from his father who taught him.

José Adán goes out to fish every day.  During the summer he enters the lagoon at 7am and returns at 5pm.  During the rainy season he enters the lagoon at 9pm and returns home at 7am the next day.  José Adán fishes tilapia, catfish, shrimp and snapper, among others.  When he comes out of the lagoon his mother is waiting for him to receive the catch and go out to sell it in the community on foot.  

Because of the torrential rains that fell on El Salvador in the middle of last October, José Adán has been unable to go fish for the last 18 days.  The rain which did not stop for ten straight days caused the lagoon to overflow and part of José Adán community was flooded displacing many from their homes.  José Adán is anxiously waiting for the water level to drop the next few days so that he can return to fishing.

José Adán is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy a pair of fishing nests and also to repair the roof on his house.  José Adán has another loan with Fundación Campo which he is repaying satisfactorily.  With help from the from the loan José Adán will have better work tools and will be able to prevent water from coming in through the roof of his house.

In the future, José Adán would like to buy a vehicle to go out to sell his fish so that his mother won’t have to do it on foot any longer.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to repair his roof.

loans.name: Fonseca

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Nampula, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que ainda frenquenta a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e não continuou porque foi encorporado no serviço militar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a seu irmão enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas alimentares. 

Saiu de Nampula para Maputo em missão de serviço, é militar ha mais de 24 anos e negociante ha mais de 9 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos de primeira nessecidade e tem um rendimento somando ao salario de 13.890.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar produtos(arroz, amendoim, farinha, oleo, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt, 18.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt,  para o negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fonseca was born in the province of Nampula in northern Mozambique. He is married and has a son who is still in school. He went to school through the twelfth grade but dropped out because he joined the military. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his brother financially, sending him money to help with his food expenses.

He left Nampula for Maputo to complete his military service and has been a soldier more than 24 years. He has been a businessman for more than 9 years, selling staple goods. He earns a total of 13,890 meticals a month. He uses the money to cover household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (rice, peanuts, flour, oil, etc.) for his business. His other loans were in the amounts of 15,000, 18,000, and 20,000 meticals, which he also invested in the business.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, peanuts, flour, oil, etc.) for his business.

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es:
La Sra. Sobeida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 16 años que cursa el quinto grado del nivel secundario y el otro hijo de 17 años trabaja.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de asaditos (palto típico). Cuando tubo a sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de seguir trabajando para  apoyar en la economía de su hogar, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en servicio de motocar. Se inicia con un capital  de S/50.00 nuevos soles. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de asados, comidas como juanes, arroz chaufa y además refrescos de frutas. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00,  comprará  productos pollos , carne de res, ingredientes para sazonar, arroz  y azúcar por kilos, aceites en litros, racimos de plátanos, saco de carbón para asar sus  parrillas, utensilios de cocina para así captar nuevos clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos .
Sobeida  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio más grande y variado, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer.
texts.en: Ms. Sobeida belongs to the communal bank "Amor y Paz" [Love and Peace] of the district and province of Moyobamba, department of San Martín. She is 35 years old, in a committed relationship, and has two children, one who is 16 and attending the fifth year of post-elementary school, and the other child, who is 17, is working. From a very early age she has devoted herself to selling barbeque snacks (traditional fare). When she had her children, she found herself in need of continuing to work to support the household economy. Her partner devotes himself to providing transportation services by moto-car. She started off with 50 Peruvian soles in capital. Currently she devotes herself to selling barbeque and dishes such as juanes [stuffed rice tamales] and chaufa rice as well as fruit drinks. With this loan of 300 Peruvian soles she will purchase products such as chicken, beef, seasoning, rice and sugar by the kilogram, oil in liters, bunches of bananas, bags of charcoal for her grills, and kitchen implements in order to gain new customers and keep them satisfied. Sobeida is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a larger business with greater variety. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for bringing her this opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as chicken, beef, seasoning, rice and sugar by the kilogram, oil in liters, bunches of bananas, bags of charcoal for her grills, and kitchen implements.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; tiene 62 años de edad, la socia es viuda y tiene ocho hijos, ella tiene una pequeña casa, y está ubicado en la zona rural del Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la comunidad de Arin a 15 minutos de la provincia de Calca, y a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad, agrícola, ganadera y turística que desarrollan sus pobladores.

La socia Julia se dedica principalmente a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cria pollos y chanchos, ella hace crecer y engordar a los animales y después los vende a sus clientes. La socia también alterna sus actividades con la elaboracion de chicha a base de maiz amarillo mediante un proceso de fermentacion se obtiene la muy conocida y rica chicha de jora, con un valor nutricional conciderable, La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y en la compra de maiz amarillo para la elaboracion de chcihca de jora.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA D. ARIN” communal bank, located in the Arin district, part of the Calca province and Cusco department.

Julia is 62 years old, is a widow and has eight children.  She has a small house, located in the rural zone of the Valle Sagrado valley of the Incas, within the Arin community, located 15 minutes from the Calca province, and 45 minutes from Cusco.  These zones are known for their agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Julia mainly raises small animals, such as chickens and pigs, fattens them up and then sells them to her customers.  She also makes yellow corn chicha (a fermented drink maD. from corn) through a fermentation process that renders the well-known and delicious chicha, with a considerable nutritional value.

She is asking for this loan to buy small animals and yellow corn to make chicha.

loans.use: La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y en la compra de maiz amarillo para la elaboracion de chcihca de jora.

loans.name: Judith Isilma

texts.es:
Judith, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de una mesa amasadora, para moldear el pan, ya que necesita de esta herramienta para mejorar su producción, aumentado la posibilidad de mejorar la venta.
Estos préstamos le ayudan para que su negocio sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Judith is asking for a new loan in order to buy a table kneading machine in order to make bread because she needs the machine in order to increase her production, improving her sales. 

The loans help her to make her business to be even better.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine in order to make bread

loans.name: Pablino

texts.es:
Pablino es de la ciudad de Caacupé, tiene 38 años, está acompañado con Norma. Pablino es mecánico, a lo que se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años, gracias a esa experiencia que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela.
Sus clientes siempre quedan muy contentos con los resultados que el da, ya que lo definen como una persona muy trabajadora y muy honesta. Nos cuenta que gracias a su taller y a un ahorro que tenia, pudo montar en su casa una despensa bien surtida, la cual es atendida por su esposa. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para los vehículos que repara en su taller, ya que eso le será de gran utilidad a la hora de hacer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pablino is from the city of Caacupé.  He is 38 years old and lives with Norma.  Pablino is a mechanic and has been working in this trade for more than 20 years.  Thanks to this experience, he has been able to form a good customer base.

Pablino's customers are always very happy with the work that he does.  They describe him as a very hard-working and very honest person.  He tells us that, thanks to his auto repair shop and some savings that he had, he was able to set up a well-stocked grocery store in his home where his wife works.  Pablino's dream is to continue growing and, in this way, to continue helping his family.

Pablino is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for the vehicles that he repairs in his workshop.  This will be very useful to him when he comes to do his work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to use in his workshop

loans.name: Yenny Julieth

texts.es: La joven Yenny Juliteh, con 21 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia donde tiene a cargo un hijo de 1 año de edad. Yenny ha trabajado anteriormente en un almacén vendiendo ropa interior, donde aprendió algunas técnicas de ventas. Asistió a una orientación de ventas por catálogo donde decidió montar su propia venta de mercancía de uso personal como salud, belleza y hogar. Desde entonces ha podido contactar varios clientes y ha visto como se aumentan sus ventas a medida que pasa el tiempo. Con el sueño de poderle brindar a su hijo una buena educación y poder darle todo lo que necesita, Yenny requiere de la compra de mercancía para la venta de modo que sus clientes tengan mas opciones a la hora de elegir sus productos, de esta manera aumentará sus ventas, sus ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en: Yenny Juliteh is 21 years old. She is a mother and head of household, raising a one year old son. Previously, Yenny worked at a store, selling underwear, where she learned a lot of sales techniques.  She attended a catalogue sales orientation for personal use merchandise for health, beauty and the home. Since then, she has been able to contact several customers and has seen her sales increase with time. With the dream of being able to offer her son a good education and give him everything he needs, Yenny needs to buy merchandise. This way, her customers will have more options to choose from when they select their products. Thus her sales and income will increase, and she will be able to improve her and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Rosario esta solicitando un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el equipo adecuado para la venta de tacos de barbacoa , ya que quiere agregar esta comida a su menú de alimentos a su pequeño negocio de venta de comido. 
Los que atiende el negocio son Doña Maria Del Rosario y su esposo quien son los que preparan la comida y atiende a sus clientes. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Desea invertir en el negocio y así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario is requesting a loan to buy the proper equipment to sell barbequed meat tacos, because she wants to add this dish to her food menu in her small food business.  

Maria Del Rosario and her husband are the ones who run this business, preparing the food and tending to their customers.

This business is the source of income for their family, and it allows them to provide for the needs of their children.  Maria wants to invest in the business so that she can have greater earnings.

loans.use: to outfit her kitchen so that she can make and sell barbequed meat tacos

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en: Shamimu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She makes chips, beef,chicken at the market on retail basis . She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, chicken,deep fryer,cabbage and a bag of irish potatoes. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of irish potatoes. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. She would like to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, chicken,deep fryer,cabbage

loans.name: Lhanghoi A Shg Group

texts.en:
Nemneikim is 38 years old married woman and is a mother to 4 children (three sons and a daughter). She is the representative of the group” LHANGHOI A SHG” and also the feature member with the hand raise in the picture. Her husband is a farmer and they reside in Saikul.
Nemneikim has already avail loan from WSDS to start her weaving business. She weaves traditional wrap around skirts for women and sell them. Since the income she and her husband gets are not sufficient to meet the daily needs of the family and also for paying fees, she wanted to weave more to get more income.
Nemneikim applies for the loan so that she could buy yarns so that she could weave more traditional wrap around skirts and sell them to earn more income. She also has a long-term goal of purchasing a handloom for her business. She is very happy with the funders and WSDS for their generosity and is looking forward for the loan.
Likewise the rest of the members are engaged in activities like poultry, selling garments and weaving and are eagerly waiting for the loan to start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy yarns of different colors and textures for weaving traditional skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Furundis would like to buy top dressing fertilizer for her maize plantation

loans.name: Maria Rafaela

texts.en:
4 years ago, Maria Rafaela started to sell natural products because her husband had to retire, and the pension he was receiving was very low. This caused serious economic problems for them, and María's income became very important: it is now their means of support. Now, she needs a $250 loan to buy merchandise and make her business grow.

María has worked very hard to help with the family's expenses. She is a very active and responsible woman, and is certain that she will be able to return the loan within 3 to 6 months. She is thankful for your sincere support. Helping her is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Hace cuatro años que Maria Rafaela inició con la venta de productos naturistas, fue cuando su esposo se quedó sin trabajo, por ser una persona mayor, lo jubilaron y la baja pensión que recibía, hizo que su hogar tuviera serios problemas económicos. Fue así como el ingreso que Maria recibía por la venta de sus productos se volvió muy importante, pues este representa el sostén para su familia. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que planea utilizar en compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

La señora Maria ha trabajado muy duro para poder contribuir con los gastos familiares, ella es una mujer muy activa y responsable y confía en devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, y agradece sinceramente tu apoyo, en tus manos está el ayudar, hazlo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Surni

texts.en: Surni is a 35 year old mother and is married with four children. Two of them are boys and two are girls. Her husband, Pardi is a fish seller, earning about $4 in a day.    To supplement her husband's income, Surni sells vegetables, instant noodles, and Indonesian salad called "gado-gado" at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $30 in a day as an income.  Surni needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio is married and he has three children. Formerly, he worked in the United States, but the desire to be with his family motivated him to return to Mexico. To obtain the necessary resources for his wife and children, because of the lack of employment, he decided to start his own business one year ago. He rented a location and started offering his services repairing and painting cars. Little by little he became better-known and the high quality of his work has helped him increase the number of his customers and expand his business.

Now Ignacio is requesting a loan for $325, which will be used for remodeling his location, changing the electric fixtures and improving the look of his business to offer better service to his customers. He agrees to repay this loan in 4 months. Please decide to support Ignacio and his family by contributing to the growth of his business. They are sincerely grateful for your confidence and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ignacio es casado y tiene tres hijos, anteriormente trabajaba en Estados Unidos pero el deseo de estar con su familia lo motivó a regresar a México. Para obtener los recursos necesarios para su esposa e hijos, ante la falta de empleo, decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace un año, rentó un local en donde comenzó a ofrecer sus servicios de carrocería y pintura, poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y la buena calidad de trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Ignacio está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, cambiando las instalaciones eléctricas y mejorando el aspecto de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Ignacio y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Berta David

texts.pt:
Berta David M. is 40 years old, she lives with her husband and child in the neighborhood of George Dimitrov in Maputo. Berta operates a small grocery store form her home, she joined the FDM program in 2004, and requested a loan of 18.000MT. She is now in the 5th cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 10.000MT to be repaid in 6 months. Berta has noticed an improvement in her business, the increase in income has helped to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Berta David M. tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de um filho.Vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo. Tem uma mini mercearia na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em 2004 como membro de grupo e tomou 1.800MT como primeiro empréstimo.Já vai no 5º ciclo como cliente individual e pretende tomar 10.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Tem verificado crescimento do volume de negócio e os lucros têm ajudado a melhorar a casa e tem pago as prestações pontualmente.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
We find Abraham working energetically to cultivate bananas and pineapples. He dedicates a great amount of time to this every day, trying to build a better future for himself and his 5 year old son. Abraham became a single father after his wife left him and their young son in his care. He would like to make a bigger investment in his business and begin to sell his produce in the city of Santa Ana. This would enable him to save enough money to cover the needs of his son, create a safe and secure home and enjoy happy moments together. He is counting on your kind support.

Encontramos a Abraham, maestro de obras, trabajando animosamente en sus tierras cubiertas de platanales e inmensas y deliciosas piñas, a las que les dedica mucho tiempo con el propósito de forjarse día a día un futuro mejor para él y para su hijo de 5 años a quien su madre abandonó y lo dejo bajo el cariño y cuidados de su noble padre.Aprendió las labores del hogar desde que empezó a dedicarse a cuidar a su pequeño niño, mostrando gran habilidad y destreza. Abraham desea tener una mayor inversión de dinero en la producción de plátanos y así empezar su negocio de comercialización en la ciudad de Santa Ana, con el cual podrá empezar a ahorrar dinero para cubrir las necesidades de su pequeño, de manera que junto a su hijo puedan compartir momentos de alegría y el anhelo de establecerse en un hogar muy seguro. Contamos con su gentil y noble corazón.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS BUSINESS CULTIVATING AND SELLING BANANAS AND PINEAPPLES, ENABLING HIM TO SAVE MONEY AND BETTER CARE FOR HIS YOUNG SON.

loans.name: Margarita Micaela

texts.es:
Margarita Micaela, despite her 60 years, works hard to support her family. She has 9 children though only 2 still live with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She earns a living making shoes which she sells at various markets in the area.

Margarita is a member of the Mujeres Valerosas ("Courageous Women") community bank from which she received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), money that she used to buy rubber soles and shoe patterns. She recently received a loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, with which she will buy synthetic materials, soles, pigments, leather and patterns because she has orders to fill for end-of-year celebrations.

Margarita is president of a locally-popular canteen called Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn"). Her greatest hope is to have a well-established workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita Micaela a pesar de sus 60 años de edad trabaja mucho para mantener a su familia. Tiene 9 hijos pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de calzado, el mismo que distribuye en los diferentes mercados del Distrito de La Esperanza. La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en este banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con los que compró plantas de goma y hormas. Recientemente ha obtenido un crédito de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (aproximadamente $167) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, con este dinero comprará material sintético, plantas, pegamentos, cuero, hormas porque tiene pedidos que atender de calzado de fiesta para estas fiestas de fin de año. La señora Margarita es presidenta de un comedor popular de su sector llamado “Nuevo Amanecer”. Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica bien implementada.

loans.use: Buy materials for shoe-making business.

loans.name: Khatamova

texts.en: Khatamova K. lives in Nausky, Tajikistan. She has been the client of the MicroInvest since 2003. She started her business practically from the scratch. She traded in small wares but thanks to the loans she has taken she improved the business and opened a trade outlet in the bazaar. Now Mrs.Khatamova trades in children and womens shoes. She is experienced in  business (about 10 years) and she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams about the good and assured future for her children.  Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has  repeat customers. She works with suppliers who give her the opportunity to work with the clients of  different income levels.  The prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices. Mrs.Khatamova requests the loan of $350 to provide  new models and to widen the existing assortment.

loans.use: to provide  new models and to widen the existing assortment

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: 32 years old, Moses is a father of two children and a wife.  Moses started his business as a trader in Makeni town.  Life was not easy with his irregular income.  With previous, small loans, he was able to rent a small shop in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  He is requesting for a $1,050 loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: To expand his business further with additional capital.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Mrs. Om Y., 46, is married with six children and works selling groceries at her house, earning around $7 a day in revenue. Her husband supports the family as a farmer,. He grows rice and makes on average $2.50 a day. Two children are employed by a garment factory in Phnom Penh city with a salary $70 each a month. Two others are waiters, and the rest of the children stay at home helping their parents with their work. To make the business grow, Om decided to appeal for a loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products. With the rest, they will use it in the side business of raising pigs for additional income. This will give the family a more stable income.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products, and also to raise pigs for additional income.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Mrs. Sahida H. lives in Dhalko. Dholko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops, and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Manjuro H. and he works in house construction. The living conditions of her family are not good because her husband has no regular work. So sometimes her husband doesn’t have any income.

So as to overcome this problem, Mrs. H. opened her beauty parlor two years ago. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work in a salon training institute in her locality. Her service is only for ladies . Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen S. is 32 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells planks and has been in business since 2003. She has learned for three years from a friend, Mrs. Eboigbe. She is requesting for a loan of $1,200 so that she can buy more timbers that she can then sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba E. sells banku, okro stew, and yams. These are local dishes, which are very popular here in Ghana. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a police officer is not sufficient enough for Araba and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Gudelia decided to sell beer and soda in her house because there were few stores close by. Actually, however, there were soon various bodegas around; consequently, she decided to engage in a parallel activity. It was this way that her daughter proposed the idea of selling clothing and shoes by request. Gudelia has been doing this for four years. Her clients are her friends and the acquaintances of her daughter and husband. Gudelia also sells cosmetics through a catalogue. The loan for which she has asked is for buying more clothing to offer her clients. She would like to have a place in the market and sell her products there.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años, Gudelia decidió vender cervezas y gaseosas en su casa debido a que habían pocas tiendas alrededor. Sin embargo, en la actualidad las bodegas abundan, por lo que decidió incursionar en alguna otra actividad paralela. Fue así que su hija le propuso la idea de vender ropa y zapatillas por pedidos. Así pues, Gudelia se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años. Sus clientes son sus amistades y conocidos de su hija y esposo. Gudelia también vende cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece a sus clientes. A ella le gustaría tener un puesto en el mercado y vender sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.es:
Edelisa is 39 years old, she lives with her husband and her three children; 17, 15, and 8 years of age. She sells clothes offering a variety of models for all ages from door to door. She has been doing this daily for the past 3 years. It is not difficult for her to sell her merchandise as everybody likes her and she has succeeded in obtaining clients that place monthly orders. Edelisa enjoys offering her products as she has got a lot of friends everywhere, and that is very favorable for her. Nevertheless, the weather makes it difficult as it is exhausting to walk hours and hours in the blazing sun. Edelisa wishes to invest in buying more merchandise to be sold at the fairs, and later on, she wishes to purchase a motorcar as motorized transportation in the jungle represents the most favorable investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Edelisa tiene 39 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17,15 y 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo que realiza de forma ambulante por las calles, ofreciendo de puerta en puerta los diversos modelos para todas las edades. En esta actividad se ocupa todo el día, hace más de 3 años. No le es muy difícil vender su mercadería, puesto que con su gran simpatía ha logrado tener clientes que le hacen pedidos mensualmente. A Edelisa le agrada el ofertar sus productos, porque puede tener una gran cantidad de amigos por todos lados y eso es favorable para ella. Sin embargo, lo dificultoso es tener que lidiar con el clima, pasar horas de horas caminando en pleno sol, lo que es muy agotador. Edelisa desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercedaría para vender en las festividades, de la misma forma, desea con el tiempo, adquirir un motocarro, ya que en la selva el transporte en moto es la mejor inversión.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 22 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 2 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Mariam is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Oem Sarad's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group of nine people is located in Trapang Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and the members will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Oem S. was selected as the group leader; she is currently in the business of selling clothes. In her business, she sells all kinds of clothes, especially those for the young generation. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Hoeng Sok, helps her in the business. Mrs. Oem S. is 46 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining five children attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Ghafooran M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son completed his education till 5th standard and started a business of selling woods. Her younger is a daily wage laborer. Ghafooran baji's husband has a bangle selling business. He has been selling bangles for the past 2 years.

Ghafooran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more bangles for her husband's bangles selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and tools) for her sanitary business. Azra baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils for her utensils selling business. Samreen baji wants a loan to buy CDs for her CD shop. Jameela baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more bangles to resell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna Arevallo, 40 years old, married and the  mother of 3 children is a new CEV client from Matina, Davao City.  She wants to expand her business but needs assistance to market her products. 

People come to her for new sandals. She makes as well as sells them in her town as a way to address all her family needs. She borrowed capital from her parents to start up her business. The sandals sell for 100-120 pesos from which she able to earn 50-60 pesos profit per pair. 

Edna needs an additional $125 of capital to expand her business. She will use the money to purchase additional materials for making sandals. 

Edna wants to own a stall in the market in Davao City. Now that she has joined CEV, she has access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance benefits CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sandals

loans.name: Sodelba

texts.es: Sodelba es pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la elaboracion de productos lacteos para comercio local, lo que le brinda el sustento familiar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, diariamente muy temprano acopia la leche la que luego procesa en queso y cuajadas, los fines de semana venda fritanga a estudiantes de la UNAN; en la actualidad tiene un hijo en la universidad contando este unicamente con el apoyo de su mamá, su mayor sueño es que su hijo se dradue de medico, para locual necesita financiamiento para reforzar su pequeño negocio y alcanzar su meta de preparar a su hijo que sera en el futuro el encargado de su sustento.
texts.en:
Sodelba is a small businesswoman who makes milk products to sell locally, thus providing support for her family and her children’s future. Very early every day she gathers the milk which she will later process into cheese and cheese curds. On the weekends she sells fried food to the students at UNAN. Today she has a son in the university depending only on his mother’s support. Her biggest dream is that her son becomes a doctor, for which she needs financing to support her small business and meet her goals of preparing her son who will be, in the future, responsible for support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sell milk products

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. R. is a widowed rice farmer who lives in Krakor Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are married and two are single. One single daughter is employed as a garment worker who can earn around $4 per day and help to support the family's living. One son works growing rice with R.. Because rice farming is the main source of income for the family, R. needs a loan to buy two oxen to use as physical labor for her farming business, and one cart to use for transportation.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to use as physical labor for her farming business, and one cart to use for transportation.

loans.name: Crucian

texts.en: E. Crucian is 44 years old and has been a farmer in the Cimislia district for more than 12 years. E. launched her business in 1998 and it has been successful but now she is struggling because she can't afford to buy the equipment she needs to expand her business. She would like a loan from MicroInvest to obtain these materials. E. is glad that Microinvest is willing to give loans to such customers who have a desire to work hard but do not have the working capital.

loans.use: To buy farm materials and equipment

loans.name: Ustobobo

texts.ru: Устобобо женат, ему 39 лет, имеет  3 детей. Сотрудничать начал в этом году, обратиться в Микроинвест посоветовали друзья. Раньше он работал на стройке , но такая тяжелая работа, которую предлагают только летом или когда тёплая погода, ему не по душе. Сейчас он торгует конфетами и другими сладостями на рынке г. Худжанда. Реализация проходит хорошо, он планирует кредитоваться и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Ustobobo is 39, married, and has three children. He began working with MicroInvest this year following the advice of friends. Earlier he worked in construction, but it is very hard work which is only available in the summer or when the weather is warm. He did not enjoy it. Now he sells candy and other sweets in the city market in Khujand. His sales are good, so he plans to get financing now and in the future.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Mr. Chhen V. is a 30-year-old father of four who lives in Trapaing Veing village in Takeo province.  He farms rice on his own plot of land, and his wife, Mrs. Pak Toem, sells homemade soya-bean. Two of their children attend the local school and the other two are still too young to work or study.  Mr. Chhen V. is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow for breeding, which will provide additional income for his family.  Both Mr. Chhen V. and his wife Mrs. Pak Toem are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Azizatou

texts.fr:
F. Azizatou est née vers les années 1980 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Azizatou est mariée à TIDJANI Yacoubou; elle est mère d’un seul enfant de nom de Henri. Azizatou vend des produits cosmétiques et produits pour bébé (habits, biberons, chaussures, couches, etc.). Azizatou achète ces produits au grand marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, Capitale du Togo (pays frontalier au Bénin). Azizatou a eu deux prêts de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu augmenter le niveau de son activité. Aujourd'hui, Azizatou sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Azizatou F. was born around 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Azizatou is married to Yacoubou Tidjani; she is the mother of an only son named Henri. Azizatou sells cosmetics and baby items (clothing, bottles, shoes, diapers, etc.) She buys these products from the big international market of Benin and in Lomé, the capital of Togo (a country that borders Benin).

Azizatou has had two loans through ALIDé and she reimbursed them correctly. They allowed her to expand her business. Today, Azizatou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital so as to respond to the needs of her clientele more completely.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing and shoes for babies, toilet soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: A medium-size wooden house located in Pursat Province belongs to Mrs.S., age 42. Since 2000, S. and her husband have been running a business growing crops. The family relies on both seasons for growing, including the dry season and the rainy season. Beside growing crops, the family has been widely known for a long time as skilled in raising pigs. Because of financial problems, they could not afford to raise pigs since their income is just enough for the basic needs of the family. Hence, Mrs. S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva as capital to purchase piglets to raise. The couple has three teenage children who are attending school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 48ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier.
Grâce à la bonne organisation de cette association traditionnelle, elles ont eu à bénéficier de la part de l’ONG ROCAM des formations en teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement et la réorganisation des tontines en caisses de micro crédit avec un intérêt de 10% par mois.
Ce groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les jouets  pour enfants, les galettes  les savons, le bois de chauffe, les jus de boissons, des pagnes wax  etc. 
Dans leurs recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leurs 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acheter,  28 pièces de pagnes wax, 57 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 2 sacs de sucre, 1 carton d’essence, 25 kg de feuilles d’oseilles de Guinée et 25 kg de tamarin. Elles se ravitaillent en différents articles au grand marché de Bamako,  avec les forains de Sansanding et Thien Bamanan, à Diamarabougou et sur les berges du fleuve Niger. Les articles sont vendus en ambulant au marché et de porte en porte à Diamarabougou alors que le bois est d’abord fendu puis mis en tas à domicile pour la revente à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour payer les frais de santé des enfants.
 Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir une charrette et un âne pour le transport du bois de chauffe et des personnes pour aller dans les différentes foires.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Danaya are married, mostly in polygamous families, and average 48 years of age and 6 children each. The women all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of marriage and membership in the same traditional women's association in the area. Thanks to the correct organizing of this traditional association, they've benefited through the NGO ROCAM from training in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, and organizing micro-credit tontines banks with an interest rate of 10% a month. This group does commerce in various goods, such as toys for children, cakes and cookies, soaps, firewood, juices for beverages, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), etc. In their search for supplemental financial resources, the women decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones. This new loan will be used to buy 28 bolts of Wax pagnes, 57 cart-loads of firewood, 2 sacks of sugar, a box of flavorings, 25 kg of dried hibiscus flowers, and 25 kg of tamarind. The group members resupply themselves with different goods at the grand marketplace of Bamako, from the fair vendors of Sansanding and Thien Bamanan, in Diamarabougou, and on the banks of the Niger River. The goods are sold in an itinerant manner at the marketplace and door-to-door in Diamarabougou. The firewood is first split and then placed into basins at home for resale to a mixed customer base. The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 51,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to cover the healthcare costs for the children. Their ambition is to obtain a cart and donkey for transporting firewood and people in order to go to different fairs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar Barrientos is managing a piggery a short distance from his house. He is 36 years old and still single. He is working very hard to make his business flourish. He was a construction worker before. He stop working construction and decided to have a business to manage instead.
He would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase pig feed and this will really help him grow his pig business. In this way, he will be able to save for his future family.
CEVI provides financial services to the poor--not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: R. Firuza has a small clothing-sales business located at Vahdat market in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. In business for 5 years, she has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business and help meet the needs of her family. Firuza currently sells a selection of children’s clothing. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Somoni to help purchase inventory to sell. She enjoys being self-employed and would like to continue growing and developing her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зеби женщина . которая кредитуется пятый год.Она работает учительницей в школе, но по выходным дням она выходит торговать посудой на большой рынок. Её оборотный капитал на так уж большой . Поэтому она берёт не большой кредит, для закупа сахарниц и солонок.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Zebi is a woman who has been taking out loans for five years. She works as a school teacher, but on weekends she sells housewares at a large market. She doesn't have much working capital, so she would like a small loan to buy sugar bowls and salt shakers.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housewares

loans.name: Samuel Muiruri

texts.en:
Samuel Muiruri N. is a petty trader who runs a retail shop in Nderi shopping center, on the outskirts of Nairobi city. He has been running this business for over four years. He estimates that he has been posting a profit of Kshs 16,000 per month.

He has not borrowed from any other financial institution before, but this will be his second loan with KADET. He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale business and grow his current client base.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Procurring additional stock for his retail business

loans.name: Santa Martha Group

texts.es:
Jazmina del Socorro G. M., María  Antonia C., Lidia de los Ángeles G. L. y María del Rosario N. A., son las integrantes del grupo Santa Martha, originarias de la comarca Nandayure, perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya. Ésta comarca está ubicada en una zona rural a 2 kilómetros del centro de Masaya.

Jazmina es la coordinadora del grupo, ella elabora hojuelas a base de harina y las vende en su comarca, su oficio lo aprendió desde que tenía 9 años, cuando su tía le enseño a elaborar este tipo de productos, al llegar ella a una edad mayor se caso y decidió seguir realizándolas para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja en una panadería, con los gastos del hogar.

Jazmina pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad de  productos para poder vender también en la zona de Masaya y ampliar sus ingresos.

El grupo Santa Martha lleva ya 12 ciclos con ADIM, y a lo largo de estos 3 años han aprendido a ser solidarias y esforzadas en el crédito que mantienen activo.

María del Rosario tiene una pulpería, Lidia trabaja como costurera, elabora vestidos de niños y también vende tortillas para solventar el gasto del hogar y doña María Antonia trabaja en la elaboración de hojuelas al igual que Jazmina.
texts.en:
Jazmina del Socorro G. M., María Antonia C., Lidia de los Ángeles G. L., and María del Rosario N. A. are the members of the Santa Martha Group. They are from the region of Nandayure, which is part of the city of Masaya. This region is located in a rural area 2 kilometers from central Masaya.

Jazmina is the group coordinator. She makes hojuelas (pancakes or crepes) made of flour and sells them throughout the region. When she was 9 years old, her aunt taught her how make this dish. As she got older, she saw this as an opportunity to help her husband (who works in a bakery) with the household expenses.

Jazmina intends to use her loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients so that she can also sell her products in the Masaya area and increase her revenue.

The Santa Martha Group has already had 12 previous loans with ADIM over a 3 year period. They have learned to be supportive of one another and work hard to maintain their credit.

María del Rosario has a grocery store. Lidia works as a seamstress making children’s clothing, but she also sells tortillas to meet her household expenses. Doña María Antonia makes and sells hojuelas just like Jazmina.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 5 hijos, ella estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en el  centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra ganado ovino.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas, para mejorarlas y venderlas en las ferias de ganado que son los domingos en Ilave, Pilcuyo, la Sra. Rosa también vende productos de la región.

Su deseo es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a business lady who owns a food kiosk in Mihang’o Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 in order to add to her stock of flour, rice and sugar. Victoria hopes to open many branches of the same business and have a stable family one day. She describes herself as friendly and a peacekeeper.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
M. is a 26 year old mother of three who runs a retail shop in Mukuru slums Nairobi. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of foodstuff and general merchandise in her shop. She has been running this business for one year and hopes to grow it into a well established business. She also hopes to have a happy and fruitful life. She describes herself as honest and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, soap, sardines and other foods and beauty products

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a resident of Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alfredo Jr. but they do not have any children yet.  They aim to improve their status of living to ensure their future. They help each other earn income for their survival and to save for their future. 

Her husband works as a utility person in Bagabag Municipal Office while Amalia buys and sells charcoal in their village.  Since charcoal is in demand in their village, she wants to improve business by having more capital. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP16,000 to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell in their village.  She hopes this will be a great help to improve her small business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Enea M. from Tukuyu. She is married with one child.  Enea has been running a clothes business since 2005, purchasing and selling clothes.  She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members. Enea currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business.  In the future, she plans to start a new business. Enea thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions and pagnes

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
Batbuyan is 46 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, 24, attends university, her daughter, 21, is unemployed and her two sons, 16 and 19, both attend university while the youngest three are in a local secondary school.

Batbuyan operates a consumer goods retail business, with the help of his wife, in two rented stalls at a local market. They sell different kinds of consumer goods such as socks, shoes oil, soap, detergent etc. He began his business in 1998 and over the years, his business has grown and become successful. In the near future, he is planning to increase his product line and grow his customer base. Batbuyan makes iron products such as fire tongs and pots to supplement his earnings. Batbuyan is requesting a 650,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more household goods such as pots, pans, silverware, dishes, etc. for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more household goods such as pots, pans, silverware, dishes.

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Sam Oeurn S. lives in Kaoh Reah Kraom village in the Kandal province. He is 63 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Yen Machh, are grocers in the local village to support their family. Although their business is doing well, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. 

In order to expand this business and improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Sam Oeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to resell. This couple does not have children. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products and support their farming

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia S. is from the town of Sto. Niño, San Agustin. She is 49 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 19-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $110 a month from this activity.

In 2006, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maricela Group

texts.en:
The Marisela Group consists of three woman: Marisela E., Karla E., and Santos Gutiérrez. The coordinator is Marisela, who began her business by selling cold drinks, ice creams, and ice.
