She would like the loan because she has decided to begin using her earnings to convert her business into one which makes and sells custom clothing.

The other members of the group are Karla, who began selling vegetables and other items in 2000, and Santos, who has been selling clothing for the past four years.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for the business

loans.name: Karen Rose

texts.en:
Karen Rose M. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Karen Rose is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Karen Rose owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Karen Rose has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen Rose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Karen Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 38-year-old father of three sons and four daughters. Ahmad, his eldest son, works in carpentry while the rest are school students.

Majed's business is ten years old. He digs wells and holes for construction-supporting columns and cleaning old buildings' stones. The machines he uses need maintenance so he applied for a loan from FATEN for this purpose. He hopes that maintaining his machines will help him earn more money and allow him to purchase more advanced machines.

Majed says that working in this field in his small town Qalqilia is good but with the primitive machines he uses it's not rewarding regarding time management.

Majed appears in our offices in Qalqilia in the picture above.

loans.use: Machine maintenance

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married pregnant woman with six children between the ages of 13 and 2 years old. Her children all attend school except for the youngest. She also cares for two additional family members as their father (her brother-in-law) has died. Her husband is a carpenter and she has a shop where she has been selling detergent, eggs, flour, cooking fat, and sugar for the past year. 

With the Ksh. 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more items for her shop such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, and detergent. She also wants to repair her business premises. Her greatest challenge is that some people buy on credit but never pay her. She wanted to join Yehu because she saw other women benefit. She owns her home but does not have water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are water, food, and school fees. Rukia hopes to educate her children so that in the future they can help her.

loans.use: More items for her shop such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, and detergent and to repair her shop

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mr. Un C. currently works in the construction field. He is 31 years old and resides south of Phnom Penh City. He has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. Un C. was married many years ago to Mrs. Yorn Leng, age 28. She is a sewing worker in the industry. By working, this couple is able to make around $10 each day to be responsible for their family. Un C. will be using his loan to build a hedge around his house to protect his property.  He will use any remaining money from the loan to improve his construction service. (Mr. Un C. was busy at his business activity when the photo was taken so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To build a hedge around his house to protect his property.

loans.name: Tehatsi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TEHATSI, porque en otomí significa “buenos días”. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  13 integrantes.

 La Sra. María Elva P. Ramírez  es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 23 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es comerciante  y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón). Ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y costura que inició hace 9 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en maíz. Sus clientes son vecinos D. la localidad. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar maíz. También espera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos.

 Irma es, un integrante del grupo Tehatzi y esta foto fue tomada en su casa donD. tiene su taller, en la foto se ve las diferentes cruces que realiza pues ella se dedica a la venta D. cruces D. tronco D. árbol  que inició hace 4  años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y poder realizar sus Artesanías. Sus clientes comentan que son artesanías muy bonitas, ellos se las compran y las venden en los semáforos del Estado D. Toluca.  
Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta.  Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es soltera y no tiene hijos. También espera que con sus ganancias,   Irma pueda ayudarle a su mama para la escuela D. sus 2 hermanos 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
- LETICIA M. M.      VENTA D. ROPA
- TOMASA R. Z.         COSTURAS
- IRMA M. O.          VENTA D. ARTESANIAS
- FRANCISCA R. Z.      VENTA D. PELUCHE
- JOSEFINA O. R.        VENTA D. TORTILLAS
- RUFINA Z. D. J.      VENTA D. DULCES
- HILARIA Z. G.     VENTA D. PELUCHES
- TERESA M. S.        VENTA D. RESINA
- ANGELINA R. Z.       COSTURA
- GLORIA F. G.        COSTURA
- EMILIA G. R.         VENTA TORTILLAS
- MARIA ATILIANO L.          VENTA D. RESINA.
texts.en:
This group is called TEHATSI, because in Otomí that means “good morning”. It is located in the state of México. The group is maD. up of 13 members. Mrs. María Elva P. Ramírez is the president of the group. She is 23 years old and she went to school until 6th graD.. She is a merchant and she has a total of 2 chilen (1 girl and 1 boy). She has sold tortillas and sewing for 9 years. She is asking for the loan to invest in corn. Her clients are the area residents. At this time, asking for the loan, she is content. She also hopes to help her husband with expenses. Irma is a member of the Tehatsi group and this photo was taken in her house where she has her workshop. In the photo the different crosses that she makes can be seen. She sells crosses maD. from tree trunks and she has been doing this for four years. She is asking for the loan to purchase wood to be able to make her artisan crafts. Her customers comment that they are very pretty. They buy them and sell them at streetlights in the state of Toluca. At this time, asking for the loan, she is content. She is 43 years old and has a 6th graD. education. She is single and has no children. Irma also opes that with her profits she can help her mother with her 2 brothers' schooling. The other members of the group are: - LETICIA M. M. CLOTHING SALES - TOMASA R. Z. SEWING - IRMA M. O. SELLING ARTISAN CRAFTS - FRANCISCA R. Z. SELLING STUFFED ANIMALS - JOSEFINA O. R. SELLING TORTILLAS - RUFINA Z. D. J. SELLING CANDY - HILARIA Z. G. SELLING STUFFED ANIMALS - TERESA M. S. SELLING RESIN - ANGELINA R. Z. SEWING - GLORIA F. G. SEWING - EMILIA G. R. SELLING TORTILLAS - MARIA ATILIANO L. SELLING RESIN

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and wood

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 33-year-old metal fabricator who does manufacturing, welding, and tinsmithing for wholesalers in his region.  He has been in this business for 9 years and has 5 employees.  Fredrick is married and has 3 children, 1 boy and 2 girls, from 7 months to 8 years old. 

The primary business challenges he faces are the unreliable power supply and the fact that high quality raw materials are not readily available.  In addition to his metal shop, Fredrick also sells spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles at a local market.  Before owning the metal shop, he operated a bicycle transport service (“boda boda”). 

Fredrick plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase materials for welding and spare parts for bicycles.  

In the future, he hopes to earn enough money to provide a quality education for his children.  In 5 years, he dreams of purchasing a plot of land for commercial and residential purposes.

Fredrick describes himself as honest, kind, and humble.

loans.use: To purchase materials for welding and spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Mariuxi Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariuxi de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y tiene tres hijos. Ella vende comida por la ventana de su casa, afuera tiene una mesa para los clientes que quieren comer allí (observen la foto). 

Antes de vender comida en su casa, ella trabajaba en un puesto de la esquina de su casa de comida pero al ver que era bueno sus ingresos decidió trabajar desde su casa haciendo la comida, poco a poco compro sillas y mesas plásticas para mas comodidad de sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas víveres para cocinar ella quiere comprar con el préstamo carnes, arroz y bebidas para su negocio de venta de comida. En el futuro quiere tener muchos mas clientes y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
32-year-old Mriuxi lives in a house made of reeds in the settlement el Fortín in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has three children. She sells food from the window of her house. Outside she has a table for her customers that want to eat there (see the photo). Before selling food from her home, she worked at a food stand on the corner by her house, but seeing that the income was good, she decided to work from home making the food. Little by little she bought the plastic tables and chairs for her customers. She works from 10am to 7pm every day. In order to increase her supplies of food, she wants to use the loan to buy meat, rice and drinks for her food-selling business. In the future she wants to have a lot more customers and her children to continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, meat and rice

loans.name: N'danida

texts.fr: après son apprentissage, T. a ouvert son atelier de coiffure qu'elle a appelé " BENEDICTION", elle est très connue dans son quartier , afin d'augmenter ses recettes elle a associé à son activité le commerce de produits de beauté. la demande de produits de beauté est de plus en plus élevée, c'est pourquoi elle voudrait s'approvisionner et demande un crédit chez WAGES pour acheter des mèches, des tissages et diverrs autres produits de beauté. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
After her apprenticsehip, Ms. T. opened a beauty salon called "Benediction." She is well-known in her neighborhood. To increase her income, she also sells cosmetic products, the demand for which is growing, For that reason, she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy braids, extensions and other cosmetic items. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy braids, extensions and other beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, hired workers and zinc.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas esta formado por 9 mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras y sobre todo que ven  la vida con mucha alegría, buscan con su trabajo diario brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, también cuenta con un centro histórico muy hermoso siendo el orgullo de sus habitantes.

La Señora Jenny T. vive por el sector de la Feria Libre, tiene 24 años, es divorciada y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres pero de una manera independiente, el papá de su hija se ha hecho responsable de pasarle la pensión mensual alimenticia.
Nuestra socia se dedica a 2 actividades de trabajo la primera es la venta de animales domésticos como son perros, gatos, conejos etc., realiza sus ventas de lunes a domingo todos los días, se dedica a este trabajo hace 4 años, también estudio para estilista en una academia y  se dedica a esta actividad  hace 6 años. Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y una amiga que pertenece al banco comunal fue quien la invito y le está muy agradecida, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales y así ir creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es  viajar a los Estados Unidos para estudiar y perfeccionarse como estilista.
 
La Señora María H. vive por el sector de San Joaquín en la ciudad de Cuenca, se dedica hace 2 años a la limpieza de oficinas los 5  días de la semana, no tiene horario fijo, ya que sale cuando termina su trabajo, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes a los mismos  que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad o los utiliza para su consumo.
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija está en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja en una ferretería y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. Es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada por una gran amiga quien la incentivado para que se beneficies de estos pequeños créditos, su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de cuyes para crecer en su negocio. Su meta es construir un galpón para pollos y así tener  más  ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas (Progressive Women) communal bank is made up of 9 tenacious, enterprising women who face life with good cheer and seek through their daily work to provide a better future for their children. They live in the city of Cuenca, Ecuador’s third most important. It has a very beautiful, historic city center that is the pride of its residents. Mrs. Jenny T. lives in the Feria Libre sector. She’s 24 years old, divorced and has a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in her parents’ house but independently. Her daughter’s father has taken on the responsibility of providing her with a monthly food allowance. She is involved in two work-related activities. The first is the sale of domestic animals like dogs, cats, rabbits, etc. She sells from Monday through Sunday every day. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. She also attended an academy to study cosmetology and has been a hair stylist for 6 years. She has collaborated with us for 3 years; a girl friend of hers who is a member of the communal bank invited her and she is very grateful to her for this. The new loan will be used to buy more animals so that her business can grow. Her goal is to travel to the United States to study and become a better stylist. Mrs. María H. lives in Cuenca’s San Joaquín sector. For the last two years she has cleaned offices five days a week. She does not have a set schedule because she gets off work when the work is completed. She also raises guinea pigs that she sells when she has to raise money and also uses them for family consumption. She is 28 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years of age. Her oldest daughter goes to a local school. Her husband works in a hardware store and their effort as a couple has resulted in their being able to build their own house. This is her first loan with the foundation. She was invited by a girl friend who motivated her to avail herself of these small loans. She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs so that her business will grow. Her goal is to build a shed for chickens thus producing additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rabbits, guinea pigs, dogs, cats.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam T., 46, is married with two children living at home in Kampong Cham province. She sells vegetables and fruit, typically making US$ 5 each day. Her husband, pictured here, is a taxi driver. Her husband typically makes about US$ 10 each day. Eam T. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a car for her husband to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita B. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and is married with two adult children.

Esterlita owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and licenses

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old woman who resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agriculture industry.  She is a caring lady and prefers to stay at home and take care of her family. She cooks delicious food for her family so they stay healthy. She does not have a well-built house but she never complains to her husband and spends her life happily with him in the two-room brick house.  Her husband's name is N. A. and he is involved in an animal-selling business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He specifically deals with goats because his clientele base is butchers so he sells goats to them to earn a profit. He buys goats from the animal market at cheap rates and sells them at a good profit. Due to his good knowledge of animal breeds, his customers contact him to arrange animals for them. In this way, his family financial circle runs. 
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy goats in bigger quantities and fulfill the orders of his customers. She is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband and his income will double in size.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy goats to resell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Sophia A.  is 48 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the west Nile region of Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children.  Four of her children are currently in school.  Sophia has a business of selling silver fish, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Sophia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock more of the silver fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sophia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Sophia hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: buying silver fish for resale

loans.name: Ingrid Lilibeth

texts.es:
la sra. Ingrid S. vive en el Barrio San Sur de la ciudad de Choluteca, es madre de 1 hijo.
Ingrid se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion.
Ingrid y su hijo viven en la casa de sus padres, por eso les ayuda economicamente con los gastos del hogar.
Ingrid se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para fabricar sus ricas tortillas y luego salir a venderlas, tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos para terner una mayor produccion de tortillas y asi tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Ingrid S. lives in the San Sur neighbourhood of Choluteca city, and is the mother of one child.  Ingrid makes and sells tortillas, a business she runs out of her home.  Ingrid and her son live in her parents' house and help them with the household expenses.

Ingrid gets up every morning at 4 o'clock to make her delicious tortillas and then goes out to sell them.  She also raises hens.  She'll use the loan to buy corn meal, firewood, lime, water and phosphorus to produce more tortillas and make more sales.

loans.use: Purchase of corn meal, water, lime, firewood, and phosphorus

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Victoriano;   él tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabaja vendiendo plásticos y productos como baldes, tachos, pelotas entre otros productos; El socio tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de plásticos desde hace 14 años y todos en el pueblo lo conocen en la época de lluvias el llega a vender todos sus rollos de plástico grueso, los pobladores llegan a desesperarse en la época de lluvias que forran sus casitas con plástico para evitar que se remoje con la lluvia el adobe de sus casitas humildes. El socio necesita comprar productos por que las lluvias se avecinan y el implementara su tienda.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar plástico.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Victoriano is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazon de Jesus de Ccatccapampa”, which is located in the District of Ocongate in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 57 years old, married, and has five children. Victoriano is a native of Ocongate. He sells plastics and products such as buckets, trash containers, balls, and other items. Victoriano has a small store where he has been selling plastics for 14 years. Everyone in town knows him and comes to his shop during the rainy season to buy rolls of thick plastic. The villagers come in desperation during the rainy season so that they can line their homes with plastic to prevent the moisture from seeping through the walls of their modest adobe houses. Victoriano needs to buy products for the approaching rains and to keep his store in operation, so he is requesting a loan to buy plastic.

He appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase plastic to sell during the rainy season

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a widow. She has survived two tragedies in her life -- she lost both her husband and her son. However, Anastasia didn’t give up on life and the opportunities it offers. She had a daughter to provide for. She started her own small business 8 years ago. Today she is still running it in one of the local marketplaces of her home town of Drogobych called ‘Malyi’ (‘Small’).  Anastasia is selling women’s lingerie. Presently, she has already invested 20,000 Grivnyas in her enterprise.  

Anastasia is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase merchandise for her vending kiosk. Assorted selection of lingerie items will help her attract more potential buyers and thus stay competitive with other market vendors selling the same type of inventory. The profit generated will provide funds sufficient to meet Anastasia’s basic needs. One day, Anastasia hopes to move her business from the marketplace to a small welcoming store somewhere in the town of Drogobych.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie merchandise for resale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Hellen has a business of selling fish, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Hellen hopes to become a teacher.    Hellen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
don Luis Antonio G. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Luis es una persona emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de peliculas, musica, fajas, bolsas y protectores para celulares, peines, cepillos entre otros productos.
su negocio esta ubicado en las afueras del mercado nuevo de Choluteca, todos los dias viaja de su comunidad hacia el mercado de choluteca.
Luis es padre de 5 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando.
trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
en sus tiempos libres visita a sus hermanos y demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de productos que vender.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Antonio G. is 41 years old and lives in the village of San Geronimo.  He is an enterprising person who sells movies, music, belts, bags and cases for cell phones, combs, and brushes, among other items.  His business is located on the outskirts of the new market of Choluteca.  Every day he travels from his community to the market of Choluteca.

Luis is the father of five children who are all in school.  In his free time, he visits his siblings and other relatives.

He will use this loan to buy more merchandise and therefore to have a greater variety of products to sell.  He needs the income to help his children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy DVDs, CDs, movies, boxes for CDs and DVDs, belts, bags and cases for cell phones, combs, brushes, and flashlights

loans.name: 21 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “21 de Diciembre” iniciará su  onceavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, han superado este ciclo, identificado sus virtudes y debilidades.  Está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: tejido de chompas a ganchillo, artesanía de tejido en mantas, venta de verduras, artesanía de tejido a mano, costura de prendas deportivas, transporte, macramé.

La señora Dionicia, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte del B.C. “21 de Diciembre” desde hace diez ciclos, aproximadamente cinco años. Casada, madre de tres hijos, su negocio es el de macramé, desde hace más de ocho años, ella aprendió a realizar esta artesanía pasando un curso auspiciado por la Radio Inca,  a partir de los puntos básicos de macramé que aprendió ahora la señora Dionicia puede crear sus propios diseños.  Esta habilidad le permite seguir la moda de macramé en mantas de chola, que según indica cambia cada tres meses.  El crédito que ha solicitado le permitirá comprar tela y flecadura. Actualmente elabora su producto a pedido de sus clientes, de esta manera no necesita un puesto de venta y al permanecer en su domicilio puede cuidar de sus hijos y de su hogar.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la oportunidad de compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The 21 de Diciembre communal bank will begin its eleventh loan cycle at Pro Mujer. As part of the Casada Community Center, they have completed this cycle and have identified their strengths and weaknesses. The group consists of eleven members and their businesses are varied: crocheting sweaters, knitting blankets, selling vegetables, hand-knitting handicrafts, sewing sports clothing, transportation, macramé.

Dionicia, the president of the communal bank, indicates that she has been part of 21 de Diciembre communal bank for ten loan cycles, or approximately five years. She is married, the mother of three children, and her business has been macramé for more than eight years. She learned to make this handicraft in a course sponsored by Radio Inca. From the macramé basics that she learned, Dionicia can now create her own designs. This skill allows her to follow macramé fashion in ‘chola’ blankets, which changes every three months according to her. The loan that she has requested will allow her to purchase fabric and fringe. She currently makes her product at the request of her customers and this way, she doesn’t need a place of sales and in staying home, she can take care of her children and her home.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she commented that she likes the opportunity to share with her fellow group members.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and fringe

loans.name: Abdulio

texts.es:
Don Abdulio de 47 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y una hija de 4 años de edad, ellos alquilan vivienda y don Abdulio posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, dedicándose por más de 12 años a este oficio, realizando trabajos a clientes de diferentes puntos del departamento de Morazán, también en su casa realiza trabajos para aquellos clientes que viven cerca.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hierro y un compresor, el hierro lo necesita para salir con un trabajo pendiente y el compresor pues es muy necesario para realizar todo el proceso en el taller, con esta inversión don Abdulio terminara de fabricar su trabajo pendiente y con la ayuda del compresor será más eficiente y  sus trabajos serán de calidad.
Sueña con ampliar el taller, contar con todas las herramientas necesarias para realizar un buen trabajo y proveer para su familia todo lo necesario así como también ahorrar para comprar un lugar propio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mr Abdulio, age 47, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department, with his wife and one 4-year-old daughter. They rent their home, and Abdulio has a metal workshop. He has had this business for over 12 years. He makes items for customers from different areas of the Morazan department. He also makes items in his home for those customers who live nearby.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of iron and a compressor. He needs the iron in order to finish a pending order, and the compressor is very necessary for the entire metalworking process. With this investment, Abdulio will finish his pending order, and with the help of the compressor he will be more efficient and his work will be of good quality.

He dreams of expanding his workshop and having all of the necessary tools for doing a good job. He also dreams of being able to provide his family with all of their necessities, and saving up to buy their own home.

loans.use: the purchase of iron and a compressor

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENDIYA sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leurs entreprises, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles achètent avec les  prêts des céréales (tel Fanta SINAYOGO), des condiments alimentaires et des ingrédients pour faire de la restauration.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Fanta S., compte acheter, 5 sacs de 50 kg de riz fumé, 2 sacs de 100 kg de maïs et 2 sacs de 100 kg de petit mil.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants au niveau des cultivateurs pour en suite revendre dans son magasin à son domicile en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BENDIYA solidarity group are married women who average 49 years of age and four children each. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came together as neighbors, through their business activities, and through ties of kinship.

In order to satisfy customer demand and expand their businesses, they joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They use their loans to buy cereals (Fanta S.’s activity), condiments and cooking ingredients.

With this new loan, Fanta S. plans to buy five 50 kg sacks of smoked rice, two 100 kg sacks of maize, and two 100 kg sacks of millet. She gets her stocks from farmers in the surrounding villages and conducts her retail sales from the shop in her home, for cash and credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA part of which will be reinvested in her business, the other portion to be used for her children’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo O. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 39 years old. Romelo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Romelo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish, like sardines & milk fish, in the local community. He also makes and sells snacks, like bibingka (a variety of rice cake).  Romelo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Romelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Romelo is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Romelo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children.  She sells clothes to earn a living for her family.  She has employed two people in her business.  She has engaged in the business for six years.  

She has been able to add business stock through her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  Hence her business has improved.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 50,000 kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen P. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a business operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from operating tricycle transport services. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Aileen joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aileen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Marilyn Maria

texts.es: Marylin  Benítez vive en el barrio la Playa en un lugar cercano  al mar, ella  es casada y tiene una hija de 25 años; Marylín tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece servicios de internet,   llamado “Cyber la antorcha encendida  Internet”, el cual inició hace diez años  cuando  comercializaba  con productos,  mediante guías especializadas o catálogos; desde hace un año Marylin designó un lugar en la casa donde vive su hija, para emprender un punto de venta,  así fue como ubicó las primeras vitrinas y empezó exhibiendo su mercancía;  este negocio es atendido por su hija y  ella también genera ingresos para si misma, mientras Maryling acompaña su esposo en un edificio donde él trabaja como vigilante y le apoya con los gastos familiares. Ella compra sus mercancías  principalmente en el centro de la ciudad y trabaja con sus revistas,  ofreciendo  a sus clientes las mejores ofertas del mes, para darle la oportunidad de que adquieran a más bajo costo lo que necesitan en un plazo de 21 días. En la actualidad  está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y requiere comprar perfumes confitería , prendas de fantasía útiles escolares electrodomésticos menores, porque sus cliente demandan muchos productos y ella quiere estar a la vanguardia, dando respuesta oportuna a la solución de sus deseos y necesidades de compra.
texts.en:
Marylin Benítez lives in La Playa neighborhood which is near the sea.  She is married and has a 25 year-old daughter.  Marylín owns a general store where she also offers Internet services called "Cyber la antorcha encendida Internet" (Cyber the lit torch Internet).  She started her business ten years ago, selling products through specialized guides or catalogs.

One year ago, Marylín put aside a space in the house where her daughter lives in order to establish a sales location.  She put up her first display cabinets and started displaying her merchandise.  Marylín's daughter looks after the business and she also makes income for herself.  Meanwhile, Marylín accompanies her husband in a building where he works as a security guard and supports him in covering the family expenses.  

Marylín mainly buys her merchandise in the city.  She works with her catalogs, offering her customers the best offers of the month.  In this way, she gives them an opportunity to acquire what they need at a lower cost with repayment over a period of 21 days.

Marylín is currently applying for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She needs it to buy perfumes, sweets, costume jewelry, school supplies and small electrical appliances because her customers request a lot of products and she has to be at the forefront, fulfilling her customers' wishes and meeting their needs in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sweets, costume jewelry, school supplies and small electrical appliances

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while the other three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Fatuma has operated a cafe business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, she experiences a high number of customers compared to the months of January to July when she has a low customer turn-out. She dreams of establishing a permanent business block to let in the future.
With her loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase three sacks of charcoal, twenty liters of cooking oil, mugs and plates for her cafe business. She decided to work with Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal, twenty liters of cooking oil, mugs and plates for her cafe

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
A travers les relations de mariage et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de pagnes, de fruits et de céréales à l’image de Kadiatou D.. 
Avec l’idée d’améliorer son pouvoir d’achat et de faire assez de stock, elle a décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son cinquième  prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Kadiatou D. fait le commerce des céréales dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 1tonne de petit mil, 600kg de maïs et 700kg haricot. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women. They have an average age of 38, and 5 children. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. They live in Masablacoura, one of the districts in the city of Bougouni, in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali. Linked by married and business ties, these women sell pagnes, fruit, and grains just as Kadiatou D. does. 
In order to increase her purchasing power and obtain more stock, she decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her fifth group loan and all of the previous loans were repaid in full. 
Mrs. Kadiatou D. sells grains in the Bougouni Grand Market. With this loan, she plans on buying 1 ton of millet, 600 kg of corn, and 700 kg of beans. She buys her stock from suppliers in the surrounding villages and then sells them retail, for cash and credit in the Bougouni market to a client base made up of both men and women. 
With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA which will be used to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción es un señor de 59 años de edad, él vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria en Chiclayo. Asunción es conocido en la zona por ser un hombre honrado y trabajador y tener una sólida unión familiar.

Asunción tiene una gran experiencia realizando labores agrícolas. Él cultiva en sus propias tierras que están ubicadas a 20 minutos de distancia de su hogar. Asunción tiene 20 años de experiencia en este rubro.

Asunción solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles que  utilizará para abonar su cultivo de arroz y así poder tener una producción optima que le permita generar ingresos para su hogar.

Asunción  estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues el desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Asunción is a 59-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife in the rural section of the District of La Victoria in Chiclayo. He is known in the area for being an honest man, working hard, and having strong family ties.

Asunción has plenty of experience as a farmer. He cultivates his own land which is located 20 minutes away from his home. Asunción has 20 years of experience in this trade.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. The funds will be used to fertilize his rice field so that it will result in optimal production. This will allow him to generate household income. Asunción is very grateful for the loan that was granted because he wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost to fertilize his rice field.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia es una madre soltera de 49 años de edad, ella vive con su hijo y con su familia en la pequeña zona rural La Florida, ubicada en la provincia San Miguel en Cajamarca. Anastacia es una mujer alegre  y emprendedora que tiene una voluntad constante de ayudar a los demás.

Anastacia tiene una bodega en su propio domicilio, la cual está instalada hace más de 15 años. Allí vende todo tipo de abarrotes (fideos, leche, huevos, enlatados, arroz, azúcar, etc.) así como golosinas y bebidas. Su bodega es una de las más surtidas en la zona y por ello cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes.

Anastacia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su bodega (abarrotes). Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Anastacia ya ha tenido un crédito con nuestra entidad que canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Anastacia es una madre soltera de 49 años de edad, ella vive con su hijo y con su familia en la pequeña zona rural La Florida, ubicada en la provincia San Miguel en Cajamarca. Anastacia es una mujer alegre  y emprendedora que tiene una voluntad constante de ayudar a los demás.

Anastacia tiene una bodega en su propio domicilio, la cual está instalada hace más de 15 años. Allí vende todo tipo de abarrotes (fideos, leche, huevos, enlatados, arroz, azúcar, etc.) así como golosinas y bebidas. Su bodega es una de las más surtidas en la zona y por ello cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes.

Anastacia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su bodega (abarrotes). Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Anastacia ya ha tenido un crédito con nuestra entidad que canceló puntual y responsablemente.

loans.use: Comprar abarrotes.

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.ru: Камолидин житель города Худжанд. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена работает в колхозе и ежедневно получает 15-20 сомони. Сам Камолидин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он у себя дома создал все условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 8 лет. В сезонный период его ежемесячный доход составляет 1000 сомони. Он берет кредит для того чтобы закупить крупнорогатый скот и увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Kamolidin lives in Khojand.  He is 58 years old.  He is married.  He has three children.  His wife works on a collective farm and earns 15-20 somoni every day.  Kamolidin earns a living by raising cattle. He built everything necessary to raise cattle at home.  He has been doing this work for eight years.  In season, he earns 1000 somoni a month. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last ten years.  He is 50 years-old, married to Jane and they have three children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.  He normally sells his produce at the local market.

In the future, Gibson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia nació en la ciudad de Huarocondo de la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 33 años de edad. Actualmente, la socia vive en la ciudad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella se dedica al engorde de ganado. Ya son 6 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chanchos para hacer platos típicos como chicharrón para las fiestas de la Virgen del Carmen.
texts.en:
This borrower is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Las Natividades' community bank.

The borrower was born in the city of Huarocondo, in La Convención province, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 33 years old and currently lives in the city in which she was born.  This is where she carries out her business, fattening livestock.  She has been in this business for six years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, the borrower needs a loan to buy pork so that she can make traditional dishes such as 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds) for the Virgen del Carmen fiestas.

loans.use: to buy pork

loans.name: Irene Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Rosario de 47 años de edad convive con el sr. Antonio hace mas de 25 años tiene cinco hijos los cuales tres son independientes, La Sra.  Rosario mas conocida como Charito vive en la zona los lote la Sra. Rosario trabaja como ambulante hace 23 años vendiendo (toallas para baño, toallas de cocina, pañuelos, medias y otros de acuerdo a la temporada tiene variedad de mercadería). El crédito que se te otorgo es para la compra de mas mercadería (compra de chompas, bufandas y otros) El cliente agradeció infinitamente a la institución por la agilidad y eficiencia que se le atiende siempre ya que ella es cliente antigua en la Institución.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosario, 47, has lived with Mr. Antonio for more than 25 years and they have five children together. Three of their children are independent now. Ms. Rosario, better known as "Charito," lives in the Los Lote zone. She has worked as an itinerant vendor for 23 years. She sells bath towels, kitchen towels,  handkerchiefs, hosiery, and other merchandise that varies depending on the season.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise, such as jackets, scarves, and other items. Rosario is infinitely grateful to Emprender for the ease and efficiency with which her loan requests have been handled, as she is an old client of the organization.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like jackets and scarves

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 47-year-old lady who has two children, ages 7 and 12. She has operated her business for three years. With this loan, she plans to buy a container of human drugs/ medicine from Uganda so that she can have enough inventory for her shop in Nairobi, Kenya. 

From the anticipated profits, she will pay her children's eduction expenses. She dreams of becoming a leading pharmaceutical supplier in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy drugs and medicines

loans.name: Catherin

texts.en: Catherin is 43 years old. She is a widow with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Catherin requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity. 

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a food stall business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major seasonality in her business. She dreams of purchasing real estate in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for tailoring and to purchase food products. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring and to purchase food products.

loans.name: Tue's Group

texts.en:
Tue was born in 1964. She lives in Cau Ca village, Co Loa commune. She has three children. They grew up. Her main job is farming. Not only growing rice, but also raising pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VietnamD. (VND). She has previously participated in SEDA; the last time she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
About other borrowers in her group:
Doan is 39 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy scrap-iron to resell.
Ngan is 32 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 29 years old and he is single. He was not able to enter college and finish a degree. Instead of lazing at home, he engaged himself in rice farming. He plants and harvests rice and  sell it in advance to traders when he harvests. Being a responsible son, he also gives remittances to his parents. Profits earned are used to pay electric bills and meals for the family. 

In his half-hectare plot of land, he needs to pay for labor costs for those who help him cultivate and prepare for the next planting season and transplant the seedlings. He is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds and pay for farm cost.

In the future, he wants to achieve more crop production and save for future expenses. He also wants to have his own family and children to sustain someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for farm costs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, and other supplies for the shop. It will help John generate greater profits and finish paying for the construction of a rental room that is attached to his house. John hopes that in the future he will be able to move into wholesale selling. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and other supplies

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale depuis 2009.  Elle à une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des boissons et des produits d’alimentation générale  après achat  à LOME. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
Akouvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut augmenter la marchandise avec le profit réalisé. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akouvi voudrait avoir une autre boutique de vente d’alimentation  dans un autre quartier.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 30, is unmarried. She's been reselling food products since 2009. She has a store where she sells beverages and food products that she buys in Lomé. She has one person helping her with her business.

Akouvi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy food products. She wants to bolster her stock with her profits. In the forthcoming years, Akouvi would like to open a grocery store in a different neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy food products and liquors

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es:
María de Jesús cuenta con 46 años de edad, es casada tiene 6 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando Joel estudia la preparatoria 2º grado, Brisa esta en 3º de secundaria, Mariana 2º de secundaria, Omar en 6º de primaria y Gerardo esta en 3º de primaria, el más chico esta en 3º de preescolar, su esposo se llama Julio se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio frutas por temporada e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras a doña maría de Jesús le gustaría incrementar su negocio y así tener ingresos para ayudar con la educación de sus hijos ya que Joel esta aun año de finalizar la preparatoria y entrar a la carrera ya que le gustaría estudiar para ingeniero en sistemas.

María de Jesús pertenece al grupo de flor del campo el cual está integrado por 10 personas las cuales son todas mujeres a continuación eran mencionadas:

María Gianelli, Divina, Diana, Flaviana, Luz Divina, Gilberta, Bertina, Claudia, Yaneli, todas se encuentran realizando una actividad comercial como son: venta de ropa, carnicería, dulcería, frutas y verduras, pollerías, joyería, etc.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is 46 years old, married and has six children who are going to school.  Joel is in second year of high school, Brisa is in third grade of secondary school, Mariana is in second grade of secondary school, Omar is in 6th grade of elementary school and Gerardo is in third grade of elementary school; the youngest is in preschool.  Her husband’s name is Julio and he’s a farmer.

She sells seasonal fruit and vegetable and will use her loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  María de Jesús would like to increase her business and have income to help with her children’s education since Joel is a year from completing high school and will start studying a career since he’d like to become a Systems Engineer.

María de Jusús belongs to the “Flor del Campo” group which has 10 members, all women, who we list next:  María Gianelli, Divina, Diana, Flaviana, Luz Divina, Gilberta, Bertina, Claudia and Yaneli.  Each one is involved in her own commercial activity like: clothing sales, butcher shop, candy store, fruit and vegetable sales, chicken shop, jewelry store, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Umoja Farm Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel is the facilitator of the Umoja Farm group. Ezekiel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ezekiel takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed his family and to afford farm inputs. In the recent 2011 season, Ezekiel had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ezekiel was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ezekiel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Ezekiel will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Umoja Farm group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Ezekiel is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Roberto tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.

Él se dedica desde hace 10 años a la estructura metálica, su jefe fue quien le enseño. Los materiales para realizar su trabajo lo compra en una ciudad del oriente del país que esta a treinta y cinco minutos de su casa.

El préstamo lo solicita para construir una cocina en su vivienda, para que su esposa pueda cocinar ahí. Él comenta que el tener acceso al préstamo le ha permitido ir haciendo mejoras y construyendo en su vivienda. Esto le permitirá tener una casa digna para él y su familia. En un futuro desea construirle una o dos habitaciones a su casa.
texts.en:
Roberto is 30 years old and lives with his life partner and a son.

He has been working with steel structures for 10 years. His boss taught him the job. He buys the materials to carry out his job in a city in the east of the country, 35 minutes away from his home.  

He requests the loan to build a kitchen in his house, so that his wife can cook there. He adds that having access to loans has allowed him to make improvements and further build his house. This will allow him to have a decent house for him and his family. In the future he wants to add one or two more rooms to his house.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 51 años de edad ,es asalariado tiene dos hijos a sus cargos vive con su esposa, toda la vida su mayor sueño que ha tenido es de mejorar su vivienda junto con su esposa ha luchado para tener una vivienda digna para sus hijos. Actualmente Francisco está solicitando  crédito para mejorar su vivienda lo cual quiere comprar Zinc, cemento,  puertas, alfa guillas entre otras materias prima para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 52 years old, and he is a salaried employee.  He has two children under his care, and he lives with his wife.  All of his life his greatest dream has been to improve his home.  Together with his wife he has struggled to have a decent home for their children.

Francisco is currently requesting a loan to improve his house.  He will buy corrugated zinc sheeting, cement, doors, and rafters, among other raw materials to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated zinc sheeting, cement, doors, and rafters, among other things.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has two school going children. Isabella owns a boutique, a business she began seven years ago. She is applying for a loan of KSH 80,000 to purchase a new stock of clothes in preparation for the Christmas festivities.Her main challenge is during the low season; she makes few sales during such periods. The extra income from this loan will be used to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To to purchase a new stock of clothes

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos y sus nietos ya que hace algunos meses se separó de sus esposo con quien tuvo muchos años de matrimonio. Pero como es una mujer fuerte y luchadora está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para más adelante poder vivir una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Rayda consiste en la venta de productos en su pequeña pero muy implementada tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa. Son 16 horas diarias las que pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche. Su bodega es una de las más concurridas de barrio, ya que sus vecinos saben que ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan, al principio tuvo muchos problemas y dificultades, pero con el pasar del tiempo entendió mejor el sistema de trabajo de este negocio y ahora trabaja muy bien y tranquila. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este será el tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Esta comprometida con el grupo que conforman los integrantes del banco comunal al que pertenece, además está convencida que será una buena cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos para su bodega además de implementarse con la venta de bebidas y chupetes.
texts.en:
Rayda, age 54, is a very kind and simple woman.  She lives in her own house with her two children and her grandchildren.  Some months ago she separated from her husband, with whom she had been married for a long time.  However, she is a strong and tenacious woman who is prepared to work very hard so that she will be able to live peacefully in her old age.

Rayda sells products in her small but well-established grocery store in her house.  She spends 16 hours a day in her store.  She opens at six every morning and works all day long until approximately ten at night.  Her store is one of the busiest in the neighborhood because her neighbors know that they will always find what they need there.

In the beginning she had a lot of problems and difficulties, but now she is happy and works very well.  What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood.  She has been in this business for one year.  She feels that the most difficult part is having to stay inside her store all day without being able to go outside.  In time she hopes that her business grows and that she is able to obtain better income.

This will be her third loan the MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She is committed to the members of her communal bank.  Also, she is convinced that she will be a good client who is punctual and responsible with her payments.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy products for her grocery store.  She will also start selling drinks and lollipops.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jose Narciso

texts.es: El señor Jose Narciso es un padre de 3 hijos y viudo desde hace un tiempo. Se dedica a la venta de pescado en su barrio en la ciudad de Medellín. Jose Narciso compra los pescados en diferentes expendios y los transporta en su carro para venderlos en su barrio. Lastimosamente el señor Jose Narciso no cuenta con una nevera portátil o algún recipiente donde pueda refrigerar los pescados, por lo que solo puede vender en las horas de la mañana para que no se le dañe el producto con los calores de la tarde; además de esto, su vehículo se encuentra en muy mal estado, por lo que se alarga su tiempo de transporte. Jose Narciso sueña con terminar de pagar la educación de dos de sus tres hijos y con comenzar a pagar la de su hija menor, por eso quiere que su negocio crezca y para eso requiere de la compra de más pescados para la venta, unas neveras para poderlos refrigerar y hacerle los arreglos necesarios a su vehículo para poder transportar su producto y venderlo con mayor calidad.
texts.en: Jose Narciso is the father of three children and has been widowed for some time.  His business is selling fish in his neighborhood, in the city of Medellín. Jose Narciso buys his fish in different locations and transports them in his vehicle to sell in his neighborhood. Unfortunately, Jose Narciso does not have a portable ice box or any container in which to keep his fish cool.  This means that he can only make his sales in the morning as his products would become damaged in the afternoon heat.  In addition, his vehicle is in a very bad state of repair, which lengthens the amount time it takes him to transport his products.  Jose Narciso dreams of finishing paying for two of his three children's education and starting to pay for that of his youngest daughter.  For this reason, he would like his business to grow.  In order to achieve this, he needs to buy more fish to sell, some ice boxes so that he can keep them cool, and to make some necessary repairs to his vehicle so that he can transport his products and sell them in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell, ice boxes to keep them cool, and to make some repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
A sus 55 años Beatriz Elena se ha visto obligada en cubrir las obligaciones de su hogar desde que su esposo sufrió un accidente. Además de esto tiene 2 hijos a los cuales les debe brindar todo lo necesario, y por los que trabaja más fuerte cada día. Es por esto que Beatriz Elena, como ya conocía la actividad de la confección, decidió iniciar con su propio negocio y trabajar confeccionando por contrato a terceros y poco a poco sacar su línea propia. Gracias a esta actividad, y a esta decisión de emprendimiento, Beatriz Elena ha podido sufragar los gastos del hogar, y sus hijos no han tenido que ver afectada su calidad de vida fuertemente. Ahora, Beatriz Elena aspira a que su negocio pueda expandirse, tener más contratos de confección a terceros y así con las utilidades ir expandiendo también la confección de su línea propia. Es por esto que Beatriz Elena esta en busca de un préstamo que le permita realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio, donde su sitio de trabajo quede mas grande, y también comprar materia prima para la confección de unos contratos que hizo con uno de sus clientes.
Beatriz Elena aspira que con la expansión de su negocio mejoren sus ingresos y pueda de esta manera cumplir su sueño de tener una línea propia confeccionada por ella y que este posicionada en el mercado. De esta manera, sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida con una estabilidad económica que les permita acceder a la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
At 55 years of age, Beatriz Elena has been obligated to cover the household duties since her husband suffered an accident. Besides this she has two children to whom she gives everything necessary, and because of this she works harder each day. And this is why Beatriz Elena, as she already knew the clothing industry, decided to open her own business, manufacturing through contract to third parties and little by little to make her own line.

Thanks to this activity, and the decision of entrepreneurship, Beatriz Elena has been able to meet the household expenses and her children have not had to see their quality of life affected very much.

Now Beatriz Elena hopes that she can expand her business, to have more dressmaking contracts with third parties, and with the profits go on expanding the manufacturing of her own line of clothing. This is why Beatriz Elena is looking for a loan that will permit her to improve her facility, making her worksite larger, and also to buy raw materials in order to complete some of the contracts that she has made with one of her clients.

Beatriz Elena hopes that with the expansion of her business, her profits increase and in this way fulfill her dream of having her own line of ready-to-wear clothing positioned in the market. In this way, her children will have a better quality of life with economic stability that permits them to afford the best education possible.

loans.use: to improve the facility, expanding her worksite, and to buy raw materials in order to carry through with a contract that she has with a client

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 73 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 28,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her seventh loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds plus pay for labor.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to improve her standard of living.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds plus pay for labor.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Mr. A. Komlan was born in Tsévié in 1968. He is married and the father of five children, and also takes care of two of his sister’s children. He trades various food products in the Gapé market to support himself and his family. Beginning with his own capital, he subsequently received two loans of $300 and $550, which he successfully repaid. Despite these loans, he still isn’t meeting market demand.

Today is asking for a $950 loan which will allow him to augment his supply which will increase his activities and thus create greater income for his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komlan est né à Tsévié en 1968. Il est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa sœur. Il exerce comme activité le commerce des produits divers d’alimentation générale au marché de Gapé. Débutant avec ses moyens, il a eu par la suite 2 crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 qui ont été soldés sans difficulté. Malgré ces crédits, il n’arrive pas à répondre aux exigences du marché.

Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $950 va servir à l’approvisionnement en produits divers afin d’augmenter ses activités et de facto ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: stocking a variety of products

loans.name: Melbin Homar

texts.en:
My name is Melvin Homar, I work primarily as a merchant and I have a store from which I sell plastics items and various other items. I have several years experience in my business, which creates enough earnings to cover family expenses and other obligations I have with my suppliers. The location of my store is strategic because many people circulate in the area but because of a lack of capital, I am unable to stock my business to offer a wider variety of products to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Melvin Homar, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de plasticos y achineraia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con proveedores, la ubicación de mi negocio es estrategica ya que a diario circula muchas personas y por falta de capital no me es posible surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a los clientes.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, bathroom sandals, women's shoes, various plastic products and popular Medinas

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is 48 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her two children.  She makes and sells Khmer noodles and earns $2.50/day in profit.  Her two children work at the garment factory to help support the family.  The loan will be used for her and her husband to purchase pigs that they will raise and eventually sell at the market.  Meas would also like to purchase a motorbike so that she can bring her items to the market easily.  In the future, she would like to repair her house if possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a motorbike to transport animals and noodles to the market

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 20-year-old, hardworking young man. He is not married and lives with his parents. Three years ago, he graduated from school and started to work in a collective farm. Usually collective farmers are not paid enough in cash to live on, so the collective farm allocates sites with apricot trees to its workers. The crop from these trees is processed, dried, and by selling the dried apricots, people can make cash. Besides the apricots from the site allocated to him, Shukhrat buys apricots from his neighbors. This brings additional profit for his micro-business.

Having learned about MicroInvest, Shukhrat became a client and received a loan to buy an apricot orchard. At the moment, the season for drying apricots is in full swing, so Shukhrat is requesting a second loan to buy more apricots. In the picture, you can see Shukrat’s family harvesting apricots.

loans.use: buying apricots to dry and resell

loans.name: Vigina

texts.en: Vigina is an experience business woman. She has been in the business of selling women's and babies wear for over 5 years. She is from Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria, and is excited to increase her business if she is given a loan of US$800. She is 45 years old, a mother of 5 children, and she has been with LAPO for the past 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more women's and babies' wear

loans.name: Lucy Marlene

texts.es:
Lucy has been able to dedicate herself to agriculture with much enthusiasm, thanks to the help of her mother, who from when she was small taught her the occupational hazards and how to sell products commercially, motivated by which she offers her products in the town of Chancamayo with thoughts of now transporting them to Lima. With this aim she leaves her mother caring for the products and her lands, who very obligingly agreed to assume the care while her daughter sought buyers.

Despite having the help of her mother, Lucy saw the need to widen their zone of production and buy further land to cultivate, but she also couldn’t give her mother so much responsibility. In consequence of this situation, she has thought of improving her products in order to acquire a further field which she would be able to personally cultivate when the business is consolidated. With your collaboration Lucy will be able to continue living as she is today, very happily and with much hope of forging a promising future.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
