Lucy a podido dedicarse a la agricultura con mucho esfuerzo gracias al apoyo de su madre que desde pequeña le enseñó los gajes del oficio y de cómo comercializarlos, motivo por el cual ella oferta sus productos en la ciudad de Chanchamayo con miras ahora de transportarlos a la ciudad de Lima. Con este fin deja a su madre al cuidado de sus productos y de sus terrenos, quién muy complacientemente accedió a asumir el cuidado, mientras que ella busca compradores.

A pesar de tener un apoyo en su madre, ella vió la necesidad de ampliar la zona de producción y comprarse un terreno de cultivo más, pero tampoco puede cargar de mucha responsabilidad a su madre. Ha consecuencia de esta situación tiene pensado mejorar sus productos para adquirir un terreno más a fin de encargarse personalmente del cuidado cuando este negocio se consolide.Con tu colaboración Lucy podrá seguir viviendo como hasta hoy, muy contenta y con muchas esperanzas de forjarse un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Pruchase of another area of land with the aim of consolidating business

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Juana is 51 years old, finished junior high school, and has two children who are not dependents any more. She lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo Province, in the La Libertad Department. She works in the manufacturing of handmaD. artisanal shoes, and offers them to customers in different areas . She learned to do this from her husband, who worked at a factory.

Mrs. Maria Juana is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Valerosas" (courageous women). From her communal bank, she obtained her first loan of S/.300 (approximately US$100), with which she bought shoe soles, shoe forms, and leather.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for S./1,000 (approximately US $335), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy leather, adhesives, and soles to make the shoes she will sell in these new year celebrations and in the summer season. Her biggest dream is to have a large factory that has the necessary machinery and technology.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Juana tiene 51 años D. edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Vive en el Distrito D. La Esperanza D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal D. calzado, aprendió a hacerlo D. su esposo quien trabajó en una fábrica; reparte el calzado a clientes D. diferentes zonas.

La señora María Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas” , en su banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con los cuales compró suelas, hormas y cuero.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,000 (aproximadamente $335) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará cuero, pegamentos y suelas para confeccionar calzado que venderá en estas fiestas D. fin D. año y en le temporada D. verano. Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica granD. que cuente con la maquinaria y tecnología necesaria.

loans.use: Buying leather and other materials for manufacturing (Compra de cuero y otros materiales para confección.)

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. R. Savoeun, 36, and her husband, Mr. Sum Sorn, 43, have been married since 1988. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. All of her children are studying in a local school. Three of them have their own looms and weave at home when they have free time from their study. They learned their weaving skills from their mother. Savoeun started her silk production in 1989. She has four looms including her children’s looms for running her business. Besides silk production, she raises pigs as well. Her husband is a house constructor. Savoeun and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet O. owns and operates a small clothing store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She is 50 years old and is a single businesswoman who has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. Melahet has been working with this business for the last 10 years and is currently seeking $1,400 of funding ($1,200 to come from Kiva, and the remaining $200 to come from Norwegian Microcredit) so that she can purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the spring and summer

loans.name: Namayemba East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rofina O.. She is currently in the business of buying and selling produce and is requesting a loan to add capital. Rofina is 42 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Rofina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Rofina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rofina is joined in her small group by Demintiria E., Yunusu N., Fatina T., and Joan K.. Demintiria E. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge. Yunusu N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to add more business. Fatina T. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more raw food. Joan K. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock.

loans.use: To purchase and sell produce in large quantities

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura H. lives in the region of Shahrinav. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma and a professional specialization. She is a cook. Mastura works at the "Dekhon" market in her region. She has a small cafe where she works as a cook. This job brings profits that give her an opportunity to provide for the family.

Now Mastura would like to expand her business. She needs to rent a new location and to buy flour wholesale. This will help her improve the quality of service and to keep prices low, because flour prices keep rising. In order to reach her goal Mastura needs a $875 loan. She will be able to repay it within 9 months. Despite her age, Mastura is a very active and cheerful woman. Her clients love her and are always happy to visit her cafe.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Холмирзоева Мастура проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 58 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Имеет средне – профессиональное образование. По профессии повар. Работает на рынке «Дехкон» в своем районе. Имеет небольшую столовую, где работает поваром . Работа приносит доход , который дает возможность обеспечивать семью.

Сейчас Мастура Хочет увеличить свой бизнес . Ей необходимо взять в аренду новое помещение и закупить муку. Это поможет ей улучшить качество обслуживания и сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию, так как цены на муку растут. Но для того , чтобы сделать это ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 875 долларов США. А погасить кредит она сможет в течение 9 месяцев. Не смотря на свой возраст, Мастура очень активная и веселая женщина. Поэтому клиенты любят ее и всегда будут рады посещать ее столовую.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rent a new cafe location

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana runs a business selling clothing in the city of Simferopol, Ukraine. She currently sells from two locations in different parts of the city. One location is well established and she is developing the other one. Svetlana is able to buy clothing at good prices from European distributors, which helps her make a better profit. Svetlana is married, and lives with her husband. One of her goals is to do some remodeling of their apartment.

Svetlana has requested a short-term loan to buy additional inventory for her business. This is her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We hope it is the beginning of a good partnership with her that will help her continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy new inventory

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.es:
Jorgelina C. leases her home in the San Pedro area of La Paz. She and her daughter are employed as cleaning staff in a hotel in the city. The place where Jorgelina lives has only one bedroom that serves multiples uses for both her and her daughter.

With a prior loan Jorgelina finished laying the foundation and bought construction materials for a kitchen. The loan she is applying for will be used to build the kitchen. This is the sixth time Jorgelina has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis we have conducted qualifies her for a loan.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jorgelina C. vive en anticretico en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija, la señora Jorgelina es empleada de limpieza de un hotel de nuestra ciudad. El lugar donde vive solo cuenta con una habitación que tiene funciones múltiples para ambas.

Con un anterior crédito la señora Jorgelina realizó la construcción de cimientos y la compra de materiales de construcción para una cocina. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una cocina. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Cost of building a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana is married and started her business when her husband, who is working in the United States, was unemployed for a period of time and he didn’t send her enough money. She began the business two years ago and decided to sell footwear. Up until now, the business has gone very well.

She is requesting a loan of $200, which she will repay over 4 months, in order to fill an order for the teachers at a school. With your support, Ana will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ana es casada, inició el negocio cuando su esposo tuvo una temporada muy mala, en la que no había trabajo y no le mandaba suficiente dinero, el se encuentra trabajando en Estados Unidos, entonces ella inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años su negocio, decidió vender calzado y hasta la fecha le va muy bien

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir un pedido para las maestras de una escuela, con tu apoyo Ana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Mrs. Dominga is 63 years old, finished high school, is married and has 7 children, two of which are girls, and has 3 granddaughters. They live in the Hyariquisana communtiy, Pilcuyo district, El Colloa Llave province, and Puno region. She is actually the secretary of the Lupkanas Communal Bank, which she decided to participate in due to lack of capital since her business was not doing well due to illness from being struck by lightning.

Initially she obtained a loan of $115, with which she purchased iron as springs, routers, electrodes, etc. to create of stakes, spikes, rings, and other items. With the loan of $350, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will continue investing in the purchase of raw iron, 1/8 electrodes, springs, and car parts, to make spikes, hatchets, stakes, and other tools. This activity allows her to stay close to her children and her husband.

She is very happy, because she has recuperated and her business is improving little by little, as well as her income, since she spends every Sunday selling her items at the Llave Fair. Her stand is located in Jiron Sucre, near the Santa Barbara Plaza. Her dream is to have more capital so she can make more agricultural tools, and that her grandchildren get an education.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dominga tiene 63 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, es casada, madre D. siete hijos a su lado están dos hijas y 03 nietas, viven en la comunidad D. Huariquisana, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao Ilave y Región D. Puno. Es actual secretaria del Banco Comunal Lupakas, decidió pertenecer por falta D. capital, ya que en ese entonces fracaso, por lo que estaba enferma por la caída D. rayo o relámpago. Inicialmente obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles. Con ello compró fieros como muelles rutas, electrodo, etc. para elaboración D. estacas, picos, argollas, entre otros. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, seguirá invirtiendo en la compra D. fieros D. media, 1/8, electrodo, muelles rotos D. carro para elaboración D. picos, hachas, estacas, entres otros, esta actividad lo realizan D. manera conjunta con sus hijas y su esposo. Ella se encuentra muy feliz, por que recuperó y su negocio está mejorando poco a poco sus ingresos también, ya que sale a vender todos los domingos en la feria D. Ilave, su puesto se ubica en jirón Sucre s/n cerca D. la plaza Santa Bárbara. Su sueño es incrementar más su capital para elaborar más herramientas agropecuarias y que sus nietas estudien.

loans.use: Purchase of Iron

loans.name: Marileth

texts.es:
MARILETH, socia D. Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA II”  natural D. departamento y provincia de San Martín,  distrito de Juan Guerra. Se dedica a la venta y el alquiler de CD Y DVD de distintas variedades como películas y músicas, también vende fajas para bajar de peso, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360.

Se inició como ambulante en las ferias, ahora atiende donde vive. Tiene como clientes a todo tipo de personas, sobre todo a los niños que recurren buscando sus dibujos animados y a sus amigas que buscan mejorar su figura, quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará CD Y DVD de distinta música, películas y dibujos animados, también piensa invertir en fajas para bajar de peso y en algunos pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, para que ellos estén satisfechos y encuentren lo que deseen.

Marileth, tiene 19 años y 1 hija. Está contenta con lo que hace, es muy perseverante, independiente, con ganas de seguir adelante. Uno de sus objetivos es el tener que implementar más el negocio con pelotas, peluches y artículos de regalo, pero en un local fijo y estratégico.
texts.en:
Marileth, member of the Group "Mientras Tanto Luz y Esperanza II" (As Long as There's Light and Hope II), is a native of the department and province of San Martin, district of Juan Guerra. She sells and rents CDs and DVDs of different types of movies of music. She also sells weight loss girdles and her business is located in her own home at Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360. She started as a traveling saleswoman in the markets and now does business out of her home. She has many different types of clients that she attends to with great kidness, from children looking for their favorite cartoons to her friends looking to improve their figures. With this loan for $350, which she'll repay in 6 months, she'll buy CDs and DVDs of varying music styles, movies and cartoons, as well as more weight loss girdles. This will fulfill client requests and ensure that they are satisfied and can find what they desire. Marileth is 19 years old and has a daughter. She is happy with her livelihood and is very persistent and independent with desires to get ahead. One of her goals is to expand her business with toys, stuffed animals, and gift items into a permanent and strategic location.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om P. is a 51-year-old weaver of silk dresses and she also operates a recycling business. With the two businesses she is able to make around US$2 each day and she has been doing so since 2002. She says that mostly she spends time at home weaving because it requires less labor than recycling. She learned how to weave from her mother and began weaving before she was married. She makes the kind of dress that people wear during Khmer New Year or the P'chum Ben ceremony. It is expensive and takes 7-10 days to complete each dress.

Om P.'s husband, Mao Nuon, 70, is a rice farmer and makes around US$2.50 each day. He grows two times each year, as do most of Cambodia's farmers. In the dry season, it takes around 3-4 months of work to get to harvest and 6-7 months in the rainy season. Rice that grows in the rainy season is much more expensive than that of the dry season, and people prefer the rice of the rainy season. Mao Nuon says that the farmer's life is difficult, working very hard for little profit and sometimes facing crop damage because of drought.

Om P. is requesting a loan of US$700 to raise pigs and to increase her recycling business.

loans.use: To raise pigs and increase a recycling business

loans.name: Munafan Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed M. M. and Mohamed K.. They named their group Munafan. Their previous loans with Kiva through SMT were a great help to these entrepreneurs. Those loans enabled them to expand their businesses. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Mohamed is the leader of this group. He was born in Farandugu village, about 15 miles from Kabala. He is 37 years of age. Mohamed is married with 4 children. His wife does some petty-trading. Mohamed has been in business for over 8 years now. He sells a number of assorted goods in his shop located at his village of Farandugu. The items he sells include cigarettes, batteries, mints, toothpastes and tooth brushes, soaps and a lot more.

Mohamed often makes a lot of sales in his village.  However, these days, sales are a bit difficult because of the current rainy season. The rainy season is coming to an end in October, so he expects to good sales to come again soon. Thus, the loan comes at the right time for Mohamed. With improved sales, he will make more profit.  Furthermore, with increased profit, Mohamed can meet the priorities of educating his children and improving the overall living condition of his family.

loans.use: Buy more packs of cigarettes, batteries, mints and other goods to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Tadogbe was born in 1961. He is married and is the father of two children, Philomène and Hubert, both in school. He buys bags of corn at the Houegbo Market to resell them in his neighborhood of Avotrou. To grow his capacity, he would like a loan to purchase more bags of corn.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Monsieur TADOGBE Joseph est né en 1961 à so- ava, marié et père de deux enfants, philomène et hubert tous deux scolarisés, il achete des sacs de mais au marché HOUEGBO pour les revendre à son domicile à avotrou.Pour accroitre sa capacité de stockage et couvrir toutes les demandes de sa clientèles il a sollicité notre concours.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre Santa Lucia se conformó en fecha 17 de noviembre de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Librada A. se contactó con la asesora para conocer mas acerca del programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma una vez enterada de como funciona el dicho programa comentó con sus vecinas y amigas, y así logró junta a 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy contentas con el programa.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 300.000, lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carnes, venta de golosinas, venta de canastos, venta de ropas, venta de gallinas y huevos, venta de mandioca, venta de comestibles, venta de carbón, etc.

El detalle exacto de actividades que realiza cada integrante es como sigue:
1	Librada A.	Venta de carnes
2	Mariana G.	Despensa 
3	Justina O.	Venta de mercaderías 
4	Juana González	Venta de gallinas
5	Aurora R.	Venta de canasto
6	Hilda C.	Venta de golosinas
7	Sabina R.	Venta de frutas y verduras
8	Nilsa A.	Venta de canasto
9	Justina C.	Venta de carbón
10	Rosa R.	Venta de mandioca
11	Altagracia Jiménez	Trabajo en cestería.
12	Antonia N.	Venta de gallinas, frutas y verduras.
13	Cinthia González	Venta de canasto, frutas y verduras
14	María T.	Venta de gallinas y huevos.
15	Juana S.	Venta de ropas y comestibles

Todas las integrantes del comité asisten a las reuniones semanales y se encuentran muy a gusto trabajando en equipo con la Fundación Paraguaya.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de carnes, compra de mercaderías para le despensa arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc. compra de gallinas, compra de materia prima para la elaboración de canastos, compra de frutas y verduras, compra de huevos, compra de golosinas, compra de carbón, compra de mandioca, compra de ropas, compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas, etc.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Committee was founded on November 17, 2008, thanks to Señora Librada A., who is currently the group's president. Señora Librada got in touch with one of Fundación Paraguaya's loan officers to find out more about the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women Program. Once she learned more about the program, she talked it over with her friends and neighbors, and was able to find 15 women, who today are working hard and are very happy with the program.

The average loan taken out by each member is 300,000 Paraguayan Guaranís, which will be used for a variety of business activities like fruit and vegetable sales, meat sales, candy sales, basket sales, clothing sales, chicken and egg sales, cassava sales, food sales, charcoal sales, etc.

Here is a list of each group member and their respective businesses:

1 Librada A., Meat sales
2 Mariana G., Grocery store
3 Justina O., Merchandise sales
4 Juana González, Chicken sales
5 Aurora R., Basket sales
6 Hilda C., Candy sales
7 Sabina R., Fruit and vegetable sales
8 Nilsa A., Basket sales
9 Justina C., Charcoal sales
10 Rosa R., Cassava sales
11 Altagracia Jiménez, Basket weaving
12 Antonia N., Sales of chickens, fruits and vegetables
13 Cinthia González, Sales of baskets, fruits and vegetables
14 María T., Chicken and egg sales
15 Juana S., Food and clothing sales

Each group member attends weekly meetings, and enjoys working as a team with Fundación Paraguaya.

The group members will use their loans to buy: meat, merchandise for grocery stores (sugar, rice, yerba mate, dairy products, bread, drinks), chickens, raw materials for basket-weaving, eggs, fruits and vegetables, sweets, charcoal, cassava, clothing, and ingredients to prepare meals with.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, merchandise for grocery stores, chickens, raw materials for basket-weaving, eggs, fruits and vegetables, sweets, charcoal, cassava, clothing, and ingredients to prepare meals with.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah T. is thirty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in the junior high school. His wife is a trader. She sells smoked fish and bread in the local market. 

He lives with his family in Somanya in the eastern region of Ghana. The town is dominated by the Krobos, one of the many tribes in Ghana. However, there are quite a number of other tribes that have migrated there due to occupation. 

Noah spray-paints damaged cars that have been welded and straightened. He has a workshop in the community in which he lives. Noah wants a loan to acquire the paint he uses to spray. According to him, there are many types of the paint with varying degrees of quality. He has been in business for fifteen years. Noah says he wants to procure the paint and other materials he works with in bulk, so he can sell some of it to colleagues and workers in his community who also use these materials in their work.

loans.use: To buy car paint

loans.name: Sabina Aydee

texts.es: LA SRA SABINA TIENE 22 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA PERO VIVE EN CONCUBINATO, TIENE DOS HIJAS DE 4 Y 2 MESES DE EDAD; LA VIVIENDA EN LA QUE HABITA ACTUALMENTE  ES PROPIA. CUENTA CON UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA PARADA DE TRUFIS Y VEHICULOS QUE VAN AL CHACO, TIENE PENSIONADOS, ADEMÁS PREPARA Y VENDE EMPANADAS Y COSTILLITAS EN SU DOMICILIO LOS DÍAS DOMINGOS. SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD HACE MUCHO TIEMPO ATRAS, ANTES LO REALIZABA JUNTO A SU MADRE,PERO DESPUES SE COMPRÓ SU PROPIO PUESTO. CABE RECALCAR QUE EL NEGOCIO ESTÁ EN UNA BUENA UBICACIÓN, YA QUE EXISTE MUCHA AFLUENCIA DE PERSONAS, SOBRE TODO VIAJEROS. EL GRADO DE COMPETENCIA ES ALTO, YA QUE EXISTEN VARIOS PUESTOS SIMILARES ALREDEDOR, PERO AÚN ASÍ CUENTA CON MUCHOS CLIENTES. ESTE ES EL TERCER CRÉDITO AL QUE ACCEDE LA CLIENTE, MUESTRA UN COMPORTAMIENTO RELATIVAMENTE BUENO, YA QUE SI PRESENTÓ ATRASOS EN EL PAGO DE ALGUNAS DE SUS CUOTAS, SE DEBIÓ A LOS PROBLEMAS EXISTENTES EN EL DEPARTAMENTO, COMO PAROS CÍVICOS Y LA ESCAZES DE CARBURANTES, GAS LICUADO DE PETRÓLEO MÁS PROPIAMENTE, QUE IMPIDIERON EL NORMAL DESEMPEÑO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES, ADEMÁS DE QUE ESTABA EMBARAZADA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is 22 years old, single, lives with a partner, and she has two daughter ages 4 years and 2 months. She lives in her own home. She has a food stand at the transportation stop for buses and vehicles that are going to the countryside; she has renters, in addition she prepares turnovers and short ribs in her home on Sundays. She has been doing this work for quite some time, she used to work with her mother, but after some time she bought her own stand. She stresses that her stand is in a good location, as there is a great flow of people, above all travelers. The competition is high, as there are many similar stands in the area, but even so she has many customers. This is her 3rd loan, she has demonstrated relatively good payment history, as she was behind in some of her payments which she attributed to the problems in the state such as civic work stoppages and the shortages of fuel, propane, which impeded her normal activities; and in addition to these challenges she was pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchase supplies

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Bahri, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and to improve her situation. Bahri is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 38 years old, married, and the loving mother of four children. Bahri started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough to cover their family’s expenses. For more than 10 years, she has operated a store where she sells children’s clothing. Her store is well-known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Bahri hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan in the amount of $1000 that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. She promises to repay the loan in time and thanks everyone for supporting her.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng K. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Moeun Vichet, is an ice cream seller.  Although they try to work hard, they still do not make enough to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mrs. Cheng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy cement and other supplies to build the house. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and other supplies for her house.

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.en:
Anastasiya M. is 26. She is married with two children. Anastasiya is selling makeup and cosmetics. She has been in the business for two years already. Anastasiya is dreaming of expanding her business and opening her own store.  She wants to establish contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Anastasiya and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating of their kids so that they become highly sought-after experts in the future. 

Now Anastasiya requests US $900 in order to purchase new make-up, such as lipsticks, mascaras, powder, skin cream, etc. with the aim of increasing the range of goods she sells. Anastasiya would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Nadya Group

texts.en:
Nadya is the group leader of Nadya group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for their business.
Nadya and Gull Soum want to take a loan for their business of tailoring, so that they can expand and progress their business. Also, Nabylah wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. Finally Shazya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business which is a car part shop. They all want to increase and expand their businesses.      
They are very happy with this process of gaining a loan in Afghanistan. It is a great help to poor people in Afghanistan and they are thankful that they can all be leaders in this process.

loans.use: to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in ChomKa SamRong Commune in Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Yin R., is 28 years old. She sells brooms that she buys in bulk from a broom-maker who lives near her house. She sells her products at retail in the local market and earns around $US3 per day. Her husband, Horm Vet, 33, is a motorbike taxi driver as well as a wooden house builder. Yin R. has given birth to two teenage children who are school age. Yin R. wants to earn extra income by taking a loan on Kiva in order to purchase more brooms to sell. The other two borrowers are:
L., a vegetable grower, who is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for growing crops, and 
R., who is applying for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase brooms to sell

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
T. Phạm Thị (121010737) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has three adult children. 

T. owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 9th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita T. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Volonte Plus Group

texts.fr:
Volonté est un groupe basé à Kisangani en République Démocratique du Congo constitué de 30 membres.  Un de ces membres est Joseph B..

Joseph est infirmier de formation et gère sa propre pharmacie depuis 2007. Il exerce son activité commerciale à l’est de Kisangani, une ville qui a été détruite par des affrontements meurtriers des armées étrangères en l’an 2000. Kisangani se situe au nord-est de la République Démocratique du Congo dans la Province Orientale qui fait frontière avec l’Ouganda et le Soudan. Joseph a commencé son activité entant qu’infirmier ambulant qui soignait des malades dans son milieu. Soucieux de desservir la population son quartier en médicaments, il décide en 2007 avec l’appui financier de Hope Kisangani à travers des crédits, d’ouvrir une pharmacie qui lui génère aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $350 par mois. Pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un Centre de Santé, Joseph a décidé en 2007 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope Kisangani dénommé « Volonté Plus  Kis ». Il y est vice-président. Ce groupe « Volonté Plus  Kis », est le premier groupe de Hope Kisangani à bénéficier des prêts de Kiva. Le prochain prêt que Joseph recevra lui servira d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques qui renforceront le stock de sa pharmacie en vue d’accroitre le revenu.  Il est âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 6 et 21 ans. Deux d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Volonté is a group based in Kisangani in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The group is comprised of 30 members. One of those members is Joseph B.. Joseph is trained to be a nurse and has owned his own pharmacy since 2007. He does his business east of Kisangani, a city that was destroyed by deadly clashes of foreign armies in the year 2000. Kisangani is located in the north-east of the Democratic Republic of Congo, in the Province Oriental which borders with Uganda and the Sudan. Joseph started his business as an independent nurse who treated patients from his home. Concerned with serving his neighborhood’s community’s needs for medicines, in 2007 he decided to open a pharmacy with the financial support of loans from Hope Kisangani. Today that pharmacy generates a profit of $350 per month for him. In order to realize his dream of one day opening a Health Clinc, in 2007 Joseph decided to join one of Hope Kisangani’s group – the group is called “Volonté Plus Kis”. He is the vice president of the group. The group “Volonté Plus Kis” is the first of Hope Kisangani’s groups to receive loans from Kiva. Joseph will use the next loan that he receives to buy the pharmaceutical products that will increase his pharmacy’s stock and therefore grow his revenue. He is 41 years old, married and the father of 5 children; the children’s ages range from 6 to 21 years. Two of the children are attending school.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Top buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ELENA P. R., tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria  , tiene 5 hijos de los cuales el menor depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando.
MARIA  se dedica a  la preparación de menús para sus pensionistas.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de insumos alimenticios para la preparación de sus menús.
Este crédito de 600 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de productos alimenticios para preparar sus menús y también de utensilios de cocina y vajilla.
MARIA sueña con tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria Elena P. R. is 52 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Peru.

She is a member of the Community Bank "Semillitas Creativas".

She has a grade 11 education, and she has 5 children, the youngest of whom is still dependent on her because he is going to school.

Maria makes foods for retirees.

The first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare her foods.

This loan of 600 nuevos soles will invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare her foods and to purchase kitchen tools, utensils, and plates.

Maria dreams of having her own restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients as well as kitchen utensils and plates.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
“Work hard in order to survive” a word of encouragement of Melinda P. who is a loving housewife of Floramante P.. They live in a rural community of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with six children, three of them are now in college while the others are in secondary and elementary education.
	In this regard, they are striving hard to earn an income to support the education of their children. Farming is the primary source of their income; they plant rice and vegetables for two cropping. Furthermore, Melinda is engage in selling snacks in their barangay to earn additional income. When she discovered that it is beneficial to them, she aims to continue and improve this business. Since she has small capital, she joined in one of the Microfinance organization and applied a loan amounting to P 5,000 to be used in the improvement of her business. She hopes that she can able to improve her business through the help of the Microfinance Organization.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is a 29-year-old married mother of two school-going children. She is the proprietor of a secondhand clothing business which she started in 2006. She buys her stock from a large market. Florence requires Kshs 20,000 to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: Additional stock

loans.name: Rosa Maribelt

texts.es: Rosa Maribelt S. Ríos tiene la edad de 42 años. Tiene 1 hijos que todavía no asiste a un colegio ya que está muy pequeño. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Rosa tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones, camisas y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos en una comarca llamada el congo, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior y trajes. Su deseo es establecer su propia tienda
texts.en:
Rosa Maribelt S. Ríos is 42 years old. She has a child who is still too young to attend school. Rosa has been selling used clothing for more than 6 years. She is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to her family, which is why she always enjoys working hard.

Based on her recollection, Rosa began selling pants, shirts, and undergarments and offered her products in a region of Nicaragua known as “El Congo”. This was the start of her business. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, undergarments, and suits. She hopes to open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité la vente des produits cosmétiques, il exerce ce commerce de façon ambulante. Pour pouvoir gagner plus de profits sur ses ventes, il s’approvisionne à Accra cela lui permet de gagner plus de profits sur ses ventes. Sa clientèle grandit de plus en plus vite, pour pouvoir tous les satisfaire et convenablement, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Etant célibataire, ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This gentleman sells cosmetic products as a street vendor. By purchasing his supplies in Accra, Ghana, he is able to earn a higher profit on his sales. His clientele is increasing more and more quickly and in order to meet their demand, he is requestng a loan from WAGES to purchase more cosmetic products. He is a single gentleman and this business allows him to support himself.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”. El nombre es original del idioma Quechua que traducido al español significa "Caminemos juntos". Ellos viven en el distrito de “San Santiago” en la provincia del Cusco. El banco esta conformado por 11 socias y la mayoría de ellas tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades de trabajo similares. La reunión de las socias se hace en la casa de la socia Lourdes. 

Nuestros socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Un gran parte se dedica a la venta de pasto (comida para animales de corral), comida y víveres. El socio Jaime tiene un carro que hace el servicio de transportes en la ciudad. Una de las socias de este banco se dedican a la venta de pasto (comida para animales de corral), otras socias tienen tiendas de abarrotes donde venden arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Una de las socias tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida, ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena.     

Las socias solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our clients belong to the communal bank “SUMAC PURIRISUN.” The name is originally from Quechua, and means “Let's walk together.” They live in the “San Santiago” district in Cusco province. The bank is made up of 11 members and the majority of them have their own independent, but similar, businesses. The group meetings are held in the home of the borrower Lourdes. These members balance their various household activities with the sale of food. A large portion of them sell grass (food for farmyard animals), food, and supplies. The member Jaime has a car that he uses to provide transportation services in the city. One of the members of this bank sells grass (food for farmyard animals), others own general stores where they sell rice, sugar, oil, etc. One of the members of the bank has a small booth where she sells food, offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The members are soliciting this loan for working capital so that they can offer more products and increase their sales, in order to better the quality of life of their families. All the members appreciate and are thankful for the loan they are receiving through this system, and thus have themselves promised to make all their payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital to develop the sale of supplies.

loans.name: Mario Octavio

texts.es: Don Mario, tiene 30 años y se encuentra casado con doña Saraitt, tienen dos hijos, que aun estan en edad escolar, viven en la casa de su mamá. La actividad principal de don Mario es la de transportista de carga con su camioneta, tiene una segunda actividad que es la de tienda de barrio, que es atendida por su esposa; precisamente para esa actividad es lo que requiere el credito, surtira la tienda con bebidas y alimentos, que son requeridos para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mario, age 30, is married to Saraitt and they have two children who are still of school age and live at home. Mario’s main occupation is carrying cargo with his truck; as a sideline, he has a neighborhood store, which his wife manages. The loan is to stock the store with food and beverages to cater for demand in the New Year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ya Umu

texts.en:
Ya Umu S. is 42 years old  and is married to a community religious leader who is based in Makeni town. She has seven children:  All are  attending school. Ya Umu sells used clothes and bags in one of the popular markets in the town.  She rents a stall at the market.

Ya Umu has been in this business for more than 5 years. She is very hard-working. She is seeking this loan to purchase more bags.  Ya Umu's goal is to make enough money to keep her children in school.  She is determined that they all will be educated.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing and bags

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA. is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children.

NawA. has owned a store selling home product since 2007. She sells perfumes, beauty products, shampoos, soap and lots more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

NawA. is speciA. in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. She decided on doing her businesses to supplement her husband’s income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Karukara Group C, Kihihi

texts.en: Group leader Fred B. is 53 years old and married with 13 children out of which 11 are still in school at either the university, secondary, and primary school.  He also takes care of one sibling. Fred has been selling produce in Rukarara since 1999 and he is able to earn 350,000 UGX in monthly profits that help him take care of his family. Fred is such a hard working man and he is determined to ensure that he educates all his children well. He hopes also for the to have good health conditions. He needs a loan to help with buying more produce for resale so that his business can improve.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba D. âgée de 43 ans s’active depuis 10 ans dans la vente de céréales. Elle est mariée mère de 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 16 ans.  Elle vit avec eux et compte sur son commerce pour compléter les dépenses quotidiennes. Cependant, elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour le renforcement de son travail. Elle veut acheter avec ce financement  des céréales qu’elle entend commercialiser dans  Diourbel, une ville située à 150 Kms de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal.
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba D., aged 43, has been active for ten years in selling grains. She is married and the mother of four children; the eldest is 16 years old. She lives with them and counts on her business for meeting day-to-day expenses. However, she's requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to bolster her work. She wants to use this loan to buy some grain, which she intends to sell in Diourbel, a city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Porfirio Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio A. es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica a la crianza de ganado en el municipio El Sauce en León donde tiene su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.
Actualmente el señor Porfirio está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de ganado específicamente en la compra de novillos para sacarles el máximo provecho y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su amada familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
Porfirio A. is a hardworking gentleman who raises livestock in the town of El Sauce in León where he has his family, composed of his wife and children. Currently Porfirio is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of livestock. Specifically, he will purchase young bulls so that he can take full advantage of this opportunity, and in this way obtain income to support his beloved family who depends on him.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young bulls

loans.name: James Kipngetich

texts.en:
James K., who was born in 1943, is the husband of Kabon Ngetich who is a 65-year-old businesswoman. They have eight children between them aged between 21 and 35 years old.

James runs a retail shop in which he sells foodstuffs like sugar, rice, margarine, cooking fat, matches and other items. He earns a profit of Ksh 8,000 per month from this business. He also earns Ksh 6,000 from selling milk. His shop is in Kabarnet Town near the stage. This is a very busy place since his customers are not only travelers but also residents of Kabarnet Town.

James has never borrowed from any other source other than KADET. This is his fourth loan since he was introduced to KADET by a friend. If this loan boosts his business, he plans to expand his shop from retail to wholesale. He hopes and dreams of opening a supermarket in future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 46 years old and is married with seven children who are between 6 and 18 years old.

Gerard is a hardworking businessman known in the business of baking breads for sale. He has been in this business for about five years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Gerard has an idea of expanding his business meaningfully through purchasing a large quantity of flour so that he can increase the quantity of produced breads to the extent that he can even start wholesaling. To this end he is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that his sales as well as the profits can be increased.

The more Gerard’s business keeps growing, the more he will save for his future and continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of flour

loans.name: Tumurhuyag

texts.en:
Tumurhuyag is 53 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Altanchimeg, sells iron products at a local market. During the day, Tumurhuyag operates an electrical products and food retailing business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2000, and has steadily expanded it.

He purchases products every two months in Taikeshken, a Chinese border city, and resells them from a shipping container in his own province. Tumurhuyag has gained a great deal of experience in the previous ten years, and his sales are very good. Tumurhuyag is an industrious person who has a great business mind. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~ 2167 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Montha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Kimhai is a 31-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group loan and was selected by four members who are located in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. N. Kimhai is a grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Rith Thy, is a printing house laborer who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is two years old.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 28 años, convive con su actual pareja  y tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Juntos residen en una comunidad , ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa que es propia .Sonia trabaja junto a su esposo, que es su socio ,juntos desde hace un tiempo se dedican a la producción y comercialización , de cacao y  hoja de coca,por esta actividad tienen buenas ganancias económicas que les permiten tener una buena calidad de vida. No siempre gozaron de prosperidad económica, en el pasado pasaron hambre,porque no les alcanzaba el dinero, pero juntos supieron salir adelante . En la actualidad tienen clientes potenciales, y les va bien en la comercialización de sus productos naturales  , debido al sacrificio constante , tanto de ella como de su esposo . Se siente orgullosa y feliz por todo lo que ha pasado, es por esta razón que cada mañana se dirige a sus chacras , para cuidarlas , por lo general trabaja junto a su esposo, pero en tiempo de cosecha contrata a  peones para que le agilicen la extracción del cacao y la hoja de coca, de manera eficiente. Normalmente vende sus productos a los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Su plan a futuro es instalar  una tienda de ropa, ya que en su comunidad existen pocas tiendas de este rubro, y calcula que obtendría buenas ganancias económicas .Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además le gusta participar activamente en su banco comunal , por la responsabilidad que tienen todos los integrantes.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en brindarle  mantenimiento a su chacra, adquiriendo fertilizantes y abono para sus respectivas plantaciones de cacao y  hoja de coca.
texts.en:
Sonia, 28, lives with her domestic partner and two children of school age. Together they reside in a community located in the Cuzco rain forest, where they own their house. Sonia works with her husband, who is her partner. For some time they have engaged in the production and marketing of cocoa and coca leaf. This activity produces good income that allows them to have a good quality of life. They haven't always enjoyed economic prosperity. There were times when they went hungry because they did not have enough money, but working together they were able to get ahead. Currently they have potential customers, and they are doing well in the marketing of natural products, due to the constant sacrifice of both her and her husband. She is proud and happy for everything that has happened. It is for this reason that every morning she goes to her farm, to care for it, usually working with her husband. At harvest time she has to hire laborers to expedite the efficient picking of cocoa and coca leaf. Normally, she sells the products to collection centers in her community. Her future plan is to install a clothing store, since there are few stores of this type in her community, and she calculates that it should produce a good income. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to comply promptly with her payments. Sonia also likes to participate actively in her communal bank, because responsibility is shared by all members. She plans to invest the money requested in providing maintenance for her farm, buying fertilizer and manure for their respective plantings of cacao and coca leaf.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE AND FERTILIZER FOR HER FARM LAND

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling her neighbors cooked food  like chapati (flat bread), beans and rice for three years. She is a married woman with 3 boys and three girls, who attend school. With the KShs. 20,000, Rehema wants to purchase more wheat flour and cooking oil. She also plants food crops in her farm. 
	
Her greatest challenge is experiencing low sales. She owns a home which does not have water or electricity. She says school fees are her great expenses. She hopes to someday open a stall since she currently takes food to shop owners.

She joined Yehu so as to access loans and expand her business and eventually support her family more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda tiene 46 años por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, Es una mujer muy responsable ya que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y los mantiene ella ya que es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, por lo que más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como es el poco apoyo que tenia por lo que no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en todos los productos. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, café, jugos, pan, galletas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Maritza Bernarda is 46 years old. This isn’t the first time she has requested a loan. She is a very responsible woman who has 3 children in her care. She provides for them because she is a single mother. Her business is a small grocery store, which she has had for more than 16 years, despite the difficulties she has faced due to the fact that she didn’t have sufficient capital to purchase all of the products she needed. She is now requesting this loan for working capital so she can buy sweets, coffee, juices, bread, cookies, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth P. is in the business of selling maize flour in a store and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Ruth is 36 years-old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has four children and one child does not yet go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family to save them the rent they must pay.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007,  BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha M. is from the village of Rizalina, Rizal. She is 45 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Editha owns and operates a business planting assorted crops and selling her harvested crops in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Editha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned land. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned land

loans.name: Ezelle

texts.en: Ezelle C. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 23 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Ezelle owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Ezelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ezelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nort

texts.en: Nort S., 34, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1 (US) each day. Besides this business, her husband also operates a recycling business in the village. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nort S. included. She would like to take out a loan of $400 to reinvest in recycling business. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: Reinvest in recycling business.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 46 years old and married with four children. Therese makes a living by selling different styles of clothes. The business hours are from 8 am to 5 pm every day. She has been in this business for about 15 years. 

Therese needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Therese will hopefully increase her sales as well as profits. These profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future. In addition, she will start saving for a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito D. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. He is 45 years old. Joselito is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Joselito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Joselito has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joselito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joselito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Joselito is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Joselito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert S. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is not currently in school. Robert has had a retail business for four years.         

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a computer and a printer for photographs. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Robert hopes to buy a film-editing machine.

loans.use: To buy  a computer and a printer for photographs

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene la edad de 31 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 8 de edad que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere pagar las insumas necesarias para el café y para el pasto. Además quiere comprar abono y herbicidas para el mantenimiento de café y para los repastos de los porteros. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibida de FUDECOSUR y esta contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Su objetivo es mejorar la finca y tener mas ganancias pues están ambas muy pequeñas para producir.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 31-years-old.  He is married and has two children who are seven and eight-years-old.  They are his top priority.  He wants to be able to pay for the imputs needed for the coffee crop and pasture.  Additionally, he wants to buy fertilizer and herbicides for the maintenance of the coffee plants and for the pasture for the animals.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the help they have offered him.  His goal is to improve his farm and earn greater profits as now they are both very small.

loans.use: Farm assistance

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett Del Socorro tiene 45 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura. Inicio a este negocio hace 13 años, su Mama fue quien le enseño este negocio pues necesitaba un medio de vida que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella realiza prendas de muy buena calidad, es por eso que muy solicitada. Pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos en Fundación, ya que ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de hilo, tijeras, agujas y telas. Por lo que sueña con mantener este negocio activo.
texts.en:
Janett Del Socorro is 45 years old and has 2 small children. Her activity is to provide sewing services. She started this business 13 years ago.

Her mother taught her the business as she needed a means of sustenance to help cover the cost of her home. She is very much in demand as most customers know that she makes very good quality clothing.

This is not the first time she has requested funding from the Fundación, as it has provided much support to her business. The funding will be invested in the purchase of thread, scissors, needles and fabrics. Her dream is to continue with this business activity.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La   Sra. Graciela   es casada  tiene   2  hijos, los  dos  en edad escolar.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, en su domicilio, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como remeras, vestidos, blusas, shorts.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is married and has two school age children. She sells clothing from her home and is able to generate a good income. With the help of her husband, she and her family are able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication.

Today she is a successful businesswoman with many customers because she provides good service. Graciela is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing such as shirts, dresses, blouses, and shorts.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, dresses, blouses, and shorts

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Immaculate has a food retail shop, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Immaculate hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Immaculate hopes to own a wholesale shop.  Immaculate is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and food

loans.name: Juana Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Nelly; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía, la socia vende artesanía al por mayor y distribuye a diferentes tiendas de artesanía, la socia vende chompas, collares, chalinas y aretes, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juana Nelly belongs to the OLLANTAY II community bank located in the district of Cusco, Peru. She is 46 years old, single and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her crafts business, buying the items at wholesale and distributing them to different crafts shops, and also selling jackets, necklaces, scarves and earrings. Juana wants to expand her crafts business. She is requesting the loan to purchase crafts at wholesale. Juana is happy for the loan and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts at wholesale

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia A., age 37, is a farmer, planting and harvesting taro and offering it for sale. Telesia has two years of experience in this business. Telesia needs a loan of WST 1,000 in order to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business. She and her husband have six children between the ages of one and 15.

In 2010, Telesia joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Telesia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia vive en casa de sus padres  en la zona de  Senkata Pucarani II, de la ciudad de  El Alto, tiene dos hijas; la señora es portera y trabaja en la Unidad Educativa Pacajes, y  en el mismo colegio tiene un puesto de venta de dulces; los ingresos que obtiene de dichos trabajos mantienen a su familia.  Es el primer crédito que solicita de  IMPRO.
También el primer crédito con KIVA y el motivo del préstamo es que necesita comprar más dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Basilia lives in her parents' home in Senkata Pucarani II district of the city of El Alto.  She has two daughters.  Basilia is a caretaker and works in the Pacajes Education Center.  She runs a stall selling sweet treats in the same school.  She uses the income that she makes from these jobs to support her family.

This is Basilia's first loan from IMPRO and her first KIVA loan.  She is requesting this loan as she needs to buy more sweet treats to offer her customers and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: To buy more sweet treats for her stall

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is 34 years old, married and a father of two children aged 3 and 9 years old.  He is able to educate his children with the income he gets from selling bananas.  He hopes to open another business that can generate more income in the future.  Being a member of Twaweza group, he can easily get loans from Faulu Kenya. Therefore, he has requested 30, 000 KES to buy green bananas.

loans.use: To buy green bananas

loans.name: Mediadora

texts.en:
Mediadora A. is from the village of Imelda, in the municipality of Labason, in the province of Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Mediadora owns and operates a business venture making instant salabat (ginger tea). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from selling instant salabat in the local community. Mediadora has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mediadora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be Mediadora's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide working capital and purchase additional inventory
